title: South Bronx Man Is Slain In His Home by 10 Youths
description: A 36yearold South Bronx man was beaten and stabbed to death last night in his apartment at 1186 Washington Avenue, reportedly by a gang of 10 youths between 17 and 20 years of age, according to the police of the Morrisania Precinct.

title: Gimbel Brothers Shows a Net Loss For the 8 Months
description: Gimbel Brothers, Inc., which has been owned by the Brown & Williamson Tobacco Company since last November, reported yesterday a net loss of $186,000 for the eight months ended Sept. 30 against a profit of $1.5million in the corresponding 1972 period. Sales rose 1.5 per cent to $484.3million from $477million.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Hails Soviet Pact While Affirming Nonalignment
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 31Prime Minister Indira Gandhi declared here today that India's longterm economic agreement with the Soviet Union in no way impinged on her administration's policy of nonalignment.

title: HENRY R. PLATT JR.
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 31  Henry A. Platt Jr., a former vice president of the Continental Illinois National Bank and Trust Company, the TrauxTraer Coal Company and Walter E. Heller jg: Co., a financing company, died Saturday in Evanston (Ill)! Hospital. He was 76 years old.

title: ThreeDay Weeks Begin In Britain to Save Power
description: LONDON, Dec. 31The threeday work week arrived in Britain today, sharply reducing industrial output and cutting the wages of millions in the most drastic program yet undertaken by any nation to cope with the energy crisis.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Steele a Scripps Editor
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 31 (UPI)  Jack Steele has been appointed editor of the Washington bureau of the ScrippsHoward newspapers, the ScrippsHoward editorinchief, Earl H. Richert, said today.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: WALK IT OFF New Year's Day. It's a day that often does not start until noon, depending upon how late you were up with the coming and going of the years. It's a quiet day in New York; too much night before to absorb new adventures any more rigorous than perhaps the cocktail hour the evening after. But, weather permitting, a good day to get out and clear the respiratory system, recharging it with what passes for fresh air in our town. The New Year represents change, and change, for better or worse, is what New York is all about. No generation since the Dutch days has been able to look back and find the city the same place that it was born into. This day of change is a good day to stroll about taking note of some of the changes that came about in

title: Will Theory Kill Creativity? Chess. Watch This Thrilling Episode
description: Theoretical! A synonym for unoriginal! How can anyone who follows a book theory closely think of stronger and more original moves? thus Tchigorin railed against

title: William L. Day, Banker, Led U. of Pennsylvania Trustees
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Dec. 31 (AP)William L. Day, a banker who was chairman of the board of trustees of the University of Pennsylvania, died here today while on vacation. He was 66 years old and lived in Devon, Pa.

title: HALFFARE RIDES MAY BE EXTENDED
description: Dr. William J. Ronan, the chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, said last night that he would ask the M.T.A.'s board of directors to extend indefinitely the Sunday halffare bargain and exapnd it to include other holidays and even some weekdays.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: 74 Was a Second Late As 1973 Took a Leap
description: The New Year arrived one second late last night because the time experts in France decreed a leap second.

title: End of Isolation Brings New Problems for Bhutan
description: THIMPHLT, BhutanA serpentine road rises perilously from Phuntsholing, on the Indian plains, to the Thimphu Valley. It is a bumpy sixhour jeep ride deep into the Himalayas, a trip over lofty ranges marked with glacierfed streams and deep glens.

title: MAN SAYS ITE PAID $13,146 FOR SODAS
description: FORT WORTH, Dec. 31 Harry Vann says he drove into this city from Montezuma, Kan., on a sunny Monday afternoon last August, walked into

title: Books of The Times
description: ON CRIME WRITING. By Ross Macdonald. 45 pages. Capra Press. $2.50.

title: HENRI BUSSER 101 COMPOSERI IS DEAD
description: PARIS, Dec. 31Henri insser, a French composer and former director of the Paris Opera, died at his home last night, 17 days before his 102d birthday.

title: Stevens and Rabin Named To State's Highest Court
description: Governor Wilson yesterday appointed Harold A. Stevens and Samuel Rabin, who are the Presiding Justices of the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court in the First and Second Departments, as associate judges of the Court of Appeals.

title: College, School Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: The New Year's Silence
description: Wakening in the night now and hearing the silence, it seems impossible that this was such a busy, noisy world only a few months ago. The summer birds have gone south. The summer insects have lived their brief lives and died or hibernated. The winter animals are silent as starlight. This is the time of the New Year.

title: O'DWYER PLUS EXPANDED ROLE
description: There will be a clean sweep of the office of the City Council President when Paul O'Dwyer takes over today with staff of young lawyers, acccitintants and college graduates Whio will be asked to make a Monetary sacrifice to work for the city.

title: CUT IN CRASH TOLL CALLED UNCERTAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31The Insurance Institute for Highway Safety, looking in vain for a silver lining in the energy shortage, has reported that fuel conservation measures will not necessarily cause significant declines in deaths and injuries from automobile accidents.

title: The Sugar Was Sweet, Indeed
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 31The hero of Notre Dame's thrilling victory over Alabama for the college football championship of the land was Tom Clements, the Irish junior quarterback from McKees Rock, Pa. Clements made two big plays in the final quarter, one which brought the victors into position for the winning field goal by Bob Thomas and the other which kept Alabama from getting its sticky fingers on the football one last time.

title: Democrats Back Call for Special Session
description: TRENTON, Dec. 31Gover norelect Brendan T. Byrne plan to call a special legislative session to deal with school finances and tax reform drew a mixed reaction today from legislative leaders.

title: Foreign Exchange
description: Foreign Exchange Monday, December 31, 1973

title: Kern Is a Decisive Victor In Lake Placid Ski Jump
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., Dec. 31  Two years ago today Terry Kern, one of America's most promising young ski jumpers, suffered a torn.cartilage in his left knee while practicing on his home 50meter hill in Dilluth, Minn.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: NEWS INDEX

title: Parseghian Is Still Able to Refuse Any Offer
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 31At least once every year since he arrived at Notre Dame a decade ago, Ara Parseghian has either been offered a job as a pro coach or patiently put down erroneous reports of offers.

title: British Soccer Standings
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: NIXON SIGNS BILL 014 FLOOD POLICIES
description: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif., Dec. 31As the old year slipped away, President Nixon signed today 19 pieces of legislation, including a widened program of Federal flood insurance.

title: Escapee, 13
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Dec. 31 (AP)The police said a youth walked away from a state a school yesterday and stole mobile home and new police car before he was apprehended.

title: Things Get Better for Fairbairn and Ranger Mates
description: And now for some good news. The ghastly scoring slump of the New York Rangers Walt TkaczukBilly FairbairnSteve Vickers line shows, at long last, a slight sign of cracking.

title: DR. S. I. STRICKHOUSER
description: NEWBURYPORT, Mass., Dec. 31 (AP)Dr. Sherman I. Strickhouser, former manager of the United States Rubber Company plant in Providence, died here yesterday at his daughter's home. He was 72 years old.

title: Tristar Decision Delayed
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 31 (AP)  Air Canada announced today that it would delay a decision on whether to exercise an option to purchase nine of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation's L10I1 Tristars, The Canadian airline said in Montreal that it would await the outcome of a Lockhead study on increasing the range of the L1011 for transAtlantic capability.

title: Nixon Names Woman to U.N.
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 31 (AP)A publicaffairs consultant, Patricia Hutar, has been named by President Nixon as the United States representative to the United Nations commission on the status of women. Mrs. Hutar, 43, an author and former, model, has been involved in Republican politics for nearly 20 years and served on the President's Task Force on Women's Rights in 1969.

title: Hot Items: Siphons, GasTank Locks
description: You got any tubing? I'll take anything. And anything in auto supplies is what sells these daysif it's availableat the Times Square Store on Linden Boulevard in Brooklyn and other stores, reflecting an incredible nationwide boom in three automobile appurtenances that suddenly have become scarcer than the gasoline itself: siphons, gasolinecap locks and gasoline storage cans.

title: JACOB J. MELNIKER
description: Jacob J. Melniker, former president of the New York Furniture Exchange, died Sunday at the De Witt Nursing Home, 311 East 79th Street. His age was S7.

title: HOLIDAY MARKED BY SNOW AND RAIN
description: The old year ended with storms and storm warnings over much of the country. Heavy snows from Kansas to Ohio on New Year's Eve made holiday travel even harder for motorists already plagued by the gasoline shortage.

title: Suit on Electricity Rates
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 31 (UPI) A suit calling on the State Public Utility Commission to investigate the electricity rate structure in the light of the energy crisis was filed today by the Sierra Club in the California Supreme Court It calls on the court to determine whether the P.U.C. had the authoritT this year to approve an 89million rate increase for the Southern California Edison Company without preparing an environmental impact report.

title: Muddying the Oils
description: Muddying the Oils

title: U,S, AGENCIES FACE A NEW RENT RULE
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 31 (AP) Starting next July. all Federal departments and agencies housed in Governmentowned buildings maintained by the General Service Administration will begin paying rent to the administration.

title: Enter Mayor Beame
description: Enter Mayor Beame

title: Prospectus Says Energy Crisis Perils Jersey Sports Complex
description: NEWARK, Dec. 31  The New Jersey Sports and ExposiLion Authority said today that the energy crisis could cut into attendance at its proposed Meadowlands footballrace track complex and possibly impair its ability to pay off $295million bond issue scheduled to go on sale Jan. 15.

title: Repertory  British at Home Here
description: By CLIVE BARNES

title: Notre Dame Defeats Alabama, 24 to 23, In Bid for National Title in Sugar Bowl
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 31 Notre Dame won the right to claim a national college football title with a 2423 victory over Alabama tonight in a Sugar Bowl classic that surpassed expectations for sustained excitement.

title: Kern Is a Decisive Victor In Lake Placid Ski Jump
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., Dec. 31 Two years ago today Terry Kern, one of America's most promising young ski jumpers, suffered a torn cartilage in his left knee while practicing on his home 50meter hill in Duluth, Minn.

title: Soviet Exults in the West's Problems
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 31  The Soviet Union ended 1973 on a wave of confidence, playing up is own gains against the disarray of the Western alliance and exulting in the chaos caused by the energy crisis in he West.

title: CON ED PLANT SET TO USE COAL ON S.I.
description: Consolidated Edison said yesterday that it expected to be burning coal at its Arthur Kill No. 3 plant on Staten Island by Feb. 1.

title: American Financial Is Seeking Interest in Shearson, Hammill
description: Wall Street sources said yesterday the American Financial Corporation, a Cincinnatibased holding company, was engaged in negotiating for a major infusion of capital into Shearson, Hammill & Co., Inc., a large Wall Street securities firm.

title: COMMUNITY UNITS GET GUIDELINES
description: Citing the growing impoH tance of community boards in the city's government, the Board of Ethics has set forth some general principles to ouide members of Community Boards in areas where there may be potential conflicts of interest.

title: A RECORD VOLUME REACHED ON AMEX
description: Volume on the American Stock Exchange reached a reclord for the year of 6,546,000 shares yesterday as prices rose sharply. Trading was the heavies since 10,306,000 shares were sold on Dec. 29. 1972. Prices also rose in the overthecounter market.

title: 15 IN SEOUL RENEW DEMOCRACY PHA
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 31 (REUTERS)A group of 15 elder politicians, religious leaders and prominent intellectuals today sent a letter to President Park Chung Hee asking for the restoration of a genuine democracy guaranteeing people's basic rights, and requesting meeting with him.

title: Shula's Record of 53.11.11s Cited
description: Shula's Record of 53111 Is Cited

title: SAIGON SAYS 60,000 DIED SINCE THE TRUCE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dee. 30 (UPI)The South Vietnamese Government reported today that 46 soldiers on both sides were killed in 73 Communist ceasefire violations in a 24hour period.

title: SuitAccord Reached BylndianaStandard And Midwest Oil
description: The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) and the Midwest Oil Corporation, 95 per cent owned by Indiana Standard, said yesterday they had settled, subject to court approval, a lawsuit filed in Denver in 1971 by present and. former Midwest shareholders.

title: State Complains of Higher Rent For Its Offices at Trade Center
description: The State of New York has received rent bills from the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey for millions of dollars higher than originally estimated for state offices in the World Trade Center, and Controller Arthur Levitt's office is investigating to find out why.

title: Some Details Dropped In New U.S. Tax Form
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (UPI)The new Federal income tax forms that 81 million Americans are beginning to receive in the mail have been shortened in some categories, according to the Internal Revenue Service.

title: FUEL CRISIS PERILS SPORTS COMPLEX
description: NEWARK, Dec. 31  The New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority said today that the energy crisis could cut into attendance at its proposed

title: Markets to Be Closed
description: The nation's major securities and commodities markets will be closed today In observance of New Year's Day. Banks, busi ness and Government offices and Canadian and European markets also will be closed.

title: Business Brief
description: LONDON, Dec. 31 (UPI)Gold ended the year at a new fourmonth high on the London bullion market today. The dollar finished the year marginally up in Frankfurt but slightly down in London and Amsterdam.

title: Horses
description: UNUSUAL PONY CARRIAGE with canopy top 8 wicker seat, excellent condition 51500. Horsedrawn Carriage completely restored. Details 215355.7100. Mr. Epstein.

title: 2 Maine Escapees Caught
description: THOMASTON, Maine, Dec.31 (AP)  Two inmates who escaped from the Maine State Prison here were caught early today fater a chase that ended in downtown Waldboro, the state police said. The inmates, George W. Swan, 21 years old, of Lewiston, and Charles E. Emergy, 23, of Sanford, who were serving terms for robbery, were recaptured in an allegedly stone car about 10 miles west of the prison.

title: Connors, Chris Evert Gain Finals
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 31 (AP)America's tennis sweethearts, Chris Evert and Jimmy Connors, each reached the finals today in the $74,500 Australian open tennis championships.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Pennsylvania Power and Light Company lias signed a $13.million contract with the Atomic Energy Commission for enrichment of uranium fuel for its first nuclear power plant. This brings to $155million the total of contracts awarded this month for fuel for the Sesquipedalian plant now being built near Berwick, Pa.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Ohio State Choice To Defeat U.S. C.
description: PASADENA, Calif., Dec. 31  Ohio State, bent on restoring the Big Ten's prestige, seeks revenge tomorrow against Southern California in the 60th Rose Bowl game. The Buckeyes (901 wonlost tied record) are rated 2point favorites over the Trojans (911). A nearcapacity crowd of 104,700 is expected for the nation's, premier bowl attraction, dating back to 1902.

title: People and Business
description: Robert E, Mercer has been named president of the KellySpringfield Tire Company, He succeeds J. Carson Dowell as head of the company, a subsidiary of the Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: James Morrow, the Conservative party candidate in one of last year's disputed Assembly races, swore in a notarized statement filed with the Board of Elections in Mineola, L.I., that he had re. ceived a total of $3,300 from former Assemblyman Stanley Harwood, a Democrat.

title: Castro Still Sees U. S. Threat; Vows Defense of Latin Nations
description: MIAMI, Dec. 31 (AP)Premier Fidel Castro has told Cuban troops that the nation still faced the danger of military aggression from the United States.

title: New West Liberty Coach
description: WEST LIBERTY, W. Va., Dec. 31 (AP)Leo Miller, chief recruiter and offensive erty State College's football program for seven years, has been named head coach. Miller, 44 years old, succeeds Bob Roe, 65, who retired.

title: Oil Increase Seen Offsetting Foreign Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31The latest increases in oil prices mean that the higher cost of imported oil next year for the world's poorer countries will more than offset all the foreign aid they will receive from all sources, according to new analyses by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Develyopment (World Bank).

title: Bridge: New York's Player of Year Is Merle Toma Jerseyan
description: For the first time ever, the New York Player of the Year title, rewarding overall performance in tournaments here, has been won by a player outside the domain of the Greater New York Bridge Association.

title: An Agenda For the New Year
description: As a New Year begins, members of Congress are finding that the home folks are not necessarily more interested in impeaching Richard Nixon than they are in the shortages of gasoline and fuel oil. That is mixed news for Mr. Nixon; it may mean less impeachment pressure for the moment, but the more unpopular he is on any grounds, the easier it will be for Congress to impeach him on Watergate grounds. As the numerous trials of his exsubordinates begin, moreover, a daily flow of Watergate headlines, and perhaps revelations, may well keep the impeachment issue vigorously alive.

title: Notre Dame Wins
description: Notre Dame defeated Alabama, 2423, in the Sugar Bowl last night in New Orleans on a 19yard field goal by Bob Thomas with 4 minutes 26 seconds remaining. Details on Page 25.

title: The winning New Jerseyl daily lottery number yesterday was:
1973: Problems for Stocks, Food, Scandals, the Dollar and Oil
description: It was a year of stock market decline, dollar devaluation, rising food prices, shortages, scandals and the energy crisis. Following are the highlights and a chronology of some major economic events of 1973:

title: U.N. DELEGATE SAYS POLICE HARASS HIM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 31 (AP)  Senegal's chief delegate to the United Nations said today that he and his mission had been targets of various hostile acts by the police and people in New York. The delegate, Medoune Fall, made the charge in a letter issued today as an official document of the General Assembly.

title: Council Overrides Veto, Raises Estimate Salaries
description: In an atmosphere of good cheer and fellowship, the City Council yesterday overrode Mayor Lindsay's veto and gave the eight members of the Board of Estimate salary increases of $10,000 each. The vote was 31 to 3, with 29 Notes needed for the override.

title: Russian Scores His Country on Drugs
description: A high Soviet health official has criticized his country's 1pharmaceutical industry for delays in bringing newly developed drugs to the consumer.

title: The Rich, Famous, Talented and Powerful Resolve
description: Democrat of North Carolina My main objective is to wind up the investigation of Watergate, to make a report to the Senate and to make recommendations about some new legislation that would prevent future Watergates or punish adequately the people who are responsible for them. I also hope to get passed Congressional budget bill which would be welldesigned to stop all this deficit financing. I look forward to a whole lot of hard work in 1974.

title: CHESIMARD AND FOUR NAMED IN SHOOTINGS
description: Joanne D. Chesimard and four others suspected of being members of the Black Liberation Army were indicted yesterday on charges of attempting to shoot and kill two Queens policemen from ambush last Jan, 28.

title: Girl Nominated to Academy In Fight on MaleOnly Rule
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (UPI) In another challenge to the maleonly policies of the service academies, Representative William L. Hungate, Democrat of Missouri, said today that he had nominated an 18yearold girl to the Air Force Academy.

title: Connors, Chris Evert Gain Finals
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 31 (AP)America's tennis sweethearts, Chris Evert and Jimmy Connors, each reached the finals today in the $74,500 Australian open tennis championships.

title: Lindsay at a Farewell Party
description: John V. Lindsay began his 2,922d and final day as Mayor with an apparent resolve to avoid any maudlin nostalgia.

title: Stevens and Rabin Named To State's Highest Court
description: Governor Wilson yesterday appointed Harold A. Stevens and Samuei Rabin, who are the Presiding Justices of the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court in the First and Second Departments, as associate judges of the Court of Appeals.

title: Carl Parsons, Entomologist Who Taught at Vermont, Dies.
description: MANCHESTER, Vt., Dec. 31  Dr. Carl T. Parsons, an entomologist who taught at the University of Vermont and more recently did private research here, died, apparently of a heart attack, yesterday at the Dorset Field Club in Dorset. He was 59 years old.

title: MAN SAYS HE PAID S13,146 FOR SODAS
description: FORT WORTH, Dec. 31 Harry Vann says he drove into this city from Montezuma, Kan., on a sunny Monday afternoon last August, walked into a flashy strip joint on Main Street and for one night in his life was a highrolling spender.

title: TexasNebraska Match A Case of Rush vs. Pass
description: DALLAS, Dec. 31 (AP) Texas, ranked No. 8, and Nebraska, No. 12, highscoring teams with little in common except bad losses to Oklahoma, meet tomorrow in the 38th Cotton Bowl classic.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: Serene Himalayan Capital Jarred by Traffic's Roar
description: THIMPHU, BhutanDark shadows cling to the snowfringed mountains at 3 in the afternoon. By 5 P.M. this valley is dark and silent except for the bells on Buddhist temples tinkling it the icy breeze, the temple drums tapped by lamas and an abrupt, lonely jeep horn carried on the wind.

title: Astronauts Have 16 New Years In a Day by Crossing Date Line
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 31 (AP) Skylab 3's astronauts had a day full of New Years today.

title: U.S. Sends Atomic Frigate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (AP) The Navy has dispatched a nuclearpowered frigate, the Bainbridge, to join an aircraftcarrier task force in the Indian Ocean, the Pentagon said today. Officials said that the Bainbridge would not immediately replace the carrier Oriskany, but that it was likely the frigate would remain behind after the Oriskany departed.

title: An Agenda For the New Year
description: As a New Year begins, members of Congress are finding that the home folks are not necessarily more interested in impeaching Richard Nixon than they are in the shortages of gasoline and fuel oil, That is mixed news for Mr. Nixon; it may mean less impeachment pressure for the moment, but the more unpopular he is on any grounds, the easier it will be for Congress to impeach him on Watergate grounds. As the numerous trials of his exsubordinates begin, moreover, a daily flow of Watergate headlines, and perhaps revelations, may well keep the impeachment issue vigorously alive.

title: Quiet Ceremony Held at Home
description: In a modest twominute ceremony in his rented apartment in the Belle Harbor section of Queens, Abraham D. Beame was sworn in last night as the 104th Mayor of New York City, six hours before he officially took office at midnight.

title: Weisl Resigns as an Officer of Lehman Foundation
description: Edwin L. Weisl jr, who was recently named Administrator of Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs by Mayor Beanie, has resigned as treasurer and director of the Robert Lehman Foundation to avoid being involved in a conflict of interest that might force him to give up the major city job.

title: Lori Wilson Wed to Allen Neuharth
description: COCOA BEACH, Fla., Dec. 31  Florida State Senator Lori Wilson was married in a sunrise ceremony here today to Allen FL Neuharth of Rochester, president of the Gannett Company, Inc., newspaper publishers.

title: Music: Goldberg Twice
description: Rosalyn Tureck decked very provocative and, in some ways, very provoking recital in Carnegie Hill on Sunday. At 2 P.M, she played Bach's Goldberg Variations complete with all tkc, repeats on the harpsichord. After less than an hour of test and refreshment, she returned and played Bach's Goldberg Variations complete with all the repeats on the piano.

title: Continuity in Spain?
description: Generalissimo Franco apparently surprised everyone with his choice of Interior Minister Carlos Arias Navarro to be Premier of Spain in succession to the murdered Admiral Luis Carrero Blanco. The Caudillo had been expected to select a highranking military officer by way of insuring the constancy of the armed forces; instead, e chose a trusted friend with long service to the regime and the reputation of having been a tough chief Spain's national security police for eight years.

title: U.S. RED TAPE SNAGS STATE ENERGY BODY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 31 (AP) Governor Cahill's Energy Committee said today it had been wasting a lot of time and energy trying to get in touch with the Federal office that handles fuel allocations for the state.

title: THEORY ADVANCED IN TYPHOID RUNT
description: MOUNT HOLLY, Dec. 31The search for possible victims or carriers of an infectious typhoid outbreak traced to a church supper in Burlington on Nov. 4 has narrowed down to six unknown individuals whose existence may be only theoretical.

title: Cedeno Released on Bail After Charge Is Reduced
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dec. 31 (UPI)Cesar Cedeno, the Houston Astro center fielder, was freed on bail today to await trial for involuntary manslaughter in the fatal shooting of a 19yearold woman in a motel room here.

title: Most Arabs Boycott Jerusalem Election
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 31  The great majority of East Jerusalem's Arabs boycotted today's municipal election, setting back Israeli hopes for advancing the integration of the city under Israeli rule. Jerusalem was divided between Israel and Jordan until the 1967 war.

title: JOHN BIGGERS, 85, OF IBMOWENS
description: TOLEDO, Ohio., Dec. 31John David Biggers, retired chief executive officer of the LibbeyOwens Ford Company died today in his home in suburban Perrysburg. He was 85 years old.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: A Winning Ending for Hawley

title: JERSEY MAY BUY GAS FROM ALGERIA
description: The Federal Power Commission gave its conditional approval yesterday to the importation of more than 4.6 trillion cubic feet of natural gas over the next 22 yearsmuch of it to be stored on Staten Island even before the commission had determined whether the procedure is safe.

title: Pro. J. Salwyn Schapiro Is Dead; City College Historian Was 94
description: Dr. J. Salwyn Schapiro, emeritus professor of history at City College, where he led four decades of students through the intricacies of European politics, died Sunday in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 94 years old and lived at 45 Christopher Street.

title: Jamaica Asks 2Tier Prices On Oil in Developing Nations
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Dec. 31 (UPI)Jamaica has asked the oilproducing nations to create a twotier price system to give the world's developing nations a price break on petroleum. Prime Minister Michael Manley said today.

title: Woman Shopkeeper, 74, Slain In BedfordStuyvesant District
description: A 74yearold woman who had worked since childhood in a drygoods store in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn was found beaten to death there yesterday, an apparent robbery victim.

title: Oates Miracle Play Depicts Violence
description: As a prefatory note to her National Book Awardwinning novel, Them, Joyce Carol Oates quotes a line from John Webster's The White Devil: . because we are poor/ Shall we be vicious? That line could serve as the root of Miss Oates's new play, Miracle Play, which opened Sunday at the Playhouse II as the first in this season's New Phoenix Repertory Company Sideshows Miracle Play will be given for six more performances this Thursday through Monday.

title: Paper Retracts Article Linking Chotiner to Watergate Bugging
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Dec. 31 (UPI)  The Manchester Union Leader today printed a frontpage retraction of charges that President Nixon's Tangtime associate, Murray Chotiner, organized the Watergate bugging incident.

title: Arms Flow to Cutoff Units Is Reported in Cairo
description: CAIRO, Dec. 31  An Egyptian writer on military affairs appeared today to confirm reports that a route for delivery of military supplies had been

title: ButaneLaden Car Derails
description: PORT HURON, Mich., Dec. 31 (UPI)  A railroad tank car filled with 33,630 gallons of liquid butane derailed and overturned yesterday near Port Huron, forcing 50 families to flee their homes for 12 hours as precaution. Officials said there were no injuries or damage and the butane did not leak.

title: Connecticut May Change Statutes on Fluoridation
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 31 (UPI) The General Assembly's Public Health and Safety Committee has drawn up a number of bills dealing with the fluoridation of public drinking water.

title: Penn State Slight Orange Bowl Favorite Over L. S. U.
description: MIAMI, Dec. 31  In the Orange Bowl where the No. 1 collegiate ranking is not at stake, Penn State, undefeated and untied, is about a onetouchdown favorite to beat Louisiana State University tomorrow night.

title: exParty Chief Says Junta Leads Greece Into Chaos
description: ATHENS, Dec. 31The leader of Greece's largest party in the last parliamentary elections 10 years agosaid today that the present Government was leading the country to chaos because nobody in Greece know who was running the nation.

title: Bridal for Miss Zimmermann And Thomas Forrest Thurston
description: SMOKE RISE, N. J., Dec. 31Miss HelgaLuise Zimtnermann, daughter of Mrs. Wilhelm Zimmermann of Munich, West Germany, and the late Mr. Zimmermann, was married here this afternoon to Thomas Forrest Thurston of Bryant Pond, Me., son of Mr. and Mrs. Lester Ralph Thurston Jr. of Smoke Rise.

title: Woman Guides Rutgers Victory
description: Rutgers University overcame a New York Athletic Club lead in the last 500 meters yesterday and won the featured eightoared race of the New Year's Eve Regatta on the Orchard Beach Lagoon in the Bronx.

title: Sworn Statement Is Filed In CampaignGilt Dispute
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 31 James E. Morrow. the Conservative party candidate in one of last year's disputed Assembly races, swore in a notorized statement filed with the Board of Elections here today that he had received a total of $3,300 from former Assemblyman Stanley Harwood, a Democrat.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Employment in State at a High

title: BANKS HERE SHUN NEW AID CHECKS
description: Nearly 200,000 aged, blind and disabled poor people in the city move today from the welrare system to the new Federal Suppiemental Security Income Drogram, but the transition has run into problems.

title: MRS, MEIR'S PARTY KEEPING AN EDGE, BUT MARGIN IS CUT
description: TEL AVIV, Tuesday, Jan. 1Premier Golda Meir's Labor Party appeared to have suffered a slight setback in Israel's crucial parliamentary elections yesterday, but appeared likely to retain its dominant position in the Government.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Board of Visitors for City College

title: Resolution for a New Era
description: The passing of the old year has more than transient significance for Americans this New Year's Day. With 1973, an era died, an era of profligacy unprecedented human experience when most Americans embarked on an orgy of consumption, following the lean years of the Depression and World War II.

title: DOW UP BY 2,84; GOLD ISSUES lin
description: Wall Street bade farewell to 1973 yesterday with a token rally and a massive set of uncertainties that were underscored by record prices in leading gold stocks.

title: Photographs Said to Show Israeli Prisoners in Syria
description: PARIS, Dec. 31 (Reuters) The French news magazine ParisMatch today published what were said to be the first photographs of Israeli prisoners held in Syria since the Syrian refusal to publish prisoner lists.

title: Lindsay at a Farewell Party
description: John V. Lindsay began his 2,922d and final day as Mayor with an apparent resolve to avoid any maudlin nostalgia.

title: Congress Weighs Curb on Presidents Spending
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 The lifestyle of American Presidents, whose perquisites and privileges have expanded with their power, has caused a steadily growing drain on the public purse.

title: Climbers Prepare Assault On Mountain in Wyoming
description: GRAND TETON NATIONAL PARK, Wyo., Dec. 31 (UPI)Paul Petzeoldt and a 25member climbing party maneuvered today for position in preparation for a ninth winter assault on 13,770foot Grand Teton Peak in northwetern Wyoming.

title: 12 Big Oil Companies Sued For $270Billion Damages
description: DETROIT, Dec. 31 (UPI)A law firm filed a $270billion lawsuit today charging 12 mai jor oil companies with artificially creating the fuel shortage in order to raise profits.

title: BETHLEHEM TO RAISE STEEL SCRAP PRICES
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, following other maior producers, announced yesterday that it would apply a scrap surcharge on some of its products in accordance with a recent Cost of Living Council decision permitting price increases to reflect higher, prices for steel scrap.

title: Paterson Tries to Salvage Some A bandoned Housing
description: PATERSON, Dec. 31A test plan to identify and salvage abandoned housinga statewide problem believed to affect about 10,000 dwellings, primarily in urban areasis under way here as an outgrowth of an Urban Affairs Task Force set up earlier this year by the New Jersey Association of Realtors.

title: Indonesia Spurs Risihg Output of Oil
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesia, now the world's 12th largest producer of oil and moving up steadily, has been doing her best to succeed in business without getting involved in today's oil politics.

title: More Food Stores Cited for Failing Two Inspection
description: The Health Department hat released the names of 34 more restaurants and food stores it the city accused of having vialated the Health Code after their owners failed to correct infractions that persisted through two inspections.

title: Christopher W Coates, 74, Dies; Headed New York Aquarium1
description: Christopher William Coates,; retired director of the New; York Aquarium, at Coney! Island, who helped make it one of the city's major attractions! with strange and fascinating! creatures from the sea, died; Sunday in a hospital in East! Stroudsburg, Pa. He was 74 years old.

title: OilSpill Cleanup on Coast Awaits Calmer Weather
description: MONTEREY, Calif., Dec. 31 (AP)Crews with giant vacuum cleaners and skimmers waited today for calm seas so they could clean up a 16,000gallon oil spill about 20 miles west of Morro Bay.

title: The Rich, Famous, Talented and Powerful Resolve
description: The term Management by Objectiveor M.B.0.has become a catchword in industry these days. It is the process whereby the heads of corporations (or of departments within the corporations) list their specific, realistic objectives with the intention of reviewing the list at given intervals to check on the progress toward achievement.

title: STUDENT IS FOUND SAFE IN CAR TRUNK
description: OCALA, Fla., Dec. 31 (AP)A student kidnapped from birthday party was found today, locked in an automobile trunk. The officials said 20yearold Kathy L. Morris was in good condition.

title: Bus Driver Is Stopped, Held on License Charge
description: The driver of a New Jersey charter bus was arrested on the Cross Westchester Expressway last Sunday and was charged with speeding and driving with a revoked license. The bus was carrying 39 passengers.

title: QUEENS MAILMAN WOUNDED IN FACE
description: A 54yearold Queens letter carrier was shot in the face and critically wounded yesterday afternoon while delivering mail in Ozone Park. Police officers of the Rochdale Village precinct said the circumstances surrounding the shooting were still unknown because the victim, Frank Marshall of 19012 89th Avenue, Hollis, Queens, was unconscious at Jamaica Hospital.

title: Skill of Newcomers Bolsters Vikings
description: The Miami Dolphins have been established in an early betting line from Las Vegas, Nev., as 6point favorites over the Minnesota Vikings for the Super Bowl game in Houston Jan. 13. That seems fair enough. The Dolphins are an imperturbable crowd going into their third straight Super Bowl. It will be another game for them and they are accustomed to winning, with 31 victories in their last 33 games.

title: No Sanctions Seen For Peru on Cerro
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 31  The United States Government, which has been holding secret talks with the Peruvian Government on zmumber of issues, is not expected to apply economic sanctions against Peru because of the nationalization of the Cerro de Pasco Corporation today.

title: Fuel Supply and Tempers Grow Shorter in City Area
description: Motorists in the metropolitan area who ventured out yesterday on the day before a holiday found the familiar symptoms of the energy crisisshort tempers, long lines and a wilderness of no gas signs.

description: The Federal Power Commission gave its conditional approval yesterday to the importation of more than 4.6 trillion, cubic feet of natural gas over the next 22 yearsmuch of it to be stored on Staten Island even before the commission had determined whether the procedure is safe.

description: World Food Program: A Losing Battle

title: Virginia Inmates Riot
description: BLAND, Va. Dec. 31 (AP)Two dozen inmates at the Bland Correctional Farm rioted for two hours last night, wrecking two dormitories, tearing out plumbing, breaking windows and setting fire to mattresses, the prison authorities said. Superintendent John Gathright estimated damage to the dormitories at $30,000 to $25,000.

description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 31Reiterating the determination of the Chinese Nationalist Government never to deal with the Chinese Communists, Premier Chiang Chingkuo today envisaged the continued separation of Taiwan from the Chii nese mainland for an indefinite period.

title: STATE COMPLAINS OF OFFICE RENTS
description: The State of New York has received rent bills from the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey for millions of dollars higher than originally estimated for state offices in the World Trade Center, and Controller Arthur Levitt's office is investigating to find out why.

title: Arthur. Daley
description: I dunno, he said. They're never on defense. They always have the ball.

title: Gifts to Neediest Top Last Year's Mark
description: The performance to date of the current drive of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund appears to belie the traditional view that a depressed stock market tends to slow 1p unnecessary spending.

title: Military Dependents Costs For Inpatient Care Doubling
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (UPI)The cost to military dependents for inpatient hospital care will increase from $1.75 to $3.50 a day beginning tomorrow, Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger said today.

title: PHOTO BRINGS TEARS AND REUNITES COUPLE
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 31 (AP) An unidentified old man whc was held in a mental ward for a week lay listlessly in bed as a nurse showed him a newspaper photo of an elderly woman, Tears came to the man's eyes and he cried: Mamma, Mamma!

title: Police Get a Special Gasoline Delivery
description: The Police Department, whose fuel stores were uncomfortably low, received 50,000 gallons of gasoline yesterday in an emergency delivery.

title: JOHN F. CHANDLER
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 31 (AP)John F. Chandler, a former sportswriter for The Associated Press, died yesterday at Bon Secours Hospital of injuries suffered in an auto accident two months ago. He was 67 years old.

title: Boston Police Chief Faults Crime Reporting System
description: BOSTON, Dec. 31 (AP)Police Commissioner Robert diGrazia said yesterday that the way statistics were reported caused distortions in American urban crime rates announced recently by the Federal Btfreau of Investigation.

title: JAPAN'S RESERVES FELL IN DECEMBER
description: TOKYO, Dec. 31 (AP) Japan ended the year with $6.12billion less in its official gold and foreigncurrency reserves than 12 months ago as the reserves dropped by another $950million in December, official said today.

title: Quiet Ceremony Held at Home
description: In a modest twominute ceremony in his rented apartment in the Belle Harbor section of Queens, Abraham D. Beame was sworn in last night as the 104th Mayor of New York City, six hours before he officially took office at midnight.

title: Conductor Marries Carol Neblett
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 31 Carol Neblett, soprano with the New York City Opera. Company, was married tonight to Kenneth Schermerhorn, music director and conductor of the Milwaukee Symphony Orchestra.

title: DR. LEANDER SHEARER
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 31Dr. Leander H. Shearer, former president of the medical board of Lincoln Hospital in the Bronx, died yesterday at the Princeton Medical Center. His age was 97 and he lived here.

title: SHELL LIFTS PRICE FOR OIL PRODUCTS
description: The Shell Oil Company announced yesterday that it was increasing prices for gasoline, heating oil and most other petroleum products. Other oil companies are expected to announce similar rises.

title: REBELS SAID TO KILL NINE IN PHNOM PENH
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 31 (UPI)Rebel gunners pressed their dryseason offensive against the Government of President Lon Nol today with rocket and handgrenade attacks against Phnom Penh, killing two women and seven children, according to official reports.

title: RUDEOIL PRICES RAISED 60% TO 80%
description: Crudeoil prices in some producing countries rose by 60 to 80 per cent to record levels effective today as Libya, Indonesia, Nigeria and Bolivia adjusted their export prices following a pattern set by the major Persian Gulf producers week ago.

title: EMIR'S PARTY RETAINING EDGE; RIGHT WING GAINS
description: TEL AVIV, Tuesday, Jan. 1Premier Golda Meir's Labor party lost ground in parliamentary elections here yesterday but still seemed certain of dominating Israel's next government.

title: New West Liberty Coach
description: WEST LIBERTY, W. Va., Dec. 31 (AP)Leo Miller, chief recruiter and offensive erty State College's football program for seven years, has been named head coach. Miller, 44 years old, succeeds Bob Roe, 65, who retired.

title: Nixon Appoints His Wife Chairman of Volunteer Unit
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Dec. 31 (UPI)President Nixon appointed Mrs. Nixon today to be temporary chairman of a voluntary service Advisory council, and named 24 persons to serve with her.

title: Appellate Judge Retires
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Dec. 31 (AP)  President Nixon acknowledged today the retirement of Judge Roger J. Kiley of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit, the Western White House announced. Judge Kiley, of Oak Park, Ill., had been on the appellate bench since 1961.

title: PROXMIRE BIDS NIXON STOP HOUSING SLUMP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (UPI)  Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, has urged President Nixon to do something about rising unemployment in housing and related industries and make it easier for middleincome Americans to buy homes.

title: Fatal PoliceCopter Crash Tied to Vehicle, Not Sniper
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 31 (UPI)  The crash last Oct. 2 of a police helicopter in which two policemen were killed was caused by mechanical failure in the drive shaft, not by bullets from a sniper's gun, as the police had previously thought, according to the National Transportation Safety Board.

description: Spencer Woolley Kimball, who became President of the Mormon church on Sunday, has a bounce to his walk and seems to wear a perpetual smile, as one colleague put it.

title: NEW ULSTER RULE WILL BEGIN TODAY
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 31The 15man Northern Ireland executive was sworn in here today. It will take over much of the administration of the troubled province tomorrow after 21 months of direct rule from London.

title: French Envoy Says Chile Grants SafeConduct to 191
description: DIJON, France, Dec. 31 (Reuters)The Chilean Government has guaranteed safeconduct out of Chile to 191 people taking refuge in the French Embassy in Santiago, but the fate of 29 others there remains in doubt, the French Ambassador to Chile, Pierre de Menthon, said today.

title: Palestinians Say They Attacked Briton
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 31The Popular Front for the I.iheration of Palestine has claimed responsibility for yesterday's attempt on the life of one of the most prominent members of the Jewish community in Britain, Joseph Edward Sieff.

title: Celtics Win 7th Straight, 10697
description: BOSTON, Dec. 31 (AP)The Boston Celtics, led by their workhorse center, Dave Cowens, pulled together after a slow start and scored their seventh consecutive victory today, 10697, over the Philadelphia 76ers.

description: Keeping up with fashion is being put down by busy, productive women who claim (a) they have no time for it, (b) its a frivolous occupation, and (c) fashion is conspiracy on the part of designers to persuade featherheaded women to keep pouring out money for clothes they do not really need but are made to feel they want.

description: COUDERSPORT, Pa., Dec. 31 (AP)  James H. McDonald, holder of the Medal of Honor, died Saturday at Charles Cole Memorial Hospital. He was 73 years old and had been retired from the Navy after a 33year career.

title: City Ignores Its Troubles and Greets 1974
description: With their traditional cheering, honking and whistling, thousands of New Yorkers welcorned the year 1974 last night in a jubilant mood oblivious to the signs of an energy crisis and troubled economy around them.

description: It's very mean today, said the small middleaged man pumping gasoline. they want more than their $3 worth and they get mad and yell at you and treat you like a dog. They're worse than animals. Is it my fault there's a gas shortage?

title: New Jersey Sports
description: Conversation in the Gagg household is strictly sports and the decor tells why. In the living room of the home in Butler, N. J., there are 95 trophies for sports, most them awarded to the four oldest sons.

title: Storm Forces Cancellation Of Pikes Peak Fireworks
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Jan. 1 (UPI)For the second consecutive year the Adaman Club was forced to cancel its annual New Year's Eve fireworks display atop 14,110foot Pikes Peak because of severe weather conditions.

title: GIFTS BY OIL GROUP TO NIXON ARE LISTED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1 (AP)Representative Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, contended today that President Nixon could not deal effectively with the energy crisis because oil interests gave his reelection campaign more than $4.9million.

title: Ohio State, Penn State and Nebraska Win
description: Ohio State, Penn State and Nebraska triumphed yesterday in the traditional New Year's Day bowl games.

title: Quick Fare Triumphs In Stakes
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 1 Quick Fare gave her owner, E. Gay Drake, a surprise New Year's Day present today at Liberty Bell Park when she rallied from off the pace to register a head victory in the fifth running of the $27,950 New Hope Stakes.

title: Beame Inaugurated, Vows Integrity and Efficiency
description: Abraham David Beame was inaugurated yesterday in City Flail Plaza as New York's 104th Mayor and immediately called for unity, pledged integrity and efficiency and expressed the hope that the day would mark the rebirth of faith in our city and confidence in our city government.

title: Outlook for State's Dairy Farmers Is Said to Improve
description: ALBANY, Jan. 1For the first time in years, the outlook for dairy farmers in New York State, who form the largest segment of the state's agriculture, is favorable, according to farm experts here and at the State College of Agriculture and Life Sciences at Cornell University.

title: Nebraska Conquers Texas by 193 in Cotton Bowl
description: DALLAS, Jan. 1 (UPI)The Nebraska Cornhuskers, stunned by a Texas goalline stand that kept them from the halftime lead, used a key interception by Bob Thornton and the breakaway runs of Tony Davis in the second half today to defeat the Longhorns, 19.3, in the 38th annual Cotton Bowl.

title: From Beach 131st Street to City Hall
description: His wife, Mary, had to get up early to make him a scrambledegg breakfast and their son Buddy had to stay home and babysit because two of the grandchildren were sick. Otherwise, Abraham D. Beame became Mayor of New York yesterday without incident.

title: Advertising: Memorabilia of 73
description: There are probably those who think that the biggest marketing  advertisingmedia story of 1973 was the introduction of the halfgallon liquor bottle. This, however, is a narrow, selfish view and tends to overlook a number of very memorable events. Like, uh urn.

description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 1President Nixon's appointment of his wife to serve on a national advisory council was illegal, the White House said today.

description: In recent years there have been several tender offers designed to obtain working control of corporations that have been followed by exchange offers for the remaining shares at much lower prices.

title: Patman Will Run Again
description: TEXARKANA, Tex., Jan. 1 plop  Representative Wright Patman, Democrat of Texas, announced yesterday that he would seek his 24th term in Texas First Congressional District. Today, Mr. Patman, 80 years old, began his 46th year In the House

description: MOSCOW, Jan. 1  New editions of two outstanding writers partly suppressed under Stalin, and even by his successors, have appeared unexpectedly here, causing an unusual stir in literary circles.

description: THE EYE OF THE STORM. By Patrick White. 608 pages. Viking. $8.95.

title: 2 Housing Patrolmen Kill Suspected Pusher in Fight
description: A man described by the poIke as a suspected narcotics pusher was shot and killed lest night by two Housing Authority patrolmen while resisting arrest following an alleged narcotics; sale at 131st Street and Eighth( Avenue in Harlem.

title: System to Cash Relief Checks Is Set Up Under New Program
description: The 170 outlets of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in the five boroughs will cash this month's checks for the aged, blind and disabled poor in the new Federal Supplemental Security Income Program if they show old photo identification cards from the welfare system from which 200,000 are being transferred.

title: Ulster's Coalition Begins Rule Amid Bombing and Shooting
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 1 (Reuters)Northern Ireland's new powersharing executive took over the daytoday running of this British province today amid incidents of gunfire and bomb blasts.

title: The Day After the Night Before Is a Tranquil One
description: Judging by the almost eerily empty streets and lightly trayeled highways, New Yorkers and metropolitanarea residents celebrated New Year's Day yesterday mainly by staying home.

title: News Summary and Index
description: of the Day The Major Events

title: Violence at New Year's Leaves 13 Dead
description: New Year's Eve violence, ranging from what the police believe was a young man's carelessness with a gun to fierce domestic quarreling, took at least 13 lives in the city Monday night and early yesterday morning.

title: Records. Astaire's Style
description: The passing of time is proving that some of the most timeless popular music of the nineteenthirties was created by and for Fred Astaire's movies. A recent book, Starring Fred Astaire, a handsome and evocative combination of words and pictures by Stanley Green and Burt Goldblatt, focuses primarily on Mr. Astaire's films. But when you are dealing with a singer and dancer, words and pictures can take you only part of the way. The next step is the sound of the voice and the of the feet.

title: Mora of Colombia Wins Brazil Road Run 2d Year in Row
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Jan. 1 Victor Mora of Colombia celebrated the arrival of the new year today by winning his second consecutive Sao Silvestre midnight road run.

title: Spokane Exchange Gains
description: SPOKANE, Wash., Jan. 1 (UPI)The Spokane Stock Exchange reported today that transactions were up 40 per cent over 1972 while dollar volume moved up 47 per cent. The yearend. report showed a volume of 12,945,919 shares changed hands for a valuation of $6,625,600, compared with a share volume of 9,257,970 worth $4,498,135 in 1972.

title: State Orders Creedmoor Crime Inquiry
description: The State Commissioner of Mental Hygiene has ordered an investigation of reports of crime and thefts by staff members, patients and outsiders at Creed moor State Hospital that a State Senator described as having reached epidemic proportions.

title: Federal Panel Voids Curb On Woman Vote in Georgia
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 1 (AP)  A threejudge Federal panel has struck down Georgia's election law, which bars married women from voting in the state when their husbands legally reside elsewhere.

title: UNIT OF EXCHANGE WILL REFUND FEES
description: The Depository Trust Company, a subsidiary of the New York Stock Exchange, said yesterday it was refunding excess fees of $1.2milllion to the 356 brokerdealers and banks that paid fees during 1973.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Orient Point Ferryboat Runs Aground

title: COAST TRAIN WRECK SOURCE OF DISPUTE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 1 (UN)  Amtrak and Southern Pacific Company spokesmen have disagreed about what caused the wreck of the Coast Starlight train in which 84 persons were hurt Friday.

title: City's Skipper Leaves To Skipper a Sailboat
description: Former Mayor John V. Lindsay, his wife, Mary, and their son, John Jr., left by plane for Puerto Rico yesterday afternoon to begin his first rest without official cares since 1965, when he was elected Mayor.

title: 1973 Death Toll in Fires Is Close to 1972 Iota
description: BOSTON, Jan. 1 (AP)Firesi lin the United States in 19731 killed about 11,900 people, nearly the same number killed lin fires in 1972, the National Fire Protection Association said yesterday.

title: State Legislators See Court Reform as Top Issue
description: The No. 1 issue when the Legislature convenes Jan. 9 is reform of the state's court system, according to a poll of legislators conducted by the Citizens Union.

title: Rent Decontrol. Reported A Spur to Worse Housing
description: A state commission said yesterday that the controversial vacancy  decontrol law had not only failed to spur landlords to make major improvements in existing housing here, but had, in fact, been accompanied by a significant decrease in such improvements.

title: GAS STATION OWNER CITES NIXON ON LAW
description: CHICAGO Jan. 1 (UPI) Sam McBride, who owns the first gasoline station to be ,closed down for energycrisis price violations, says he will not abide by court orders because neither does President Nixon.

title: WILLIAM E. JOHN, 61, AD MAN, YACHTSMAN
description: PORT CHESTER, N.Y. Jan. 1 William E. John, an advertising man and leader in yachting, died today of complications following surgery in United Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived at 5 Hunter Lane, Rye.

title: The Laws of Chance Explain Why the Pollster Is Probably Right
description: A pollster asks 3,000 people whom they favor for Mayor and then predicts that Abraham D. Beame will get such and such per cent of the vote, John Marchi so much, Albert H. Blumenthal so much and Mario Biaggi so much.

title: Wagner to Lindsay to Beame
description: It's over nowthe adventure that was the Lindsay years. John Vliet Lindsay's election in 1965 was something of a political miracle. He appeared so young; he was so full of hopes and ideas. Besides, who had ever supposed a Republican would win in New York City? A period of innovation and excitement surely seemed to be in store, when the genius of New York would reveal itself in a city made more habitable for all, more beautiful, more responsive to the talents of its extraordinary population. Instead, the years opened with a devastating subway strike; they soon saw the city under the menace of riots and growing fears of crime, its life torn by protests, picket lines and stoppages.

title: France Sends 6 Basques From Spain to the North
description: PARIS, Jan, 1 (Reuters)Six Spanish Basque refugees were rounded up in the French Basque country before dawn today and sent under police guard to live in northern France, far from the Spanish border.

title: ENRICO CARUSO SISCA
description: Enrico Caruso Sisca, a building contractor and a godson of the tenor for whom he was named, died yesterday in his sleep at his home, 12 Beekman Place. He was 64 years old.

title: Riderless Motorcycle Kills 2 in El Paso Parade Crowd
description: EL PASO, Tex., Jan. 1 (UPI) A motorcycle careened into spectators at the Sun Carnival parade today, killing two of them and injuring 22, when its rider, a Juarez, Mexico. policeman, was thrown off while doing tricks.

title: CHARLES TEAGUE OF HOUSE IS DEAD
description: SANTA PAULA, Calif., Jan. 1 (AP)  Representative Charles M. Teague, who had represented this Southern California city in Congress since 1955, died Iof a heart attack sometime last night, aides said today. He was 64 years old. Mr. Teague's body was discovered this morning by his son, Alan, who is Mayor of Santa Paula.

title: Israel's Morning After
description: Labor party today is like a son who has come through terrible automobile. accident with only a broken arm, senior party official observed TEL AVIV, Jan. 1The

title: DAVID C. M'MILLEN
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Jan. 1 David C. McMillen, group vice president of the Writing Products Division of the Joseph Dixon Crucible Company of Jersey City, died yesterday at Overlook Hospital. His age was 55 and he lived here.

title: Losers Restrict Cappelletti to 50 Yards
description: MIAMI, Jan. 1Penn State completed its third undefeated and untied football season in the last six tonight just as it finished the other two with a narrow victory in the Orange Bowl.

title: Suicide Ends Texas Chase
description: TUCUMCARI, N. M., Jan. 1 (UPI)A Texan ended a wild police chase yesterday by putting a gun to his head inside his moving car and killing himself in front of three hitchhikers. The police said the dead man, William Harvey Baker, 29 years old, of Fort Worth, Tex., had fled after being stopped by the police who became suspicious when they noticed his car had Texas dealer license plates.

title: High School Choralists A Hit at the Inaugural
description: One of the warmest ovations at Mayor Beanie's inauguration was accorded to the All City High School Chorus, made up of youngsters from all parts of the city and of various ethnic groups.

title: Senators Accuse Interior Chief Of Ignoring Danger of Coyotes
description: ROSWELL, N. M., Jan. 1 Twentyone Senators from) Western woolgrowing states, have written a joint letter to Secretary of Interior Rogers C. B. Morton accusing the Department of Interior of a failure to protect ranchers against substantial losses of domestic livestock to coyotes.

title: Dancing Papa in a. Waltz
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 1 (UPI)Dancing Papa, ridden by Don Pierce, pulled away from El Extrano in the stretch today to capture the $34,450 El Monte Handicap at Santa Anita, Dancing Papa, who returned $15, $6.60 and $3.60 for $2 across the board, ran the 1 116 mile on a slow track in 1:45 45.

title: ExBallplayer's Daughter Killed in Elevator Shaft
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 1 (UPI)Sharon Thomas, 17yearold daughter of a former National League baseball star, Frank Thomas, was killed early today when she fell 35 feet in an elevator shaft at a restaurant and motel in suburban Ross Township.

title: Bronxville Power Plant, Sold for $1, Being Revitalized
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y.For dollar, a small Connecticut company has bought the dilapidated power plant that marred the center of this wealthy old village in Westchester County.

title: Mournful Year Ahead
description: PARISThe next twelve months cannot avoid being difficult for the industrialized West even though the United States, economically, may survive with less sweat than countries of the European Economic Community (Common Market). The availability and price of petroleum is, of course, the major element contributing to gloom.

title: ALBERT KAPP, 77, LED FURNITURE EXCHANGE
description: Albert Kapp, president of the New York Furniture Exchange since. 1969, died yesterday at his home in East Orange, N. J. His age was 77.

title: Shots Greeting 74 Kill 2, Hurt 100 in Naples
description: ROME, Jan. 1  Two persons  an 8yearold girl and a 17yearold youth were killed by gunshots fired joyfully in the streets of Naples last midnight. More than 100 people were injuried during the celebration.

title: Soviet Starts AtomicReactor in Siberia
description: The Soviet Union, moving ahead with an active nuclearpower program, has started up the world's northernmost reactor, in a remote corner of Siberia facing Alaska.

title: People in Sports: Clemente Is Memorialized
description: Friends, fans and the family of the late baseball star, Roberto Clemente, gathered on a beach in San Juan, P.R. under drizzling, leaden skies Monday night to commemorate the first anniversary of his death.

title: Amusements for the Children
description: Who can fault good Walt Disney? The animated feature of Robin Hood, held over from Christmas into the New Year, turns out to be top fun, like the bright, sharp, amusing Disney of yore. It has a surprisethe characters are animals, not the humans of such predecessors as Peter Pan and Cinderella. Add to this neat screen package at the Radio City Music. Hall, the annual Christmas stage show, complete with the sacred pageantry and the highkicking Rockettes. (2464600).

title: Caso, Starting 2d Term, Hints He'd Leave for the Right U.S. Job
description: MINEOLA, L. T., Jan. 1 The Nassau County Executive, Ralph G. Caso, who started his second term in office today, is hinting that he might not complete his new term if an appropriate Federal office became available in a new Republican Administration.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LUMINARY Mention the name Joseph H. Lewis to a movie fan. If he doesn't look blank and mumble who? he really knows his stuff. Mr. Lewis is not a man for limelight grabbing. He's been making movies these many years, since the nineteenforties, and they've been mostly if not entirely Hollywood B films, Westerns, gangster pictures, melodramas. As a director he's worked with low budgets, and grindemoutscripts and yet has made movies that people went to see, if not remember.

title: Youth Rescued at Brooklyn Bridge After Plea by Pastor
description: A slender, 21yearold bearded youth, screaming Nobody wants menobody cares, scurried for an hour yesterday around the steel latticework of the Brooklyn Bridge before repeated pleas lured him to safety.

title: Quick Fare First At Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 1Quick Fare gave her owner, E. Gay Drake, a surprise New Year's Day present today at Liberty Bell Park when she rallied from off the pace to register a head victory in the fifth running of the $27,950 New Hope Stakes.

title: Wilson Shows His Political Style at Yonkers Inaugural
description: YONKERS, Jan. 1Governor Wilson broke a longstanding gubernatorial tradition today. Rather than be the host at the annual open house at the Executive Mansion in Albany, he chose to come here to Yonkers, his home and the seat of his own political career, to swear in the new Republican Mayor and the Republicandominated City Council.

title: School Fire Extends Holiday
description: BOSTON, Jan. 1 (AP)Students at the Edward Southworth School will have three extra days of winter vacation because of a fire that damaged the 12room building this morning. A spokesman for the Boston School Department said the school building, situated in the Meetinghouse Hill section of Dorchester, was being used as an annex for the crowded Grover Cleveland Junior High School.

title: Lottery Off for Holiday
description: There was no New Jersey daily lottery yesterday because

title: Restaurant Melting Pot
description: CHICAGO (UPI)The United States has been called the world's melting pot. The National Restaurant Association reports ethnic restaurants in America now comprise more than 11 per cent of the total number of eating establish

title: Beame Inaugurated, Vows Integrity and Efficiency
description: Abraham David Beame was inaugurated yesterday in City Hall Plaza as New York's 104th Mayor and immediately called for unity, pledged integrity and efficiency and expressed the hope that the day would mark the rebirth of faith in our city and confidence in our city government.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: A Refuge for Wildlife Set for South Jersey
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 1A new 650acre Federal wildlife refuge will be created at mouth of the Salem River South Jersey as soon as land can be deeded over to Government by Philadelphia Conservationists, Inc.

title: SHARP RISE NOTED IN SUEZ INCIDENTS
description: CAIRO, Jan. 1A sharp increase in outbreaks of shooting; along the Egyptian Israeli ceasefire lines was reported today by the United Nations; Emergency Force.

title: MidHudson Green.
description: MidHudson Green.

title: Court Security Plan Sharply Curtailed
description: A court security programfeaturing intercom systems for judges to summon help during disturbances and the experimental use of metal detectors to keep weapons out of coutroomsis to be instituted here this month.

title: Business Briefs
description: KARACHI, Jan. 1The Pakistani Government today nationalized all Pakistani banks, shipping lines and leading oil distribution companies. Foreign banks were not affected except that they will no longer be permitted to establish new branches.

title: Gasoline Drought in City Expected to Ease Today
description: Motorists looking for gasoline on the first day of the New Year could find only 16 stations selling it in the city. The situation is expected to improve today as stations end the holiday shutdown and get new supplies.

title: Uncertain Mandate
description: With the close of the polls across Israel, the way now open for serious negotiations to be undertaken among the Middle East combatants, for the first time in a quartercentury.

title: Earnings Outlook: Take Your Choice
description: The Mideast situation and its farreaching effects have confused the outlook for corporate profits this year. The energy shortage has imposed complexities on top of other uncertainties, and the widely varied forecasts of earnings for this year reflect these complications.

title: Basketball, Hockey Standings
description: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n

title: 38 Killed as Italian Jetliner Crashes Near Turin on a Flight to Geneva
description: TURIN, Italy, Jan. 1Thirtyeight persons were killed today when a twoengine jetliner of the Italian domestic air services crashed near Turin on a flight from Cagliari, Sardinia, to Geneva.

title: Missing Youth's Body Found
description: TUJUNGA, Calif., Jan, 1 (UPI)The body of a young Air Force man, missing more than a week, has been found in the wreck of his car in a rugged mountain canyon. A hiker found the body of I8yearold Jesse B. Stephenson yesterday about two miles from his home in Los Angeles County. The young man had been on holiday leave from an Air Force base in Little Rock, Ark.

title: Annual Dip in Lake Michigan
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 1 (AP)Members of Wisconsin's Polar Bear Club took to Lake Michigan's icy waters today as is their annual New Year's Day custom. Club members here and in Sheboygan shed winter coats, gloves, galoshes and scarves in nearzero temperatures and scampered into the lake, where the water temperature was about 34 degrees. The windchill factor, based on wind and temperature, registered about 30 below during the dips.

title: France to Ration Natural Gas
description: PARIS, Jan. 1 French authorities have decided to ration natural gas this month, cutting back supplies to industrial users mainly in the southern and central regions of the country by as much as 50 per cent.

title: Text of Beame's Address
description: Fallowing is the text of Mayor Beanie's inaugural address:

title: 4,000 Throng Lobby of the Met For Reception Honoring Beanie
description: More than 4,000 invited guests crammed into the lobby of the Metropolitan Opera House at Lincoln Center yesterday afternoon, and they all seemed to have come for one purpose: to shake the hand of Mayor Beame.

title: EndofYear Marriages Up Because of Taxes
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Jan. 1 (UPI)A justice of the peace says the marriage business boomed last weekend and yesterday, thanks, in part, to Federal tax laws.

title: In the Theater, the Best Dressers Don't Always Wear the Clothes
description: If behind every great man there is a little woman who finds his socks and sees that his tie is straight, behind every theatrical performance there is an anonymous someone called a dresser waiting in the wings.

title: State Lauds Scope of Farm Districts Experiment
description: ALBANY, Dec. 30More than one million acres of prime farmland came under the protection of agricultural districts throughout the state during the first two years of an experiment to preserve farming as a major industry and way of life in New York.

title: 700 ARE STRANDED ON 2 AMTRAK TRAINS
description: More than 700 persons spent a chilly New Year's Day stranded aboard Amtrak trains, one stalled at Galesburg, Ill., another at Klamath Falls, Ore.

title: Irish Saga: Out One Ara and In Another
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 1Maybe it was what Coach Ara Parseghian had felt all alongthat this Notre Dame team, despite its youth, was just loose enough, just cool enough to pull off anything under pressure. Anything.

title: Tract Offered to U.S. As a Wildlife Refuge
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1 (UPI)A conservation group says it will give the Federal Government 343 square miles of central New Mexico land, provided that the government preserves it as a wildlife refuge and research area.

description: Morning

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WOODBRIDGE, Jan. 1Steve Mizerak teaches spelling and geography to seventh graders at the William C. McGinnis middle school in Perth Amboy, then hustles off to work with a different type of chalk and Englishat a Metuchen pool hall (the Four Seasons) he owns with Stan McDowell.

title: 211.7 Million in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 1 (UPI) With the start of the new year, the Census Bureau estimated that there were 211.7 million people in the United States. The total represented a 1.5 million net gainor 0.7 per centover the beginning of 1973.

title: Le Mans Survives Oil Crisis
description: PARIS, Jan. 1Auto racing in France has been given New Year's reprieve and all Le Mans is celebrating.

title: Covens Tops East AllStar Vote
description: Dave Cowens, the Boston Celtics center, who was the most valuable player in last year's National Basketball Association All Star Game, was the leading votegetter for the Eastern Conference team for this season's contest, it. was announced yesterday by Commissioner Walter Kennedy.

title: Crosby Ill With Pleurisy
description: BURLINGAME, Calif., Jan. 1 (AP)Bing Crosby was reported in satisfactory condition today after having been hospitalized for treatment of pleurisy, an inflammation of the membrane around the lungs. The 69yearold singer entered Peninsula Hospital here yesterday.

title: Mr. Nixon's Last 1,000 Days
description: Among many who long at the beginning of the New Year for a new Government and a new spirit in America, there is still a reluctance to call for the resignation or impeachment of the President, something that holds them back, probably some fear that somehow this would weaken the Presidency and harm the nation.

title: Leeds's Soccer Streak Now 24 Without a Loss
description: LONDON, Jan. 1 (UPI)Leeds United continued its recordshattering soccer season in the English League today, extending its unbeaten string to 24 games with a 11 tie with Tottenham Hotspur. Leeds has won 16 games.

title: Top Military Commanders Are Reassigned by Peking
description: HONG KONG, Wednesday, Jan. 2In a move of major political import, the Chinese leadership has put into effect) a sweeping reshuffle of positions among the nation's tops military leaders, a dispatch from Hsinhua, the official Chinese press agency, revealed this morning.

title: 30 Presented at New Year's Ball
description: Thirty young women were presented last night at the 52nd Debutante Assembly and New Year's Ball in the Grand Ballroom at the WaldorfAstoria. Miss Susan A. Giannestras and her escort led the grand march at the dinner dance, for which Mrs. Robert Stith Williams Jr. is chairman.

title: Herman Steinlauf 76, Founder Of Sporting Goods Stores, Dies
description: Herman Steinlauf, founder and chairman of Herman's World of Sporting Goods, which grew from three stores in the nineteentwenties to the present 32, died yesterday at Doctors Hospital. His age was 76 and he lived at 140, Riverside Drive.

title: ExChief in Ulster on the Honors List
description: LONDON, Wednesday, Jan. (Reuters)Queen Elizabeth's New Year's honors list today awarded recognition to the Government's troubleshooter, William Whitelaw; a leading trade unionist, Victor Feather. and the soccer star Bobby Charlton.

title: The Penitent Seers
description: Ecnomists, like inveterate horse players, cannot kick the forecasting habit, no matter how badly they have been doing lately. It was indeed penitent and humble band of

description: LONDON, Jan. 1 (UPI)Leeds United continued its recordshattering soccer season in the English League today, extending its unbeaten string to 24 games with a 11 tie with Tottenham Hotspur. Leeds has won 16 games.

title: Darkness at Noon
description: Gulag Archipelago, Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn's new history of Soviet police terror and the subhuman prison camp network, is less important for what it says than for what it leaves unsaid. This horrifyingly detailed account of repression in the Soviet Union from 1918 to 1956 takes on its real importance from the suggestion that the police system it describes continues to this day. The infamous network of slave labor camps remains in operation, even if the numbers imprisoned have been vastly reduced since the amnesties granted by the Khrushchev regime.

title: Presence of Pathet Lao Is Calmly Accepted by Laotians Near Royal Capital
description: BAN PAKOU, LaosThe people in the Governmentheld areas of Luang Prabang Province have accepted the presence of the Communistled Pathet Lao as calmly as they accept the silvergray mist that floats down from the mountains and chills the towns until about 10 o'clock on most winter mornings.

title: PENTAGON'S FUEL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1Contrary to earlier predictions, civilian airlines have not used any of the 1.5 million barrels of military fuel that was allotted to them by the Government before Christmas for peak

title: Train Crash in Austria Kills. Driver and Hurts 6 Tourists
description: VIENNA, Wednesday, Jan. 2 (Reuters)  A 40yearold Austrian was killed and six French tourists were injured in a train crash involving the crack Vorarlberg Express from Paris to Vienna last night, an Austrian railways spokesman said today.

title: Radio
description: 110 A.M., WNCN. Ballet Music from Faust, Gounod; Symphony No. 35, Mozart; Coriolanus Overture, Beethoven; Beautiful Galatea Overture, Von Suppe; Sinfonia in D, Torelli; Pique Dame Overture, Von Suppe; Overture to La Scala de Seta, Rossini; Musetta's Waltz from La Boheme, Puccini; Night of the Tropics, Gottschalk; Overture No. 1 in E minor, Arne; Overture to Beatrice and Benedict, Paderewski.
