description: HONG KONG, Jan. 3  The extensive reshuffle of military commands in China revealed in Peking on New Year's Day is viewed by analysts here as the most significant and dramatic development involving the military in China since the death of Defense Minister Lin Piao in September,, 1971, reportedly after an attempted coup d'etat.

title: British Suspect Tie Between the I. R. A. And Palestinians
description: LONDON, Jan. 3 (AP)British security forces are convinced that extremist guerrilla ;groups are linking up for coordinated terrorist campaigns throughout the world, an intelligence expert said today.

title: POMPIDOU PREDICTS MIDEAST TRUCE ONLY
description: PARIS, Jan. 3President Pompidou of France predicted today that the Geneva talks on the Middle East would probably produce a prolonged armistice rather than a real peace.

title: 70 Gas Stations Ordered To Roll Back High Prices
Japan's Foreign Minister Lands In Peking to Begin Trade Talks
description: PEKING, Jan. 3Foreign Minister Masayoshi Ohira of Japan arrived tonight for a threeday visit during which he will discuss trade and international relations with Chinese leaders.

title: Briefs on Energy
description: Consolidated Edison saved the equivalent of 142,000 barrels Of oil in the week that ended Dec. 30 as New York households and businesses continued to conserve energy. Compared with last year, electricity consumption was down 7.8 per cent, steam 8.5 per cent and natural gas 4.8 per cent. The threeclay holiday work week at many businesses and a 3 per cent voltage reduction that began Dec. 24 contributed to the savings. Since Oct. 28, the utility reported, customers have saved the equivalent of 562,000 barrels oil, threefifths from saved electricity and twofifths from steam.

title: Gasoline Truck Carrying 3,000 Gallons Hijacked
description: A tank truck loaded with 3,000 gallons of gasoline was hijacked at gunpoint last night at Commerce and Zarega Avenues in the Westchester section of the Bronx, the police reported.

title: SelfDestructing City
description: In city development, nothing fails like success. There is no question now about the successful regeneration Lower Manhattan. The new downtown construction strong on civic responsibility and superior urban design. With last week's action by the Board of Estimate furthering creation of two complete new communities, Battery Park City and Manhattan Landing, Lower Manhattan about to become not only the world's most dramatic urban experience, but a place to live as well as work.

title: Truck With 5,343 Cartons Of Illegal Cigarette Seized
description: A panel truck containing 5,343 cartons of cigarettes was seized by the police last night in Astoria, Queens, and the operator of the truck was arrested and charged with possession of untaxed cigarettes, a felony.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
Kodak to Raise Outlays
description: The Eastman Kodak Company said yesterday that it planned capital expenditures totaling $516million this year. Expenditures in 1973 came to $360million. The capital budget this year includes $229million for the United States and Canadian photographic division, $194million for the Eastman chemicals division and $93million for the international photographic division.

title: TV: On College Money Crunch and the Right to Die
description: The postNew Year's sobering process has started in earnest at the network news departments. Last night at 10 o'clock, the National Broadcasting Company examined the soaring costs of education in The College Money Crunch. Tomorrow night at 8 o'clock, the American Broadcasting Company's CloseUp series looks at the The Right to Die in terms of modernmedicine miracles that can prolong life, ,perhaps against the patient's wishes.

title: PLANNERS REJECT TENAFLY PROJECT
description: TENAFLY, Jan, 3  A controversial proposal to construct a housing development in wooded undeveloped tract near the Palisades Interstate Park way has been rejected by Tenafly's Planning Board as totally contrary to the density concept in the borough's imaster plan.

title: ELSIE S. PARKER
description: DREXEL HILL, Pa., Jan, 3Elsie Scott Parker, retired managing editor of The National Civic Review, formerly the National Municipal Review, published in New York by the National Municipal League, died Tuesday in a nursing home in Upper Darby. She was 82 years: old and lived here.

title: Poll Finds Public Support for Press as Adversary to Government
Arthur Daley, Sports Columnist, Dies
description: Arthur Daley, whose sports columns for The New York Times won him a Pulitzer Prize, died while on his way to work Yesterday, apparently of heart attack. He was 69 years old.

title: Opera: A New Lindoro
description: Enrico Di Giuseppe is a tenor who has learned that the most direct way to win acclaim from casual operagoers is to belt out the biggest tones possible. He has generally gets along with it well enough.

title: All Safe in Bus Accident
description: DEER LAKE, Pa., Jan. 3 (AP)  Muhammad Ali escaped injury when his private bus skidded on an icy hill and struck an embankment today. Ali, who was driving the bus, was taking a group of people from his training camp in this wooded area near Reading to Philadelphia when the accident occurred.

title: Socal to Spend $1.6Billion
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 3 (UPI)The Standard Oil Company of California said it planned expenditures of $1.6billion this year for capital improvements and exploration. This will represent a 40 per cent increase over the expenditures of $1.2billion last year, the company said.

title: Henri (the Other) Filion Savors His 3Victory Night at Roosevelt
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Jan. 3Henri Filion was still bubbling joyfully today at Roosevelt Raceway, in recollection of his feat of driving three winners the night before. He took especial deAt the light in exclaiming, And I beat Race Herve twice. Tracks Herve, of course, is the most famous of the seven Filion brothers, all natives of Angers, Quebec, and all engaged in driving harness horses in various parts of the United States and Canada.

title: Henri (the Other) Filion Savors His 3Victory Night at Roosevelt
description: WESTBURY, L. I, Jan. 3Henri Filion was still bubbling joyfully today at Roosevelt Raceway, in recollection of his feat of driving three winners the night before. He took especial delight in exclaiming, And I beat Herve twice. Herve, of course, is the most famous of the seven Filion brothers, all natives of Angers, Quebec, and all engaged in driving harness horses in various parts of the United States and Canada.

title: December Retail Sales Up
OLIN AND CONALCO COMPLETE A DEAL
description: The sale of the Olin Corporation's aluminum business to the Consolidated Aluminum Corporation (Conalco) for $126million was completed yesterday. An agreement for the sale was announced on Sept. 21. Included in the sale are Olin's aluminum sheet and plate mill and eight other fabricating plants, and a half ownership in the Ormet Corporation.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Canada to Regulate Campaign Financing
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 3Canada's House of Commons adopted tough new rules today to govern the financing of election campaigns.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: On Menhaden
Price Depends on Whether Oil Is Old, New, Foreign or Domestic
Bill to Ease Rail Regulations Drafted
description: WASHINGTON, Jan 3 (UPI) The Administration has drafted a bill to relax Federal and state regulation of railrOads, while pouring $2billion In  Government  guaranteed loans into railroad facilities and freight car fleets.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Irish Rated No. 1, But Falter on TV
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SALE OF FORD PLANS BRINGS 60DAY TERM
description: DETROIT, Jan. 3 (AP)  A Ford Motor Company engineer was sentenced today to 60 days in jail and ordered to pay $10,000 fine for selling patented blueprints toa Portuguese concern.

title: Dutch Will Clear Shipments of Oil Slated for Belgium
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 3  The Netherlands, against which the Arab oil producers have declared an embargo, will allow Arab oil destined for Belgium to pass through the port of !Rotterdam, according to a Belgian foreign ministery

title: Drivers Waiting to Fill Empty Tanks Pour Out Their Many Tales of Woe
4 DRUG DEALERS ARE SENTENCED
description: Prison sentences of 12 to 18 years were imposed yesterday on four narcotics dealers who were permitted t6 spend Thanksgiving at home after their conviction last Nov. 21.

title: NIXON IS PLANNING APPEAL ON ENERGY TO 20 COUNTRIES
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan, 3President Nixon will make a personal effort to persuade major oilproducing and oilconsuming nations to band together to ease the energy crisis, Secretary of State Kissinger announced today.

title: Yankees Name Virdon, ExPirate, as Manager
description: Although not abandoning the idea of hiring Dick Williams eventually, the New York Yankees named Bill Virdon, dismissed by the Pittsburgh Pirates late last season, as their manager yesterday for the 1974 season. Virdon signed a oneyear contract.

title: Preparing for the Future
description: Today we are talking a great deal here about interdependence. The word has been around long enough nowsince at least 1963, when President Kennedy made his famous declaration of interdependenceso much so I regard it as a clich. The root is dependence, and that, in fact, is the condition that we and the rest of the world find ourselves in. It means, according to Mr. Webster, unable to exist, sustain oneself, or act normally without the assistance of others.

title: Bodies Found in Lake
description: JACKMAN, Me., Jan. 3 (AP) Divers recovered the bodies of two young people yesterday from 20 feet of water in Big Wood Lake here after their; nowmobile fell through some ice. The victims were identified as Peter Coro, 19 years old, of Jackman, and Dorothy McAfee, about 20, of Greenville.

title: BROKER CHARGES BANK WITH FRAUD
description: Officers of the National Bank of North America, a large New Yorkbased institution, allegedly solicited and received payoffs from a financially troubled shipping company in return for approving more than $7million in apparently illegal loans, according to documents filed in United States District Court here.

title: CRIME TASK FORCE GETS NEW DIRECTOR
description: ALBANY, Jan. 3 (AP) Assistant Attorney General Maxwell B. Spoont has been selected to head the state's Organized Crime Task Force, succeeding Robert E. Fischer.

title: O'Hare Busiest in 1973
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 3 (UPI) O'Hare International Airport retained its status as the world's busiest airport in 1973, landling arrivals and deparures of a record 695,304 airraft, the Federal Aviation kdministration's Great Lakes egional office said this week.

title: NIX0N IS PLANNING APPEAL ON ENERGY TO 20 COUNTRIES
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 3President Nixon will make a personal effort to persuade major oilproducing and oil. consuming nations to band together to ease the energy crisis, Secretary of State Kissinger announced today.

title: Ailing Dent Forfeits to Tennis Foe
description: SYDNEY, Jan. 3 (Reuters) Phil Dent of Australia, who was seeded fourth, retired because of shoulder trouble today in the third round of the New South Wales open tennis championships.

title: United States Government and Agency Bonds
Israelis Obstruct Supplies For Egypt's Sinai Forces
description: CAIRO, Jan. 3  A United Nations spokesman said today that Israeli troops obstructed the movement of nonmilitary supplies yesterday to elements of the Egyptian Third Army that are cut off on the Sinai Peninsula, on the east bank of the Suez Canal.

title: Bridge: Fisher to Get Another Crack C. At the World Open Pair Title
description: The United States representatives have never succeeded in winning the World Open, Pair Championship, which has gone once to France, once to Holland and once to Austria. The closest any of the United States players have come was in 1966, when Jim Jacoby and Dr. John Fisher, both of Dallas, were beaten into second place in a photofinish.

title: GIFTS TO NEEDIEST SENT IN GOODWILL
CANADA TO RAISE OILEXPORT TAX
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 3The Canadian Government indicated today that it intended to nearly I triple its tax on oil exports to the United States next month because of soaring world prices.

title: Books of The Times
description: It was a sensible precaution to print the words a suspense novel on the cover of The Ambassador and the Spy because the book is so well written that many readers might never have known. Though guns are fired and one of the two principal characters is a spy, Mr. Brome's book could. if he chose, have come naked into the world as a novel, without the qualifying adjective. In fact. I wonder why all novels should not have this encouraging legend on their covers to remind readers that suspense is as much the business of art as it is of entertainment. Have you read the suspense novel Crime and Punishment by Fyodor Dostoyevsky? The Good Soldier by Ford Madox Ford? Moby Dick by Herman Melville?

title: Yankees Name Virdon, ExPirate, as Manager
description: Although not abandoning the idea of hiring Dick Williams eventually, the New York Yankees named Bill Virdon, dismissed by the Pittsburgh Pirates late last season, as their manager yesterday for the 1974 season. Virdon signed a oneyear contract.

title: ... and Judging Judges
description: Mayor Beame deserves credit for declining to reappoint a criminal court judge with strong Democratic links in Queens, who was recommended neither by the (Lindsayoriginated) Mayor's Committee on the Judiciary nor by the judiciary committee of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York.

title: Briefs on Energy
description: Consolidated Edison saved the equivalent of 142,000 barrels of oil in the week that ended Dec. 30 as New York households and businesses continued to conserve energy. Compared with last year, electricity consumption was down 7.8 per cent, steam 8.5 per cent and natural gas 4.8 per cent. The threeday holiday work week at many businesses and a 3 per cent voltage reduction that began Dec. 24 contributed to the savings. Since Oct. 28, the utility reported, customers have saved the equivalent of 562,000 barrels oil, threefifths from saved electricity and twofifths from steam,

title: Margin Cut Lifts Stocks
description: Stock prices soared yesterday following the Federal Reserve Board's reduction in margin requirements to 50 per cent from 65 per cent. The DowJones industrial average rose 25.37 points to 880.69. Also helping the market was a lowering of the prime rate to 9 per cent from 10 per cent by Chase Manhattan. Details, Page 43.

title: Off Off Broadway
description: It is advisable to telephone theaters for schedules and prices before going to the show. Most, if not all, theaters accept Theater Development Fund vouchers.

title: Hospital Delays Admitting ExIsraeli Military Leader
description: One of Israel's former top military leaders, a retired general, was sent to Mount Sinai Hospital here as an emergency patient last month, and had to sit for an hour in the waiting room before being admitted because he did not have $3,080 as an advance payment for a projected twoandahalfweek stay, it was asserted yesterday by family members and two physicians handling his case.

title: A 10GALLON LIMIT ON GASOLINE URGED
Dealers See Panic Buying In Long Lines for Gasoline
description: Panic buying was blamed yesterday by gasoline manufacturers and retailers for the fact that, even while New York City motorists were lining up at pumps more often, they were doing less driving.

title: A DELAY BY TANKERS OFF SHORE IS DENIED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 (UPI) William E. Simon denied reports today that oil tankers were waiting off the United States coast in hopes of new oil price increases.

title: Gracie Mansion Gets a Beame Look
description: I was here J.V.L. 19651974. Good Bye. That was the message 13yearold John V. Lindsay Jr. had scribbled With a red marking pen on the closet door in his bedroom at Gracie Mansion.

title: J.D.Leonard Weds Paula S.Vogelsang
description: Roman Catholic Church here yesterday Miss Paula Siebs Vogelsang, a fashion designer, was married to John D.

title: ARABS RELUCTANT IN HIJACKER CASE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 3Palestinian sources report that Arab Governments are showing reluctance to allow any trial on their territory of the five Arab gunmen who killed 31 people at the Rome international airport Dec. 17 and hijacked an airliner to Athens, Damascus and Kuwait.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Film

title: PartTime Student, 20, Raped In Empty BMT Bowery Station
description: An armed man raped a 20yearold parttime student yesterday morning in the Bowery station of the BMT subway line, the transit police reported.

title: MCI Granted Injunction In Suit Against A.T. &T.
description: The MCI Communications Corporation reported yesterday that the United States District Court in Philadelphia had granted it a preliminary injuncLion in its suit to force the American Telephone and Telegraph Company to allow it to interconnect its equipment to Bell System equipment.

title: Soul City, N. C., Is Moving From Dream Stage to Reality
description: SOUL CITY, N. C., Jan. 3 Some of the older blacks living around the old Satterwhite place just south of the Virginia line in the green hills of North Carolina tobacco country still talk of the slave days, recalling where their grandparents worked in the fields and pointing out the place where the men were sometimes whipped as punishment.

title: Dublin Holding 15 In Drive on Rebels In Border Regions
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 3The Irish Government intensified its action today against suspected terrorists with the arrest of 30 men at four places close to the border of neighboring Northern Ireland. Fifteen were released but the rest were held for questioning.

title: TV: American Religious Experience
description: Religious America, produced for the Public Broadcasting Service by WGBHTV in Boston, begins a run of 13 weekly installations tomorrow evening at 8:30. Each episode is a halfhour in length, and each attempts to distill the peak essence of some variety of religious experience that can be found somewhere today in America.

title: Bridge: Solidity Often Gives a Bidder Better Support Than Length
description: A beginner learns that in notrump he should develop the longest combined suit in the partnership hands. This is a good general guide, but he eventually finds cases in which solidity is more important than length. A case in point is the diagramed deal, taken from George Coffin's famous collection of singledummy problems.

title: Airlines Say Cost of Fuel May Cause Bankruptcies
description: Soaring increases in jetfuel costs brought warnings from the airline industry yesterday that it would face bankruptcies or need massive government subsidy unless sharp new fare increases were authorized.

title: Vesco Sues the I.R.S. to Prevent Collection of $800,000 Taxes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.4 (Reuters)Robert L. Vesco has sued the Internal Revenue Service to prevent it from forcing him to pay more than $800,000 in back taxes.

title: Nixon Blocks Federal Aid For Buying of Local Buses
description: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif., Jan. 4President Nixon pocketvetoed today a bill that would have facilitated the use Federal funds for the purchase of local buses. In a memorandum of disapproval, the President said that the bill had become an antitransit measure.

title: Pop Music: Dylan Myth
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 4Bob Dylan didn't live up to his legend at the Chicago Stadium last night. But that legend was probably imposlible to live up to anyhow. By beginning with the early, relatively obscure Hero Blues, about his unwillingness to be somebody else's idol, and ending with Most Likely You Go Your Way, rit Go Mine, Mr. Dylan seemed to be declaring his Independence of his own myth. And on its own inevitably more circumscribed .terms, the opening concert here of his first nationwide tour in eight years did provide frequent moments of :genuine pleasure.

title: Cabbies Stage Brooklyn Blockade Over Fuel Crisis
description: About 300 independent cab drivers blockaded a Brooklyn gasoline station and the streets around it with their taxis for several hours yesterday to dramatize the reduction of their weekend operations following cutoff of fuel supplies.

title: We Regret His Departure
description: PARISThe United States has rarely had the diplomatic service it deserves, thanks to a tradition of political payoffs usually reserving key embassies for party contributors whose heads are often as fat as their wallets. Chip Bohlen, who died New Year's Day, was a glowing exception to that rule.

title: U.S. JOBLESS RATE ROSE IN DECEMBER TO 4.9% FROM 4.7%
description: The nation's unemployment rate rose in December for the second consecutive month, but the role of the energy shortage in the rise was still uncertain, the Labor Department reported today.

title: FLOOD SUIT FILED BY PENNSYLVANIA
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan, (AP)Pennsylvania filed suit in Federal court yesterday in an effort to force the Small Business Administration to re. open its assistance program to some flood victims in the state.

title: MRS. C. P. WATERMAN
description: Mrs. Clarence P. Waterman, who was a prominent Brooklyn clubwoman and later a successful real estate broker, died Monday at the Mary Manning Walsh Home, 1339 York Avenue. Her age was 84.

title: PAYMENTS APPROVED IN NEWSMAN'S DEATH
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 4 (UPI) 7 Superior Court Presiding Judge Alfred J. McCourtney approved yesterday distribution of a $700,000 Los Angeles County settlement to the family of Ruben Salazar, a newsman.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PFRONTEN, West Germany, Jan. 4 (UPI)Annemarie Proell of Austria flashed down the 2,022meter (about 11/4 miles) course in 1 minute 15.13 seconds today, the fastest time in nonstop training for tomorrow's World Cup downhill race and said, I didn't even go flat out. The next best time, 1:15.72, was by Claudia Giordani of Italy. A pair of Austrian girls placed third and fourth, Irmgard Lukasser in 1:15.96 and Brigitte Schroell in 1:15.98.

title: Tankless House Gets Oil
description: SOUTH PORTLAND, Me., Jan. 4 (AP)The Union Oil Company dumped 250 gallons of heating fuel on the cellar floor of a vacant house here and attributed it to a computer error and the theft of an oil tank. Officials said thieves had apparently made off with the oil tank on Wednesday. A company spokesman said a computer had failed to note that delivery was to be stopped.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ALL STARS A new stellar performance opened this week at the Hayden Planetarium, Central Park West and 81st Street (8731300). The new show on this astrodome is about us, that is, the earth on which we live. It rolls and hurtles through space, driving through many directions simultaneously at breakneck speeds, except that it doesn't break our necks because, because, well, it's very scientificgo see the show.

title: JOHN E. GROVES
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 4 John E. Groves, corporate vice president for industrial relations of Allegheny Ludlurn Industries, died last Friday following a cerebral hemorrhage. He was 53 years old.

title: CHESIMARD MOVE DENIED BY COURT
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Jan. 4Superior Court Judge Leon Gerofsky this evening denied a change of venue motion to move the selectiori of a jury for the trial of Joanne Chesimard and Clark E. Squire from Morris County.

title: SUPPLY BLOCKADE LIFTED BY ISRAEL
description: CAIRO, Jan. 4An Israel blockade of food and other non. military supplies for element: of Egypt's Third Army and the city of Suez was reported today to have been lifted after the United Nations interceded with the Israeli Army and Govern. ment.

title: St. Louis U. Retains Soccer Title
description: MIAMI, Jan. 4Dan Counce scored two goals tonight, the second one in the suddendeath overtime, in leading St. Louis University to its 10th National Collegiate Athletic Association soccer championship. The Billikens defeated the University of California, Los Angeles, 21.

title: POWER EXPORT CURB LIFTED BY CANADA
description: The Canadian National Energy Board announced yesterday that it had lifted a net export limit on electric power from the Ontario HydroElectric Power Commission. The net effect will almost double the amount of electricity that can be exported to the United States.

title: U.S. INVESTMENTS UPSET CANADIANS
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 4  The Canadian Government is increasingly concerned about American corporations that it believes are hurrying to invest in businesses in this country before the effective date of a. new law that will limit such investment.

title: Dr. Hubert M. Thaxter Dies; City College Math Teacher
description: Dr. Hubert Mack Thaxter, member of the City College mathematics department, died Thursday evening of a cardiac arrest at Presbyterian Medical Center. He was 64 years old and lived at 409 Edgecombe Avenue.

title: Nixon Blocks Federal Aid For Buying of Local Buses
description: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif., Jan. 4President Nixon pocketvetoed today a bill that would have facilitated the use Federal funds for the purchase of local buses. In a memorandum or disapproval, the President said that the bill had become an antitransit measure.

title: Pitcairn Island Sends Radio Plea for Fuel
description: GLENDALE, Calif., Jan. 4 (UPI)The descendants of the mutineers from H.M.S. Bounty, who settled Pitcairn Island in 1790, are caught in the energy crisis.

title: Winchester Rink Gains in Curling
description: MOUNT HOPE, N.Y., Jan. 4 The defending champion Winchester (Mass); Curling Club, skipped by Stanley Neill, scored twice in the 10th end todak and defeated Potomac C.C. of Washington, skipped by Jack Murray,, 87. The Winchester victory filled the quarterfinal brackets in the 39th annual Douglas Medal bonspiel at St. Andrew's Golf Club.

title: Vietnamese Reach Accord on Prisoners
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan, 4The South Vietnamese Government and the Vietcong's Provisional Revolutionary Government agreed in principle today to resume the prisoner exchange that broke off in dispute in July.

title: HUMPHREY TAKING TUMOR TREATMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, is suffering from a tumor of the bladder and has been undergoing Xray treatments since the first week in November, his physician said today.

title: Defense Bid for Venue Change Case Is
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Jan. 4Superior Court Judge Leon Gerofsky this evening denied a change of venue motion to move the selection of a jury for the trial of Joanne Chesimard and Clark E. Squire from Morris County.

title: 2 Exchanges Open Today To Clear Work Backlog
description: The New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Exchange will be open today but not for trading purposes.

title: Store Safes Advance
description: WASHINGTON,: Jan. 4The Department of Commerce rei ported today that depdrtmet store sales last week were an estimated $1.338billiori, up 41 per cent from last year's levtil. of $950Million. Retail: store sales were about $9.863billion tip 11 per cent from last year's $8.911billion.

title: Flawed Budget
description: The $1.52billion capital budget submitted to Mayor Beame by the City Planning Commission is in many respects an admirable document, a lucid exposition programs and priorities that merits wider readership than it is likely to receive. The 197374 capital expenditure proposals are especially notable in that they reflect for the first time a determined effort by the commission incorporate community priorities recommended by 62 district planning boards, a budgeting breakthrough which We trust will receive as solid support from the new administration as it received from the old.

title: FREDERICK AYER, US, AIDE ABROAD
description: Frederick Ayer Jr., a former top Federal Bureau of Investigation agent and an author whose books included Before the Colors Fade, a memoir of his uncle, Gen. George S. Patton, died yesterday of a heart attack in Tucker's Town, Bermuda, where he was on vacation. He was 57 years old and lived in Wenham, Mass.

title: Skylab 3 Crew Near a Record for Time in Space
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 4 (UPI)The Skylab 3 astronauts, watching a dimming comet Kohoutek, moved closer to a record for time in space today and now trail only the Skylab 2 crew for endurance.

title: Singles Bars Swing Into the Suburbs
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Jan. 4The singles begin drift in by 8 P.M., the men alone or in pairs, the women in twos or threes. Small talk, banter and comeons mingle with the drinks, becoming by 10 or 11 P.M. brew bubbling up all over suburbia.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE BANK BOOK. By Morgan Irving as audited by Charles Sopkin. 246 pages. Little, Brown. $6.95

title: New Chief Executive at Pennsy Named in Management Changes
description: In a major executive shakeup William H. Moore relinquished the post of president and chief executive officer of the Penn Central Transportation Company yesterday and Jervis Langdon Jr., a trustee of the bankrupt corporation since July, 1970, was selected to replace him.

title: SCHOOLS TO STICK TO COALBURNING
description: The city's public school system has abandoned a plan to convert to oilheating 400 schools that now burn coal, according to Dr. Bernard R. Gifford, the deputy chancellor for operations.

title: Brooklyn's Broadway Joe Is Hunted by Arson Squad
description: The Broadway that rum between the BedfordStuy vesant and Bushwick sections of Brooklyn is not the Broadway of bright lights. ..and theatrical extravaganzas It is not the street that is usually associated with the name Broadway Joe, a nick. name commonly applied tc glamorous Manhattan characters.

title: No.CarolinaState Tops North Carolina, 78 to 77
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Jan. 4 (UPI)  Tommy Burleson and David Thompson combined for 42 points tonight as fifth  ranked North Carolina State scored a 7877 victory over fourthranked North Carolina in the Big Four basketball tournament. It was the Tar Heels first loss in eight games.

title: 4th Mideast Arms Talk Held in Geneva
description: GENEVA, Jan, 4Egyptian and Israeli military negotiators held their fourth meeting here today on the separation of their forces on the Suez Canal front, apparently confining their discussions to the technical issues involved.

title: Railroad freight Traffic Is Reported Down by 5%
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United Slates railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 11.3 billion tonmiles, down 5 per cent from the level a year ago.

title: Opposition Ends Labor's Rule in Tel Aviv
description: TEL AVIV, AVIV, Jan 4A new municipal coalition headed by the Likud, Israel's major opposition group, was formed here today, ending 18 years of Labor party rule in coalition with religious parties.

title: BURCH WILL MEET CONSUMER GROUPS
description: Representatives of more than 160 consumer and community organizations from various parts of the country will appear before the Federal Communications Commission in Washington on Jan. 14 to submit their views on several broadcast issues under consideration by the F.C.C.

title: CANNED MUSHROOMS ARE BEING RECALLED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI)The Food and Drug Administration said today that thousands of fourounce cans of mushrooms from a packing company in Temple, Pa., and distributed under 18 brand names were being recalled because of contamination that could lead to botulism poisoning.

title: Kissinger Cites Progress After Session With Dayan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 Secretary of State Kissinger said today that he and Defense Minister Moshe Dayan of Israel had made progress in a twoandahalfhour meeting aimed at providing momentum for the talks in Geneva on the separation of Israeli and Egyptian forces.

title: 3 Tourneys Designated As Musts for Golf Stars
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 4Golf's superstars will be compelled to participate in three designated tournaments this year, Joseph C. Dey, commissioner of the Tournament Players Division, announced today,

title: Bonds for Sports Complex Get LowerMedium Rating
description: I The two most influential companies that rate bonds disclosed yesterday that they regard the $295million bond issue to finance a new stadium and race track in New Jersey as a lower mediumgrade investment.

title: GERMS IN SHAMPOO FORCE U.S. RECALL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) An estimated total of 16.800 pints of baby shampoo contaminated with bacteria are being recalled from the market in four Eastern states, the Food and Drug Administration announced today.

title: Mrs. Dodge's Will Fought By Own Animal Shelter
400 IN NASHVILLE FOR RITTER FUNERAL
description: NASHVILLE, Jan. 4 (AP)Country music celebrities, government officials and family members paid their respects today to Tex Ritter as music warmed a bonechilling day in the country music mecca of the world.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The State Department of Motor Vehicles reported yesterday in Albany that gasoline shortages and a lower speed limit apparently contributed to a sharp reduction New York State traffic deaths during November. According to Motor Vehicle Commissioner Arnold R. Fisher, the 213 fatalities reported for November were 77 fewer than a year ago, a drop of 26.6 per cent.

title: Judge Refuses to Dismiss Charges Against Beckwith
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 4 (AP) A Federal judge refused yesterday to dismiss charges in firearms case against Byron De La Beckwith, tried twice but !never convicted of murdering the civil rights leader Medgar Evers 10 years ago.

title: Drivers Face Another Weekend Of Lines and Rising Fuel Prices
description: Harried motorists in the metropolitan area stocked up yesterday for what promised to be another difficult weekend for gasoline seekers.

title: Telex Wants Cited for Contempt
description: The Telex Corporation has asked the United States District Court in Tulsa, Okla., for a contempt citation against the International Business Machines Corporation.

title: To Liza (With a Z) New York Is Still the Big Apple
description: Can you believe it, Liza Mlnnelli said. They spelled my name wrong on the tickets.

title: Wilson Names Appellate Chief Here
description: Governor Wilson yesterday designated Justice Owen McGivern, a Democrat and a friend since both men entered the Assembly as freshmen 35 years ago, as presiding justice of the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court, First Department.

title: City Asked for $8Million to Pay For OutofState Trash Disposal
description: The city's Environmental Protection Administration is asking for $8million to pay for outofstate disposal of garbage in abandoned strip mines.

title: Brooklyn's Broadway Joe Is Hunted by Arson Squad
description: The Broadway that runs between the BedfordStuyvesant and Bushwick sections of Brooklyn is not the Broadway of bright lights and theatrical extravaganzas. It is not the street that is usually associated with the name Broadway Joe, a nickname commonly applied to glamorous Manhattan characters.

title: ABDUCTION SUSPECT FOUND WITH INFANT
description: AMARILLO, Tex., Jan. 4 (UPI)$A teenaged girl accused of kidnapping a 15monthold boy early this week in Las Vegas was arrested today as she and the baby left a commercial bus.

title: WILSON IS SEEKING MORTGAGE CHANGE
description: Governor Wilson intends to ask the Legislature to force banks to pay interest on the mortgage escrow accounts they require of homeowners.

title: Coal Gasification Process for Pilot Plant Is Patented
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Department of the Interior received a patent this week for a coal gasification process that is to be tested in a $30million pilot plant now under construction. The department's Office of Coal Research regards the process, for which Ernest E. Donath was granted Patent 3,782,913, as a very significant step in its program. The twostage procedure turns coal into gas that is rich in methane and suitable for home heating and industrial use. The process can also be used in the production of synthetic oil and gasoline. Patents of the Week

title: Dr. White's Estate $75,000; Trust Will Benefit Widow
description: BELMONT, Mass., .Tan. 4 (AP) Dr. Paul Dudley White, the heart specialist who died last Oct. 31, left an estate of $75, 000, according to his will filed at Middlesex Probate Court.

title: RectorySchool Head Voted
description: POMFRET, Conn., Jan. 4Carl L. Kempner, president of the hoard of trustees of the Rectory School here, announced today that John A. Green had been elected unanimously to succeed the present headmaster, John B. Bigelow, who will end a 4Iyear career at the school next July. Mr. Green, 42 years old, is now dean of faculty and students at Avon Old Farms School.

title: Saudi Oil Production Reported Down 35%
description: LONDON, Jan. 4 (AP)The chairman of the Esso Petroleum Company of London said today that Saudi Arabia's December oil production was 35 per cent below the output that had been expected before Middle East broducing countries began production cuts.

title: POSNER WILL RUN FOR REELECTION
description: Assemblyman Seymour Posner, Bronx Democrat  Liberal, who said last summer that he was fed up with politics and was seeking honest employment, declared yesterday that he had decided to run again because of improved conditions in his district.

title: Redistricting Has Been an Issue 3 Times in Last 6 Years Here
description: Three times in the last six years the State Legislature has already been faced with the delicate and politically explosive task of remapping New York's Congressional districts here.

title: FUND DISCLOSURE UPHELD BY COURT
description: OLYMPIA, Wash., Jan. 4 (AP) Citing the public's right to know to what extent money and persuasion influence government, the Washington Supreme Court upheld today strict disclosure law for public officials and lobbyists.

title: OIL IMPORTS SHOW BIG DROP IN WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Oil, statistics made public today indicated that the Arab embargo was having a delayed effect and that further declines in oil imports might occur in January.

title: Chicago Fans Welcome Dylan in First Tour Stop
description: CHICAGO, Jam 4 A few blocks away from the packed stadium where a song about having one foot on the highway, the other foot in the grave was to be sung, a cluster of hobos and winos stood in the freezing night air outside a dilapidated mission, waiting for a free meal.

title: Airlines Say Cost of Fuel May Cause Bankruptcies
description: Soaring increases in jetfuel costs brought warnings from the airline industry yesterday that it would face bankruptcies or need massive government subsidy unless sharp new fare increases were authorized.

title: PHILIP J. DUNLAY
description: DIX HILLS, L. L, Jan. 3 Philip J. Dunlay, a partner in the New York law firm of Dewey, Ballantine, Bushby, Palmer & Wood. died in Huntington today after a long illness. He was 52 years old and lived here.

title: Senate Democrats Keep Courtesy Rule
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, Jan. 4The Democratic majority of the incoming New Jersey Senate Voted today to retain the practice of senatorial courtesy, which allows a state Senator to Secretly block gubernatorial appointments in his home district.

title: HalfFare Payoff
description: Although the Metropolitan Transportation Authority's halffare Sundays have not yet reached the breakeven point financially, and may never do so, the experiment is already paying off handsomely where it counts most in attracting new riders to mass transit.

title: Operation Defiance
description: In rejecting the Senate Watergate committee's subpoenas of the White House tapes and documents, President Nixon has once again shifted from earlier promises of maximum disclosure to his original posture of defiance. By his action, Mr. Nixon has moved at least the Senate's part of the investigation . back to that earlier stage a potential constitutional confrontation.

title: BOC Financial Corp, Begins Its Paymeni For Shares of Airco
description: The BOC Financial Corporation, a subsidiary of the British Oxygen Company of London, announced yesterday it had begun payment for the 4 million common shares of Airco, Inc. that it is purchasing un der its recent tender offer to buy Airco common shares. BOC Financial also said the 4 million shares being purchased represented 64.6 per cent of the 6,189,898 Airco shares tendered. It said the remaining 2,189,898 shares were being returned. Airco, leading producer of industrial gases and ferroalloys, has 11,315,199 common shares outstanding.

title: School Board 1 Is Ousted By Court
description: Federal Judge Charles E. 'stewart Jr. formally removed the members of the District school board yesterday and empowered School Chancellor Irving Anker to govern the strifetorn Lower East Side district pending a new board election.

title: Post Raises Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Washington Post has increased its home delivery subscription prices because of a substantial rise in publishing costs. The increases went into effect on Jan. 1. Daily and Sunday home delivery prices went up from 98 cents to $1.10 per week and from $4.25 to $4.75 per month. Daily only home delivery prices increased from 60 cents to 72 cents a week and from $2.66 to $3.10 a month.

title: EXXON IS REQUESTED TO YIELD CONCESSION
description: CARACAS, Jan. 4 (Reuters) The Venezuelan Government today asked a subsidiary of the Exxon Corporation to relinquish a concession granted it for oil exploration over .two areas totaling 14,500 acres in eastern Venezuela, which will revert to the state.

title: Controlling the Boom in Vermont
description: MONTPELIER, Vt.For two centuries, Vermonters have been wedded to the land. They have farmed it, logged it, hunted and fished upon it. They have tamed it with respect. They understand its capacity. Conservation is not a passing fancy in Vermont. It is an applied science.

title: Bank of England Cuts Lending Rate to 12%
description: LONDON, Jan. 4 (UPI)The Bank of England announced today that it was cutting its minimum lending rate by onequarter of a percentage point to 124 per cent. It had been at a record of 13 per cent since Nov. 13.

title: Demolition Work Begun On the Liner Elizabeth
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 4 (AP)  Workers today began breaking up the wreck of the liner Queen Elizabeth, which was destroyed by fire two years ago. Demolition of the halfsunken ship is expected to take three years.

title: Britain Charges U.S. Woman as Terrorist
description: LONDON, Jan. 4 (AP)British authorities charged an American woman and two male friends otday with arms conspiracy, and said they had seized a second American woman for questioning about international terrorism.

title: STOCKS CONTINUE TO GAIN ON AMEX
WINE TALK 500 Londoners Find a Little Bit of Paris With HomeDelivered Wine
description: A handful of lucky Londoners are enjoying a service that Parisians have taken for granted for a hundred years: home delivery of wine. Still in the experimental stage, the service is provided to about 500 customers by a new company called Frenchoice Ltd., according to Harpers, the British wine trade magazine.

title: Solzhenitsyn Quoted as Saying He Expects Arrest Over Book
description: PARIS, Jan. 4Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn reportedly told two French lawyers at his wife's apartment in Moscow Monday that he expected to be arrested and tried for the foreign publication of his new book, The Gulag Archipelago, 19181956.

title: EXP.O.W. WILL RUN AGAINST M'GOVERN
description: SIOUX FALLS, S.D., Jan, 4 (AP)Leo K. Thorsness, a retired Air Air Force officer who spent six weeks as a prisoner of the North Vietnamese, announced that he would run for the United States Senate in 1974.

title: Airlines Say Cost of fuel May Cause Bankruptcies
description: Soaring increases in jetfuel costs, brought warnings from the airline industry yesterday that it would face bankruptcies or need massive government subsidy unless sharp new fare increases were authorized.

title: Gibson 4 Others Sign Cards'
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 4 (AP)Bob Gibson; who has the second,highest number of victories among active major league pitchers, is one of five St, Louis Cardinals playerS who have signed 1974 contracts, the club announced today.

title: Vesco Sues the I.R.S. to Prevent Collection of $800,000 Taxes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (Reuters)Robert L. Vesco has sued the Internal Revenue Service to prevent it from foraing him to pay more than $800,000 in back taxes.

title: Saudi Oil Production Reported Down 35%
description: LONDON, Jan. 4 (AP)The chairman of the Esso Petroleum Company of Landon said tbday that Saudi Arabia's December oil production was 35 per cent below the output that had been expected before Middle East producing countries began production cuts.

title: Drivers to Return to Jobs At Pittsburgh Newspapers
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 4 (AP)Officials of the Pittsburgh Press Company and a local of thE International Brotherhood of Teamsters announced today that 700 delivery truck driver. and circulation employes whc walked off their jobs yesterday would return to work while negotiations continue on a new contract.

title: 11 Jailed Czechoslovak Liberals Are Reportedly Released Early
description: PRAGUE, Jan. 4 (Reuters)Eleven Czechoslovak liberals sent to prison in the summer of 1972 on charges of subversion were released on probation shortly before Christmas, usually reliable sources said here today.

title: C.I.A. Chief Scores Order By Court to Give Up Data
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The director of Central Intelligence told a Federal judge this week that highly classified intelligence information might be "leaked to the public if the agency complied with the judge's recent order to make that information available to limited group of security experts.

title: Ashland Oil Sets Increase For Posted Crude Prices
description: Ashland Oil, Inc. said yester day that it would pay: $10 a barrel for various domestic new.. oil and Stripper well crude oil New oil and stripper prices ara, not regulated as is old oil, or oil that was discovered in the:: past. All domestic prices for oil are set by the purchaser, whoannounces or posts What price he Will pay for petroleum.

title: Public Interest Groups Join
description: BOSTON, Jan. 4 (AP)  The Eastern and Western Massachusetts Public Interest Groups two Ralph Naderinspired organizations  announced their merger yesterday into the Massachusetts Public Interest Research Group. Both groups have been active in regional consumer and environmental affairs.

title: COURT RULES DISTRICTING IN 3 BOROUGHS IS SUBJECT TO RACIAL FAIRNESS TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4A Federal District Court, applying the provisions of the 1970 Voting Rights Act to a Northern state for the first time, held today that Congressional and Legislative districts in Manhattan, Brooklyn and the Bronx were subject to the scrutiny of the Justice Department for racial fairness.

title: Bernard Geis Robbed
description: A gunman invaded the fifth floor offices of Bernard Geis Associates at 128 East 56th Street last evening and robbed $300 from Bernard Geis, the book publisher, $25 from an editor, and $115 from a California woman whose book the firm is editing, the police reported.

title: Briefs on Energy
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 4 (AP)Connecticut may subpoena the Army Corps of Engineers to obtain information about the state's oil supplies, a deputy attorney general said today.

title: Drivers Will Get Full Data
description: The 13 harness drivers accused of fixing superfecta races learned at their arraignment yesterday that they will get a chance to know the dates and races the Government has accused them of fixing.

title: Uruguay Devalues Peso
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 4(AP)  Uruguay's peso was devalued today by 2.2 per cent against the American dollar; tile Government announced. The new exchange rate would give the seller: of a dollar 947 pesos,

title: Peggy Michel Reaches Aussie Tennis Semifinal
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 4 (AP)Peggy Michel of Pacific Palisades, Calif., was the only American to survive the quarterfinals of the New South Wales tennis championships today.

title: Goodrich Is Chosen for West Team
description: The Western Conference team will have the tallest player Kareem AbdulJabbarand the .shortestGail Goodrichin the starting lineup for the National Basketball Association AllStar game against the East Jan. 15 at Seattle.

title: Private Jet is Damaged
description: JOHNSTOWN, Pa., (UPI) A private jet with seven businessmen aboard skidded on an ?? runway and made a belly landing yesterday when its landing gear buelded at JohnstonCambria County Airport in Pennsylvania.. The pilot and passengers, on a flight from Hartford, Conn., escaped injury. Damage to the $800,000 Lear jet was extensive, the authorities said.

title: 12 Quakers Win Suit to Bar Tax Allotment for Military
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 4 (UPI) The Government was enjoined yesterday from collecting 51.6 per cent of Federal income tax from two Quaker committee employes through the withholding method because it violates the free exercise of their re ligion.

title: The Daley Touch
description: With unashamed enthusiasm and sentiment, Arthur Daley took his readers on a marvelous journey from the golden age of sports in the nineteentwenties to the tacky age of electronic supersports and fake turf in the nineteenseventies. As often as possible, he traveled back into the past: when Yankees were Yankees; when the Original Celtics kept the scores low in what he liked call the dribble diversion; and when virtue triumphed in the ring for strong, silent men. When Joe Louis was once kidded for carrying a copy of The New York Times, he replied, I ain't no intellectual  I'M just a friend Arthur Daley.

title: Mrs. Jaffe Remarried
description: Mrs. Ernestine Bergman Jaffe, widow of Sanford S. Jaffe, was married here yesterday to David Rasch. Rabbi William Berkowitz performed the ceremony in his study at Congregation B'nai Jeshurun. The bride is chairman of the Carlton Group, New York Section, National Council of Jewish Women, and honorary chairman of the AntiDefamation League Women's Division. Mr. Rasch, a widower, is a vice president and senior counsel of the Sterling Drug Company.

title: Wilbur Cohen Gets Post
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP)Wilbur J. Cohen, former Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, has been elected the next president of the American Public Welfare Association, I was announced today. He will assume office next January.

title: Barkum Among 5 Added to Pro Bowl
description: Jim Bertelsen of Los Angeles, Wally Chambers of Chicago, Woody Peoples of San Francisco, Jim Carter of Green Bay and Jerome Barkurn of the Jets were named yesterday to replace injured players for the National Football League's Pro Bowl game Jan. 20 at Kansas City.

title: CITY BUSINESSMEN MORE PESSIMISTIC
description: Increased business bankruptcies, greater problems in debt collection and strong pressure on sales and earnings are expected in New York City in 1974, according to the results of an annual survey of 16 major industries released here yesterday.

title: Store Sales Advance
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.338billion, up 41 per cent from last year's level of $950million. Retail store sales were about $9.863billion, up 11 per cent from last year's $8.911billion.

title: Deadlock on Aviation Pact
description: TOKYO, Jan. 4Foreign Minister Masayoshi Ohira's meet. ing with Premier Chou Enlai in Peking today apparently in. eluded an effort to break the deadlock over . an aviation agreement that has stalled improved relations for over year, Japanese officials indicated today.

title: Four Get $200,000 In Airline Robbery At Kennedy Airport
description: Four armed men in hard hats, posing as telephone workers, gamed entrance to a cargo building at Kennedy International Airport yesterday afternoon, handcuffed 10 airline employes and escaped with more than $200,000 in cash.

title: Voluntary Hospitals Here Raise Rate $5 to $31 a Day
Contract Awards
description: The Boeing Company has been awarded a million Air Force contract to build and install the communications and control system for an E4B airborne command aircraft. The Air Force said that $11.2million of the total would be allocated immediately.

title: Cornhill Group for Fraud
description: SalterWalker said the allegations are totally unfounded.

title: The Burmese Adopt A New Constitution; 1,212 Detainees Free
description: RANGOON, Burma Jan. (Reuters) Burma today celebrated the 26th anniversary of her independence from Britain by adopting a new constitution aimed at making the country a socialist republic under oneparty rule.

title: Remco, a Toymaker, Closes Due to Materials Shortage
description: Herbert S. Gurbst, president of Remco Industries, Inc., a toy manufacturer of Harrison, N. J said yesterday that inability to obtain sufficient raw

title: People in Sports: New Coach Goes by His Own Book
description: The University of Oregon released its football coach yesterday and replaced him with an author. I was not happy with the direction being given to the football program at Oregon, said the school's athletic director, Nary Ritchey, who informed Dick Enright he no longer had the job. Replacing the coach was his assistant, Don Read, who has published two books, The Complete Football Passing Game and The Line of Scrimmage.

title: Drivers Will Get Full Data
description: The 13 harness drivers accused of fixing superfecta races learned at their arraignment yesterday that they will get a chance to know the dates and races the Government has accused them of fixing.

title: Market Place: 4 Funds Seek New Managers
description: Last month the outside directors of a group of four mutual funds dissatisfied with the performance of the funds management company took the unusual step of terminating the management contract.

title: Greenwich Man, 103, Dies
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. (AP)  Charles A. Pirro Sr., father of Charles A. Pirro Jr., editor of Greenwich Time, died last night at Greenwich Hospital. He was 103 years old.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Oil Spill Traced to Defective Valve

title: MOSCOW CRITICAL OF U.S. ARMS CHIEF
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 4The Soviet press today attacked Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger's plans to seek an $85billion defense budget for 1975, on the ground that this was an attempt to turn back the process of dtente.

title: CATTLE PRICE UP THE DAILY LIMIT
description: The February live cattle contract rose a cent a pound, the daily price limit, yesterday to close at 51.25 cents a pound on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange

title: Callender Goes to City Hall About a Job
description: Dr. Eugene S. Callender, president of the New York Urban Coalition and a former official in the Lindsay administration, met yesterday with Deputy Mayor James A. Cavanagh to discuss his chances of being named the city's first black Deputy Mayor.

title: A London District Learns About the Dole
description: LONDON, Jan. 4Catford is an almost arbitrary point in the endless Victorian graybrick desert of southeast London.

title: Albert E. Sutherland, 76 Director of Silent Films
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Jan. 4 (UPI)  Albert E. Sutherland, a retired director who started his career as an early member of Mack Sennett's Keystone Kops and then joined Charles Chaplin's film staff, died at the age of 76.

title: U.S. Judge Rules Against Raiders
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 4 (UPI)A Federal judge ruled today that the Oakland Raiders must refund 50 cents a ticket for three home National Football League games played in 1971.

title: Voluntary Hospitals Here Raise Rate $5 to $31 a Day
description: New York City's voluntary hospitals, already among the most expensive in the country, have raised their charges by amounts ranging from $5 to $31 a day increases that will soon show up in the majormedical insurance premiums paid by millions of New Yorkers.

title: 60YardWide Park Is Proposed to Save Raritan Canal Area
description: TRENTON, Jan. 4A legislative study committee today recommended that a 60yardwide linear state park be created along the entire 60mile length of the historic Delaware and Raritan Canal in an effort to stop further destruction by commercial development.

title: U.S. JOBLESS RATE ROSE IN DECEMBER TO 4.9% FROM IN
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 The nation's unemployment rate rose in December for the second consecutive month, but the role of the energy short. age in the rise was still uncertain, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Daylight Saving Time Will Return Tomorrow
description: Daylight Saving Time returns at 2 A.M. tomorrow, making it advisable to set clocks and watches ahead one hour before retiring tonight.

title: Buying Better Health
description: Three out of every four Americans are covered by some form of health insurance, but few have insurance that puts the accent where it ought to be: on keeping them healthy. A law just signed by President Nixon takes. a significant step toward swinging the balance in that direction.

title: Music: Leinsdorf at the Philharmonic
description: Erich Leinsdorf was such a lastminute replacement for Riccardo Muti that the Thursday evening programs of the New York Philharmonic did not even contain his name, much less the music lie conducted.

title: American Motors Corp. Reports 27% Rise in Its Car Sales for Year
description: DETROIT, Jan. 4The Amer ican Motors Corporation said today its dealers sold 395,831 cars in 1973, up 27 per cent from 312,271 sold in 1972 and the highest yearly total in decade.

title: Drachma to Be Floated
description: ATHENS. Jan. 4The new Government today quietly floated the drachma up to the rate of 30 to a dollarthe rate before the 10 per cent revaluation of the drachma last Oct. 20.

title: Demand for Divorce Brings Laws to Make It Easier and Cheaper
description: One of the more dramatic shifts in the American temperament in the lagt five years is the increasing tendency of couples to seek divorce and the tendency of courts and state legislatures to make it easier for them to do so.

title: As Italian as Apple Pie and Baseball
description: One of my earliest recollections, going back to before I started school, of my mother's references to the two Irish families on our block as Americans as distinguished from us Italians. I remember asking myself, and my mother, why they were any more American than we were. Although she conceded the technical point of my American birth and citizenship (and hers) she nevertheless clung to her sense of our being more Italian than American.

title: Swinging Singles Bars Are Spilling Into Suburbs

MarcelBruno Gensoul Is Dead; Defied Churchill on Fleet in 40
description: PARIS, Jan. 4 (UPI)  Adm. MarcelBruno Gensoul, who defied a world War If order by Winston Churchill to surrender French warships anchored in the bay of Oran, Algeria, died here Sunday, friends said yesterday. He was 93 years old.

title: Record Quarter Net Listed by Offshore

description: JAKARTA, IndonesiaStatistics in Asia are often little more than guesswork, and dry bones at that. Even so, in Jakarta the most advanced city in Indonesiathey can be starkly revealing.

title: Delaware River Port Unit To Weigh Censuring Chief
description: CAMDEN, Jan. 4Commissioner Henry W. Sawyer 3d of the Delaware River Port Authority of Pennsylvania and New Jersey said today that when the authority met next in its headquarters here on Jan. 16 he would introduce a resoluiton to censure its chairman, Ralph Cornell of Woodbury.

title: Maxim Shtraukh, 73, Dies; Actor Known as 2d Lenin
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 4, (Reuters)Maxim Shtraukh, a Soviet actor who became known as the second Lenin because of his realistic portrayals of the Russian Communist leader, has died here at the age of 73, it was officially announced last night.

title: REYNOLDS RAISING ALUMINUM PRICES
description: The Reynolds Metals Company announced yesterday that it would raise its prices on broad range of aluminum products beginning Monday.

title: Major Commercial Banks Cut Prime Rates to 9%
description: The First National City Bank, the Bankers Trust Company and a number of other major commercial banks announced yesterday reductions from 10 per cent to 934 per cent in their prime or base lending rate.

title: Boys and Girls Together?
description: SAN DIEGOCurrent trends in our society are bringing about greater opportunities for women. As a child psychiatrist and father of a girl and a boy, I welcome this change but we may unwittingly decrease the value of some wellestablished organizations for children.

title: China Is Increasing OilExport Deals
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 4Apparently tempted by the world's oil crisis, China has been making new commitments to export oil in modest amounts. But there have been no hints that Peking is ready to succumb to the blandishments of the international oil companies in hopes of becoming a major exporter in the near future.

title: Lawyer for President James Draper St. Clair
description: BOSTON, Jan. 4James Draper St. Clair and his wife had slipped away to Florida for a Christmas to New Year's holiday, but even as the bellhop was Man putting the key into the door of their room at the Innsbrook Resort at Tarpon Springs, near Tampa, the telephone was ringing.

title: Ukrainians Plead for an Old Church
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 4A Russian Orthodox congregation in the western Ukraine has appealed directly to the Kremlin leadership to save its graceful wooden church, which local officials have closed and intend to demolish.

title: Filipino Senator Drops Plea For Release in Political Move
description: MANILA, Jan. 4A former Senator, detained without charges since the imposition of martial law in September, 1972, has withdrawn all petitions for release that had been submitted on his behalf to the Philippine Supreme Court.

title: New Jersey Spots  Move Over Dr. J
description: ENGLEWOOD, Jan. must have come as a surprise. to New York basketball fans last summer that the Most Valuable Player award in the Whitney M. Young junior, star game between a New York City team and.? Buffalo, N. Y.., teem went to a.16yearold from New Jersey. But Bill (Poodle) Willotighby, who Went from his home in wood, to play in. Harlem about three. days a Week, is a sliloung man with a big futureif you believe statistics. and the opinions of college coaches meant anything.

title: Carl Troy, 76, Who Headed Cascade Laundries, Is Dead
description: Carl E. Troy, chairman of the board of Cascade Laundries of Brooklyn and of the Martin Linen Supply Company of San Antonio, Tex., died Thursday at his home in Newport Beach, Calif. He was 76 years old and lived at 980 Fifth Avenue.

title: Bonds for Sports Complex GetLowerMedium Rating
description: The two most influential companies that rate bonds disclosed yesterday that they regard the $295million bondl issue to finance a new stadium and race track in New Jersey es a lower mediumgrade investment.

title: Drachma to Be Floated
description: ATHENS, Jan. 4The new Government today quietly floated the drachma up to the rate of 30 to a dollarthe rate before the 10 per cent revaluation of the drachma last Oct. 20.

title: COURT LIFTS BAN ON PAPER STRIKE
description: The Appellate Division, in a 3to2 decision yesterday, reversed a State Supreme Court order that had enjoined Typographical Union No. 6 from striking or taking other job actions at The New York Times.

title: Yesterday's Results at Bowie
Gibson, 4 Others Sign Cards'
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 4 (AP)Bob Gibson, who has the second highest number of victories among active major league pitchers, is one of five St, Louis Cardinals players who have signed 1974 contracts, the club announced today.

title: But Why the Epidemic? It Could Be as Simple as Making Do Won't Do
description: LOS ANGELESIn 1957, Diane and Winslow Smith got married. Diane had to quit college, but Win was finishing law school, and while she was not in love, he was. Besides, her parents approved. We didn't think, Diane remembered, we just did it.

title: Tokyo Foreign Minister Meets With Chou and Mao
description: PEKING, Saturday, Jan. 5 (Agence FrancePresse) Foreign Minister Masayoshi Ohira of Japan spent an hour and quarter with Chairman Mao Tsetung early today in Peking, official Japanese sources announced.

title: China Says U.S. and Soviet Create Tension in Mideast
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 4 (Reuters)  China accused the Soviet Union and the United States today of having created a state of no war, no peace in the Middle East to gain control of the region.

title: Index of Commodity Prices Rose to 208.2 in the Week
China Is Increasing OilExport Deals
ROBERT T. VOGEL
description: Robert T. Vogel, an audiovisual designer who had worked on pavilions at Expo 67 in Montreal, the New York World's Fair of 196465 and the .Burlington Mills Exhibit in this city, died here, apparently of a heart attack, on Wednesday. He was 57 years old and lived in Freeport, L. I.

title: Art: Neglected Duly Is Back
description: The art of Raoul Dufy, though it occupies a permanent place in the history of the School of Paris, no longer causes much excitement among critics and curators specializing in modern painting. 11(luseums do not vie for the honor of mounting Duty retrospectives, and the art journals rarely, if ever, mention his nameexcept, perhaps, to include it among those artists whose early promise failed to fulfill itself in later life.

title: Hamilton Names King
description: CLINTON, N. Y., Jan. 4 (AP)Robert J. King, acting coach, has been named head coach of the Hamilton College football team for the 1974 season. Donald M. Jones, head coach for 23 years through 1972, returns Feb. 1 from a leave of absence, but at his request, will not be assigned football coaching duties.

title: Notes on People
description: Clifford Irving was transferred yesterday from the Federal prison at Danbury, Conn., to a halfway house here, and within an hour after checking in, was granted a weekend pass that gave him his first taste of freedom since he entered prison in August, 1972.

title: Air Force Cancels Junket by General To Save Gasoline
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4With a press release and a few critical comments, Representative Les Aspin succeeded today in saving 24,000 gallons of aviation gasoline that an Air Force general would have used on a flying inspection trip to Europe.

title: Oberlin Names Acting Head
description: OBERLIN, Ohio, Jan. 4 (AP) The board of trustees of Oberlin College has appointed Ellsworth C. Carlson, provost and professor of history, as acting president of the college, effective Feb. 2. He will succeed Dr. Robert W. Fuller and will serve until a new president is named. Dr. Fuller is resigning after more than three years as president.

title: 3 Tourneys Designated As Musts for Golf Stars
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 4Golf's superstars will be compelled to participate in three designated tournaments this year, Joseph C. Dey, commissioner of the Tournament Players Division, announced today.

title: PROTESTANT BODY IN ULSTER REJECTS TIES WITH IRELAND
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 4A policy of moderation pursued by the leader of the fourdayold coalition administration of Northern Ireland was repudiated today by his own Protestant party.

title: U.S. JOBLESS RATE ROSE IN DECEMBER TO 4.9% FROM 4.7%
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 4 The nation's unemployment rate rose in December for the second consecutive month, but the role of the energy short. age in the rise was still un. certain, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Mail Doesn't Co Through
description: SALMON, Idaho, Jan. 4 (UPI) Bitter cold temperatures did what other forms of foul weather  including gloom of Inightare not supposed to do: Stop the mail from going through. Temperatures of 30 below froze up the truck that delivers the mail .from Idaho Falls. After three days the first mail of 1974 was delivered yesterday.

title: City Plans Program to Repair Latest Outbreak of Potholes
description: The plague of the pothole is again upon the city and Mayor Beame announced yesterday, following a day of sleet, snow and rain, a renewed program to fill the autodamaging holes.

title: DIPLOMATS ATTEND FUNERAL OF BOHLEN
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) Diplomats, young and old, American and foreign, today came to the funeral of Charles E. Bohlen, who died Tuesday, to pay their last respects to the man who Secretary of State Kissinger said represented the best traditions of the Foreign Service.

title: Banker Pays Extortion
description: COLLINSVILLE, Tex., Jan. (UPI)A man told Gene Bryant president of the Collinsville State Bank, yesterday that he would fire a bazooka at the building unless he was given $20,000 to $30.000. Mr. Bryant put $19,400 in two deposit bags and dropped the money near a bridge a mile east of the city, where the extortionist picked it up and escaped, the police said.

title: DUBLIN RELEASES 14 I.R.A. SUSPECTS
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 4  The Irish police tonight released 14 of 15 men they had arrested near the border of Northern Ireland late Wednesday and early yesterday on suspicion of having engaged in terrorist activities.

title: W. H. TALIAFERRO, MICROBIOLOGIST,DIES
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 4Dr. William Hay Taliaferro, a microbiologist at the University of Chicago who helped form modern concepts of immunology, died Dec. 21 in LaGrange, III., where he lived. His age was 78.

title: GRAND JURY STUDIES U.S. FINANCIAL DEALS
description: A Federal grand jury in San Diego is investigating past transactions of the financially troubled U. S. Financial, Inc., it was learned yesterday.

title: MacPhail's Baseball Goal: Eliminate the Dead Spots
description: BOSTON, Jan. 4 (UPI)The new American League president, Lee MacPhail, said today his first task would be to eliminate the dead spots and enliven baseball.

title: OSKIE SLADE
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Jan. 4. (AP)  Gordon Leigh (Oskie) Slade, an infielder for the Brooklyn Dodgers, St, Louis Cardinals and Cincinnati Reds in the nineteenthirties died Wednesday night of a heart attack at his home. He was 69 years old.

title: Dave Anderson The Worth of Dick Williams
description: Not long after the New York Yankees announced that Bill Virdon had been hired as their new manager, the phone rang in Dick Williams's home amid the palm trees and the yacht canals of Riviera Beach, Fla.

description: LONDON, Jan. 4Catford is an almost arbitrary point in the endless Victorian graybrick desert of southeast London.,

title: The Screen:Ali-Frazier Bout Is Star of 'The Fighters'
description: William Greaves's "The Fighters," which opened yesterday at the Apollo Theater on 125th Street, is both a recollection and a coming attraction, being a documentary feature about the 1971 heavyweight title bout between Muhammad Ali and Joe Frazier, who meet again at Madison Square Garden on Jan. 28.Although "The Fighters" is primarily a round-by-round record of the extraordinary 1971 fight, won by Frazier on a decision, this footage has been ably supplemented by other material designed to give the fight some of the same impact it had when it was being billed as "the fight of the century."Interviews, training-camp sequences and even a brief glimpse into the complicated financial negotiations that made it all possible frame the footage of the 15-round bout that increased the statureand the bank accounts  of both winner and loser. "The Fighters" is a first-rate film of its unprepossessing kind.

title: Power to Use DDT Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) The Agriculture Department asked the Environmental Protection Agency today for standby authority to use the banned pesticide DDT to control moth infestation in Oregon, Washington and Idaho. Last year the environmental agency denied a similar request, and there was heavy damage to Douglas fir forests by the tussock moth.

title: SUPPLY BLOCKADE LIFTED BY ISRAEL
description: CAIRO, Jan. 4An Israeli blockade of food and other nonmilitary supplies for elements of Egypt's Third Army and the city of Suez was reported today to have been lifted after the United Nations interceded with the Israeli Army and Government.

description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Jan. 4The singles begin drift in by 8 P.M., the men alone or in pairs, the women in twos or threes. Small talk, banter and comeons mingle with the drinks, becoming by 10 or 11 P.M. brew bubbling up all over suburbia.

description: NEW HAVEN The scene in the kitchen of Charles F. Montgomery's Greek Revival house here was unexpected. Spread out before him on the top of an Eero Saarinen table was the eclectic accumulation of a man less interested in acquiring conventional antiques than in owning vintage objects worthy of design study.

title: G. H. Estabrooks, ExHead Of Psychology at Colgate
description: HAMILTON, N.Y., Jan. 4 Dr. George H. Estabrooks, former chairman of the psychology department at Colgate University, died at the Community Memorial Hospital on Sunday., He was 78 years old and lived at 8 University Avenue.

description: ROME, Jan. 4The Foreign Ministry, responding to a request by an Arab pressure group, said today that Government action to dismiss an Italian newspaper editor was not conceivable because it would violate the constitutional freedom of the press.

title: 4 Energy Studies Set
description: BOSTON, Jan. 4 (AP)The New England Regional Commission announced grants today of $69,000 for four studies to help the region deal with the energy shortage. The an.. nouncement was made by Gov. Francis W. Sargent of Massa. chu setts.

description: ELMONT, L. I., Jan. 4Some detective work by a Queens motorist led today to the padlocking of two gasoline pumps at an Elmont station that had charged him for 18.9 gallons to fill his car's 16gallon tank.

description: ASHLAND, Ky., Jan. 4 (AP)  Rexford S. Blazer, retired president and board chairman of Ashland Oil, Inc., died, apparently of a heart attack, yesterday. He was 66 years old.

description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 4 (UPI)Senator Lloyd M. Bentsen, Democrat of Texas, says he is not well enough known nationally to consider running for the Presidency in 1976 but that the situation might change by the end of the year. He spoke at a news conference yesterday.

title: PROTESTANT BODY IN ULSTER REJECTS TIES WITH IRELAND

title: Spain's New Premier Pledges To Relax Political Restrictions
description: MADRID, Jan. 4 (UPI)Premier Carlos Arias Navarro pledged his new Spanish Government to political liberalization today but warned that it would uphold order with severity and calmness.

title: China's Reshuffle
description: The sweeping reshuffle of China's chief military area commands accelerates a process under way since the decline and subsequent death in 1971 of Marshal Lin Piao, who had been the designated heir to Chairman Mao Tsetung. Along with the purge of military leaders close to Marshal Lin, there has been a reassertion of civilian control of the military, progressive removal of military men from political and economic posts of importance and an effort to break up the entrenched positions built by military leaders long stationed in certain areas.

title: Orr's Two Goals Rally Bruins To 42 Triumph Over Rangers

title: HENRY MEYERS
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Jan. 4Henry Rutgers Baldwin Meyers, former Mayor of Milltown and Superintendent of Schools there, died Thursday in a nursing home in Neshanic. He was 87 years old and lived at 1050 George Street and Iformerly had lived in Mill[town.

title: PEPSICOLA OFFICIAL SEIZED IN ARGENTINA
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 4 (Reuters)An executive of the Argentine subsidiary of Pepsico, Inc., was kidnapped near here last night, police sources said today.

title: People and Business

title: 3 Suspects Are Arrested In a Brooklyn Drug Raid
description: Three narcotics suspects and 28 ounces of suspected heroin were seized early yesterday morning in a raid on Brooklyn apartment, according to a spokesman for Frank Rogers, the special narcotics prosecutor.

title: EXXON IS REQUESTED TO YIELD CONCESSION
description: CARACAS, Jan. 4 (Reuters) The Venezuelan Government today asked a subsidiary of the Exxon Corporation to relinquish a concession granted it for oil exploration over two areas totaling 14,500 acres in eastern Venezuela, which will revert to the state.

title: GEORGIA TO HANG DR. KING PORTRAIT
description: Currently, no portraits of blacks are on display in the Capitol building, situated here in the city that Dr. King used as the headquarters for his nationwide civil rights operations before he was assassinated in 1968 at the age of 39.

title: MRS. MARK BOGART
description: Mrs. Lillian R. Bogart, wife of the former Tax Commissioner Mark A. Bogart and founder of the Lower East Side Neighborhood Association, died Thursday at New York Hospital. Her age was 62 and she lived at 3 Peter Cooper Road.

title: Track Snowed Out
description: PAWTUCKET, R.I., Jan. 4 (AP)The scheduled horse races at Narragansett Park were cancelled today because of snow.
