description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 9 (Reuters)JanErik Olsson, charged with having held four hostages in a Stockholm bank for six days, pleaded not guilty to kidnapping, armed robbery and attempted murder today. Clark Olofsson, a friend of Mr. Olsson's who was freed from jail and taken to the bank as part of the ransom demands, pleaded not guilty to charges of kidnapping and robbery.

title: Personal Finance
description: Parents oftencomplain that it costs a small fortune, none of which is tax deductible, to send children to college.

title: SNOW NO PROBLEM FOR CITY FINANCES
description: While harried New Yorkers slogged and drove through 4 inches of snow and slush yesterday, officials of the Sanitation Department sighed with relief because of the medium snowfall, which they estimate would not be too expensive to clean up.

title: Democrats Score Wilson's Call For Primary Vote in September
description: Democratic candidates for Governor, announced and unannounced, yesterday criticized Governor Wilson's proposal to Postpone the primary date from lune to September as a politial maneuver to enhance his wn election chances.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Commission on Status of Women, working group on discrimination  10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Court Bars Rail Passenger Suit On Curtailed Service by Amtrak
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9The Supreme Court ruled today that passengers cannot use the Federal courts to challenge decisions by Amtrak to discontinue service.

title: HIGH COURT VOIDS A LOYALTY OATH
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 States cannot constitutionally require political parties to swear that they do not advocate the forcible overthrow of the Government in order to win a place on the ballot for their candidates, the Supreme Court held today.

title: $5.3Million Deficit Is Posted by Schick For Fiscal Quarter
Scalded Trenton Prisoner Was to Testify on Hanging
description: TRENTON, Jan. 9  A 21yearold inmate who died slowly by scalding in the Trenton State Prison was regarded as a key witness against state officials in the death of a fellow prisoner, it was disclosed today by lawyers and a penal reform organization.

title: G.O.P. to Name a Chairman Tomorrow
description: TRENTON, Jan. 9New Jersey Republicans will meet Friday to pick a new state chairman, amid speculation that the party may turn to its former state chairman, Webster B Todd.

title: U.S. NAZIS ATTACKED AT SCHOOL MEETING
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 9 (UPI)  Twelve members of the American Nazi party were attacked last night during a Board of Education meeting called to consider the integration of the city's junior and senior high schools.

title: Judge Sets Hearing Date On Pennsy Reorganization
description: Judge John P. Fullam of the Federal District Court in Philadelphia set yesterday March 25 as the date for a hearing to determine whether the Penn Central Railroad's reorganization should proceed under newly enacted legislationthe Re gional Rail Reorganization Act designed to merge the system with six other bankrupt carriers in the Northeast and Midwest. Judge Fullam has been in charge of the Penn Cen tral's bankruptcy since it filed for reorganization in June, 1970, under Section 77 of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: WHEAT FUTURES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: An offering of Government wheat and a rumor that the Soviet Union might postpone taking deliveries of some wheat already ordered hit the wheat futures market yesterday, but not before prices set a record high for the March delivery.

title: Delay of 2 Weeks Granted To Hughes in Airline Case
description: RENO, Nev., Jan. 9 (UN)1Howard R. Hughes has been given a two week delay in his arraignment on criminal charges resulting from his takeover of the airline Air West, Inc., in 1969.

title: U.S. Embassy in India Chagrined by Peace Corps Inability to Fill Quota of 50
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 9The United States Embassy and the Peace Corps are involved in a bitter wrangle over the corps's inability to fill its quota of 50 here this year.

title: I.T.T. and MilkPrice Statements: No Gain Seen for the President
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9  If President Nixon was not thrown for a loss, he certainly did not gain any ground with his statements yesterday on the I.T.T. and milk price controversies. Nobody a r ound Washington was saying today, He certainly ran over the opposition this time. Even at the Western White House at San Clemente no hats were thrown News Analysis into the air. What they were uments and tape recordings that the President has refused to surrender, and against impeachment proceedings if Congrss decides to undertake them.

title: Blank Checks From Hughes to Nixon Fund Alleged
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 9 (UPI) An agent of Howard R. Hughes gave signed blank checks to President Nixon's reelection campaign committee, according to sworn testimony released today.

title: CUT IS ESTIMATED FOR COTTON CROP
Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING Roosevelt Raceway, Westbury, L. I., 8 P.M.

title: Enlarged City Council Opens Sessions With an Unexpected Racial Power Play
description: The City Councilexpanded, this year to include more members of racial minoritiesmeth for the first time yesterday for the pleasant ceremony of a formal organization meeting and unexpectedly found itself in a racially charged debate.

title: GRISWOLD DIFFERS WITH I.T.T. VERSION OFFERED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 Erwin Griswold, former Solicitor General of the United States, said today that he disagreed with part of the White House version of the antitrust case against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: Sale of Padres to Mrs. Everett's Group Is Vetoed
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 9National League club owners further muddled the San Diego Padre situation today by vetoing the sale of the club to a group headed by Mrs. Marjorie Lindheimer Everett.

title: 2 Factions on Thieu Staff Vie for Real Political Punch
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 9Political life in the generally understood sense of the term does not exist in South Vietnam.

title: POKER WINNINGS SENT TO NEEDIEST
description: Contributions to the New York Times Neediest Case: Fund invariably come from in come resulting from ordinary endeavors.

title: Scott Names Investments But Withholds Their Value
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 (UPI)  The Senate Republican leader, Hugh Scott, filed to day an updated financial statement with the Senate, publicly disclosing his investments but withholding the amounts and value.

title: 2d Man Is Sentenced to Death In Slaying of Family in Georgia
description: DONALSONVILLE, Ga., Jan.; 9 (UPI)  George Dungee, a 36yearold fugitive from a Baltimore prison, was convicted today of six counts of murder and sentenced to death in the mass slaying of a South Georgia farm family.

title: The Battle to Improve Road Termed Worst in the State
description: TROY, N.Y. Jan. 9  The Hoosick Falls Kiwanis Club is preparing to erect a billboard this weekend on state Route 7 near the Vermont border, close to the official sign that reads, Welcome to New York State.

title: Merger Plans Dropped
description: Plans for the merger of Timpte Industries, Inc. into the Carnation Company have been terminated. No reason was given.

title: OIL SALE BY SAUDIS CONFIRMED BY PARIS
description: PARIS, Jan. 9 (UPI)France, apparently rejecting proposals by the United States and the European Common Market for a united energy policy among Western industralized nations, confirmed today that she had signed a big oil deal with Saudi Arabia on her own.

title: MALCOLM SCORES CRITICS OF TOMBS
description: The city Correction Commissioner, Benjamin J. Malcolm, asserted yesterday that conditions at the Manhattan House of Detention, also known as the Tombs, were not as bad as critics would have you believe.

title: Prices Doom Cab Service
description: MARSHALL, Mich., Jan. (UPI)rhe Marshall Taxi Cab Company, the only cab service in this city of 7,000 people, says it cannot survive with the high price of gasoline and is going out of business. David Yeck announced today that he was ending his onecab service.

title: Nixon Staff, Under Gray San Clemente Skies, Tries to Cheer Up President With 61st Birthday Party
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan.??President Nixon celebrated his 61st birthday today with an awkward surprise party his office that underscored enormous changes that have taken place in his Administration and his handling of the Presidency in the last year.

title: Paraguay Accepts Bolivian
description: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Jan. 9 (Reuters)  The Paraguayan Government today granted political asylum to former President Victor Paz Estenssoro of Bolivia, who arrived here last night after being deported from his own country.

title: Zero Mostel, in Union Suit, Blows Hot and Cold for Sesame
description: Zero Mostel is the stage's consummate insiderhe put himself in a comic skin to play in Fiddler on the Roof, in a rhinoceros hide to play Ionesco; Ana in a stream of consciousness to play Joyce.

title: Christopher Thoron Dies; Headed University in Cairo
description: Christopher Thoron, resident since 1969 of the American University in Cairo, died yesterday in Memorial Hospital for Cancer and Allied Diseases. He was 43 years old.

title: I.T.T. Sets Up a Reserve Of $35Million on Levitt
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation announced late yesterday the establishment of a $35million reserve to reduce its investment in Levitt and Sons, Inc., to estimated realizable values.

title: An Ice Capades for All
description: How's this year's Ice Capades? Bright, cheerful, eyefilling as can he. As usual, Madison Square Garden has a good, family buy through Jan, 20.

title: Trooper Saves Man in River
description: STURBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 9 (AP)  State Trooper Frederick C. MacDonald braved swirling snow and swam through icy water today to reach John Fahrigio, a truck driver whose rig had skidded off the Massachusetts Turnpike into a nearby river. The two men waited 45 minutes until additional help came. Later the police helicopter that took the men to a hospital was forced to make an emergency landing on the turnpike after it developed.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New York University faculty members and librarians began voting in the university's runoff collectivebargaining election yesterday and will continue the balloting until this evening. The runoff choice between the American Association of University Professors and the no agent, or no union, position, were ordered by the National Labor Relations Board in November, when neither side got the necessary majority in a threesided race in which the United Federation of College Teachers was eliminated. Results of the runoff will not be known until Jan. 16, a spokesman for the university said.

title: Consumer Notes
description: The power of the civil court. to throw out debtcollection cases en masse when the creditor is shown to be engaging in certain fraudulent practices has been officially confidmed by a state law that went into effeet Jan. 1.

title: Scalded Prisoner Was to Be Witness In Jersey Jail Case
description: TRENTON, Jan. 9A 21yearold inmate who died slowly by scalding in the Trenton State Prison was regarded as a key witness against state officials in the death of a fellow prisoner, it was disclosed today by lawyers and a penal reform organization.

title: WILSON'S SPEECH CALLS MODERATION HIS PRINCIPAL AIM; In State of State Message, He Cites Era of Inflation and the Fuel Shortage; NOTES PAST RESILIENCE; Governor Calls for Increases in Jobless and Welfare Aid +Duryea Wins Ovation
description: ALBANY, Jan. 9Emphasizing the moderate, middle way, Governor Wilson delivered his first message to the Legislature today and promised there would be no extravagant ventures by the state in this time of inflation and fuel shortage.

title: Baseball Drafts Its Relatives
description: The University of Southern California's National Collegiate champion team lost its shortstop yesterday when the worst team in baseball, the Texas Rangers, picked Roy Smalley Jr. in the major leagues freeagent winter draft.

title: Market Place: Tender Offers And Federated
description: What is in store for the minority shareholders of the Federated Development Company, a realestate and insurance company whose shares have been the subject of three tender offers in less than a year?

title: EXPORTING LANDS FREEZE OIL PRICES
description: GENEVA, Jan. 9Major oilexporting nations, after quadrupling their prices in the last three months, today promised stability over the next quarter but warned that future price decisions hinged on the industrial countries ability to control both inflation and the profits of oil companies.

title: Aiken Hints Early Decision On Plans for Seventh Term
description: MONTPELIER, Jan. 9 (AP)Senator George D. Aiken, Republican of Vermont, said yesterday that he might announce some decision earlier than usual on his political future.

title: TeacherUnion Halts CollegeAid Plan
description: The United Federation of Teachers has suspended its college scholarship program for members children because of problems with the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Skylab 3 Crew Scanning Earth for Geothermal Spots
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 9 (AP1The Skylab 3 astronauts scanned the earth from space today searching for geothermal her, spots that could provide new sources of power.

title: BAKERS FORECAST HIGH BREAD PRICE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9Leaders of the baking industry asserted today that a wheat shortage this spring could drive the price of bread as high as $1 for a familysize loaf unless the Government acted to limit booming wheat exports.

title: Birth of a Campaign
description: Governor Wilson's first State oUthe State message not only spelled out his legislative program but also laid out the broad strategy by which he hoPes to insure that there will be a second, third, fourth and fifth Wilson State of the State message after next November's gubernatorial election. The message was, in effect, the 59year old Mr. Wilson's opener in his campaign to come out from under the shadow of Nelson A. Rockefelfer and win the governorship in his own right next November. It heralded the following moves by Mr. Wilson in his still unannounced campaign for a,full term.

title: German Bicycle Sales Soar
description: COLOGNE, West Germany,1 Jan. 9 (UPI)Bicycle sales rose 61 per cent in November when West Germans first became aware of the threatened Arab oil embargo, the Cologne University Institute for Merchandising Research reported today.

title: MONEY THE ISSUE FOR OFF BROADWAY
description: As Off Broadway faces the possibility of the second strike of actors and stage managers in its 30year history, money continues to be the crucial issue between the Actors Equity Association and the League of Off Broadway Theaters and Producers.

title: Court Finds Juror's Illness No Basis for a Mistrial
description: TRENTON, Jan. 9 (AP)  A state appeals court ruled today that the absence of one juror because of illness was not ground for a mistrial.

title: F.T.C. Urged to Ask Companies to Prove ImageBuilding Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9Six members of Congress urged the Federal Trade Commission today to require proof of corporate imageimproving claims made in advertisements, especially those, dealing with energy and environmental issues.

title: Mrs. David Sarnoff Dies at 79; Widow of Broadcasting Pioneer
description: Mrs. Lizette Hermant Sarnoff, widow of David Sarnoff the broadcasting pioneer who became chairman of the RCA Corporation, died Tuesday night in Lenox Hill Hospital. She was 79 years old and lived at I Sutton Place.

title: Big Powers Will Seek to Narrow Gap Between Israel and Egypt
CHANNEL 13 TO AIR REGIONAL THEATER
description: Productions by regional theaters from various sections of the country will form a large part of Theater in America, a new series for the Public Broadcasting Service, to be presented Wednesday nights on Channel 13/WNET, at 8:30 P.M.

title: MOSCOW WRITERS
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 9The Moscow Writers Union today expelled Lidiya K. Chukovskaya, a prominent novelist, for having come to the defense of the dissident atomic physicist Andrei D. Sakharov when he was under attack last fall.

title: Celtics, Led by Nelson, Trounce Bulls, 10689
description: BOSTON, Jan. 9 (UPI)Don Nelson scored 24 points tonight as the Boston Celtics routed the Chicago Bulls, 106.89, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Dale, 35, Recalls First Super Bowl
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 9 (UPI)Carroll Dale, Minnesota's 35yearold wide receiver, has no hangups about his age, so nobody bothers kidding him about having played in the days when they didn't wear helmets. But he is asked a lot of questions about the first Super Bowl game.

title: Duryea Is Given Applause From Both Sides of Aisle
description: ALBANY, Jan. 9The hour belonged to Governor Wilson, but it was Perry B. Duryea, the indicted Speaker of the Assembly, who clearly captured the day.

title: Wonderland Papers...
description: The White House statements defending President Nixon's actions in 1971 with regard to the milk price increase and the I.T.T. antitrust settlement have an AliceinWonderland quality. Some awkward facts are omitted; others are stated but not explained; still others are described as meaning what the President says they mean, regardless of how they might first appear.

title: EXXON AND UTILITIES DISCUSSING OIL DEAL
description: The Boston Edison Company said yesterday that it was gotiating with the Exxon poration and the Florida Power and Light Company for a ship. ment of 310,000 barrels of oil. The oil was originally destined for the Florida utility but the Federal Energy Office requested Exxon to divert the, heavy fuel oil to the Boston utility because of possible shortages in that area.

title: New Bus for Winnebago
description: FOREST CITY, Iowa, Jan. 9 (UPI) Winnebago Industries unveiled a prototype intracity bus today as part of its new diversification program. Winnebago officials said the bus, designed to carry 19 passengers, is built on a motorhome chassis utilizing the. company's motorhome production lines.

title: Pelyk Helps Leafs Beat Penguins
A Stolen Lindbergh Trophy Is Recovered in St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 9 (UPI)The police yesterday recovered a gold trophy cup awarded to Charles Lindbergh when he made his historic solo flight from New York to Paris in 1927.

title: Met Museum Trustees Laud Rousseau
description: The board of trustees of the Metropolitan Museum of Art has passed a resolution recording its sorrow and deep sense of personal loss at the death last week of Theodore Rousseau Jr., vice director and curator in chief of the museum since 1968.

title: Peking's Liquor Is Milder Than Soviet
description: A vodka tasting is almost a contradiction in terms. The success of vodka in this country is based principally on the theory that vodka has no taste. Or any aroma, either. Of course, vodka does have a taste, and the new Chinese vodka, Great Wall, has a specific taste of its own, a taste most laymen might distinguish in a comparison test.

title: 400 FROM CHILE GET EAST GERMAN HAVEN
description: BERLIN, Jan. 9  East Germany has granted asylum to 400 refugees from Chile, becoming the first country of the Soviet bloc to fulfill Communist pledges to the victims of the military coup d'etat in September.

title: Surprise Plea in Texas Case
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Jan. 8 (UPI)  Fred Gomez Carrasco, alleged boss of the South Texas narcotics underworld, entered a surprise plea of guilty Tuesday to a charge of assault to murder a police officer, Judge Preston Dial sentenced him to life in prison. At the same time, the state dropped. charges of murder and illegally carrying a weapon against Mr. Carrasco and a charge of assault to murder against his wife, Rosa.

title: ...But Not in Jersey
description: GLEN ROCK, N.J.I have a theory. So many things go wrong nowadays because there are so many more opportunities for failure. In this land of boundless opportunities, failure is at last being recognized for what it is: a probability.

title: Advertising: Y. & R. Goes Retail
description: One can just imagine Edward N. Ney, the chief executive of Young & Rubicam who presided over the acquisition of both a healthcare agency and a directmarketing agency in 1973, looking desperately for new fields to conquer in 1974.

title: Text of Communique
description: GENEVA, Jan 8Following is the official text in English of the communique issued today after th: extraordinary meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries.

title: Detroit Homicide Toll Up
description: DETROIT, Jan. 9 (UPI)The Detroit homicide toll for 1973, originally announced at 750 yesterday, was revised to 751 following an autopsy of a man who died Dec. 31. The police said that Walter Perry, 73 years old, had been beaten to death. The autopsy revealed he had died of a broken neck after being attacked by assailants outside a Detroit bar on New Year's Eve.

title: Illegitimate Babies Arouse  Born of 74'
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Jan. (UPI)Three Iowa newspapers yesterday named illegitimate babies as winners of their First Born of 1974 contest.

title: SEVEN HELD HOSTAGE BY FEARFUL ESCAPER
description: HONOLULU, Jan. 9 (AP)An escaper from Hawaii State Prison held a police detective and six other persons.hostage for mote than five hours before surrendering; the police said.

title: HoffmannLaRoche Licensed To Sell Cancer Detection Test
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9(AP)The Food and Drug AdrninistraOm disclosed todaythat it had granted HoffmannLaRoche, Inc., the first license to market a cancer test for restricted use.

title: A HEARING IN MANILA ON U.S. PRIEST BEGINS
description: MANILA, Jan. 9  An American missionary was said today to have induced unrest among hill tribes and peasants in the southern Philippine province of Davao as deportation proceedings initiated against him by the martiallaw Government began here.

title: Notes on People
description: A former Under Secretary of Labor, Laurence H. Silberman, was reported in Washington to be the leading candidate for the job of No. 2 man in the Justice Department, Deputy Attorney General.

title: Theater: A King Comes to Brooklyn
Import to Vie With Others on Market
description: Would you believe vodka from... China? That is precisely what New Yorkers will be given an opportunity to sip  or  gulp  sometime later this year if plans announced here by the importers come to fruition.

title: DOLLAR OFF SHARPLY IN MOST MARKETS
description: LONDON, Jan. 9 (UPI)The dollar, which rose to record heights Monday and yesterday plunged in most markets today. The price of gold, down drastically overnight, dropped even more during the day.

title: Witness in Campisi Trial Says Foil Packet Was Found in Car
description: NEWARK, Jan. 9Defense witnesses in the narcotics trial of Peter R. Campisi, a reputed mobster, testified today that the police had found a tinfoil packet allegedly containing cocaine inside a car and not, in contrast with earlier testimony, on the person of Mr. Campisi.

title: Stranded on an Icy Railway...
description: PORT WASHINGTON, N. Y.  The morning of the big freeze I was trapped for nearly eight hours on a Long Island Rail Road train. Some 400 of us left Port Washington at 8:24 A.M. and about 300 more got on at Plandome, Manhasset and Great Neck.

title: Rise in Illegal Gambling Linked to OTB Climate
Hughes's Blank Checks
description: An agent for Howard R. Hughes gave the Nixon reelection committee signed blank checks, and Sally Harmony, G. Gordon Liddy's secretary, filled in the amounts, according to her sworn testimony revealed yesterday. Details, Page 22.

title: Sandylands: The Prefix of 51 Champions
description: Mrs. Gwen Broadley of Warwickshire, England, has judged in many partsof the world, including Australia, Africa and Europe. So when fanciers heard she was going to work at the Maryland show, her first assignment in America, many made the trip to Baltimore. News of Dogs

title: Americans Keep Busy Hunting Down British Twigs on Their Family Trees
description: LONDONMany do it to find names to drop, others are chasing property, some hope to claim a lost inheritance but most do it out of curiosity.

title: J. &L. TO LIFT PRICES ON TIN min GOODS
description: The Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation said yesterday that it planned to raise prices on tin mill products by an average of 7 per cent beginning Feb 16. The increases are similar to those announced, Monday by the United States, Steel Corporation.

title: Don't Look Now...
description: There was a small story in the paper the other day about a Central Intelligence Agency operative out in Thailand faking a letter from the local guerrillas to the Thai Government. The agency apologized to the Thais for the incident, described it as an aberration and said it would never happen again.

title: More Mushrooms Are Recalled As a Possible Hazard to Health
Senate Panel Sets Meeting On Nation's Nutrition Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 (AP) With an eye on rising costs of fuel and fobd, a Senate committee announced today plans for a national nutrition policy conference this year.

title: Bromley Pumping Gas To Keep Skiers Happy
description: PERU, Vt., Jan. 9Bromley Mountain's management is keeping skiers happy by dispensing gasoline from its own pump in the main parking lot. The pump, installed the day before Chritmas, has provided about 18,000 gallons for Bromley's custourers. In view of the fuel situation, the pump has proved a key addition to our facilities, Bob Paron, the mountain's manager, said today, Skiers from the New York and Boston areas can reach here with one tankful of gasoline. During the emergency, we plan to help them complete the round trip by refueling them.

title: ARAB SPOKESMAN BEGINS U.S. TOUR Beirut Newsman Seeks to Give Views on Mideast to Many Americans
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9A special envoy of the 19nation Arab League opened a threemonth crosscountry campaign today to tell the Arab side of the Middle East conflict to as many Americans as possible.

title: Snowstorm Rages Over Tristate Area, Slowing Traffic
description: On top of the new morning darkness at an hour when the day's activities are expected to get into gear, residents of the metropolitan area were greeted with a snow storm that by 9 A.M. had dumped more than three inches.

title: Barge Brings Foreign Gas Here To Buttress Dwindling Supplies
description: Natural gas from overseascooled to a liquid at minus 260 degrees Fahrenheitwas shipped cautiously into New York Harbor yesterday to help stretch the dwindling supplies of The Brooklyn Union Gas Company.

title: Ford Plans Layoffs of 7,000 Workers
description: DETROIT, Jan. 9The Ford Mottor Company announced today it would lay off later this month some 7,000 workers at two plants near Detroit and St. Louis, 2,500 of them indefinitely.

title: MAXMILIAN E. RAYM
description: Maxmilian Egon Raym, who retired in 1966 as publicrelations representative for Press Wireless at the United Nations, died, apparently of a coronary attack, yesterday at his home, 1192 Park Avenue, He was 71 years old.

title: Snow Outside, a Flood of Words Inside
description: ALBANY, Jan. 9The State Senators, the Assemblymen, the aides and the hangerson, too, came back today.

title: 3 Met Opera Lookins To Have Kaye as Host
description: Danny Kaye, who in two sessions instructed more than 7,000 young people in the workings of the Metropolitan Opera last year, will do the same this spring. Because of their success, these Lookins will be expanded to three, on March 28 and 29 and April 1.

title: Pro Musica Will Disband After 20 Melodious Years
description: The New York Pro Musica Antigua, for two decades the leading ensemble in this country dedicated to the performance of medieval and Renaissance music, will be disbanded at the end of its current season. The announcement was made yesterday by Mrs, Noah Greenberg, president of the Pro Musica board.

title: CARPI JURY HEARS OF VICTIM'S FEARS
description: TRENTON, Jan. 9  Mrs. Laura Carpi feared for her safety in the days before she was murdered, a friend testified in court today.

title: Daughter Says Nixon Predicts a Good Year
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 (AP) This is going to be a good year, President Nixon told his daughter Julie Mrs. David Eisenhower in an early morning telephone call tdday from California on his 61st birthday.

title: Protesting Thais Demand American Envoy's Ouster
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan. (AP)Shouting, jeering Thai students demanded the ouster of the United States Ambassador today and protested the visit by the Japanese Premier,

title: EDWARD C. M'AULIFFE
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., Jan. Edward C. McAuliffe, who served two terms as chairman of the Delaware River Port Authority, died yesterday in Cherry Hill Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 10 Media Road.

title: Kuwait Threatens Oilfield Destruction Should U.S. Step In
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan, 9The Government of Kuwait has threatened to blow up its oilfields in the event of American military attempts to occupy them.

title: A Spanish Court Sentences Anarchist to Death in Killing
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Jan. 9 (UPI)  A military court sentenced a Catalan anarchist to death today for having killed a policeman and to 30 years in prison for having robbed a bank.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The chairman of the State Board of Institutional Trustees resigned yesterday because, he said, Governorelect Brendan T. Byrne did not consult the board before announcing his choice for Commissioner of the Department of Institutions and Agencies. In a letter of resignation Governor Cahill, the chairman, John J. Magovern Jr., said Mr. Byrne's announcement seemed to him to be in direct contravention of the statute previously called to his [Byrne's] attention and contrary to the understanding the state board.

title: Three Brothers
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9  Little Brother is watching you.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING Roosevelt Raceway, Westbury, L. I., 8 P.M.

title: Peking Calls 1974 a Good Year For Revolutionary Movements
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 9  As seen from Peking, 1974 is expected to be a year of increased international turbulence, an excellent situation for revolutionary advance by oppressed nations and people.

title: John Huntington, 56, Dies; Transport Concern Officer
description: John Stevens Huntington, vice president of Transamerican Trailer Transport, Inc., and a retired Navy commander, died on Monday, apparently of a heart attack, at the Downtown Athletic Club, He was 56 years old and lived at Shore Acres, Staten Island. Mr, Huntington joined Transamerican in 1966 and was in

title: Reception Is Good For New Offering Of Bell Telephone
RUSSEL E. MARKS
description: Russel E. Marks, a former director of industrial relations and an assistant vice president of W. R. Grace & Co., died Tuesday in Tampa (Fla.) General Hospital. He was 69 years old and had been living in Tampa.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING Roosevelt Raceway, Westbury, L. I., 8 P.M.

title: Old Plot With New Cast
description: TRENTON, Jan. 9The overwhelming Democratic majorities that took control of the Legislature here yesterday confront a number of highly controversial issues this year.

title: ExBaltimore County Aide Says He Relayed Kickbacks to Chief
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 9  The former top administrative officer for Baltimore County testified in Federal Court here tolay that he had accepted plain white envelopes containing money from engineers and architects doing business with the county and bad passed them on to N. Dale Anderson, successor to Spiro T. Agnew in he County Executive's job.

title: Big Retailers Optimistic Despite Woes
description: After listening to the pessimistic reminders of persistent inflation, looming shortages, the energy crunch and the shaken consumer, toplevel executives of three retail companies that move more than $17billion of consumer goods emerged optimistic on the forthcoming spring season.

title: U.S. ACTS TO HELP CUT JURORS TIME
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9States seeking Federal anticrime funds will be officially notified next week that they must use some of the money to improve court dealings with private citizens who serve as jurors and witnesses.

title: Alleged Rapist, 25, Slain
description: A 25yearold man reputedly one of a gang of eight who allegedly raped the young wife of a 44yearold man, was shot in the head and killed early yesterday in front of a social club at 161 West 108th Street.

title: GRISWOLD DIFFERS WITH I.T.T. VERSION OFFERED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9Erwin Griswold, former Solicitor General of the United States, said today that he disagreed with part of the White House version of the antitrust case against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: Youth's Right to Privacy In His Room Faces Ruling
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill.. Jan. 9 (UPI)  The state will ask the United States Supreme Court, to decide whether a youngster who has locked himself in his room with some marijuana has a constitutional right to privacy that authorities said yesterday.

title: Drinking at 18 Backed
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 9 (UP1)A proposal to lower the drinking age to 18 in California has been approved by the Assembly, 56 to 10, but its fate was doubtful in the Senate, which has killed previous attempts.

title: TV: Scaling Heights, Sort Of, in National Geographic Project
description: In tonight's National Geo graphic Society special, Journey to the Outer Limits, on the American Broadcasting Company network at 8 o'clock, try to keep an eye on a young girl named Meredith Johnson, one of 19 youths participating in a mountainclimbing project. It won't be easy, because Miss Johnson was not one of the three participants selected by the Society and Wolper Productions for a special focus that would lend a form to the spontaneous expedition.

title: MONETARY STAND IS SHIFTED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9A new strategy for negotiating reform of the international monetary system has been adopted by the United States Government, partly because of the uncertainties created by the world oil situation.

title: G.M. Increases Prices Of Most Expensive Cars
description: DETROIT, Jan. 9 (AP)The General Motors Corporation says it has increased the base prices of its most expensive cars to cover the addition of formerly optional equipment as standard.

title: Dance: A la Balanchine
description: The New York City Ballet, which had been playing to soldout houses with George Balanchine's The Nutcracker since Dec. 12, returned to general repertory Tuesday night at the State Theater with Jacques d'Amboise's Irish Fantasy and Jerome Robbins's The Goldberg Variations.

title: Snowmobiler Killed
description: CUMBERLAND, R. I., Jan. (AP)  Shirley McLean White, 25 years old, of Attleboro, Mass., was killed tonight when the snowmobile on which she was riding hit a parked car.

title: Snowstorm Rages Over Tristate Area, Slowing Traffic
description: On top of the new morning darkness at an hour when the day's activities are expected to get into gear, residents of the metropolitan area were greeted with a snowstorm that by 9 A.M. had dumped more than three inches.

title: GRAND JURORS HEAR KENT STATE EXHEAD
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 9 (UPI)Robert I. White, the president of Kent State University in 1970 when four students were shot to death by National Guardsmen, said he answered every question put to him today during two hours of testimony before a Federal grand jury.

title: MOSE ASSAILS VOICEOF AMERICA
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 9A leading Soviet television commentator today attacked the Voice of America for carrying broad casts on Aleksandr I, Solzhenit syn's latest book and accused it of preparin,g its material with dirty hands.

title: Kissinger OH to Mideast TonightNixon Calls Session on Energy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9 Secretary of State Kissinger leaves tomorrow night for talks in Egypt and Israel to help bring about an agreement for the separation of Israeli and Egyptian forces near the Suez Canal.

title: 19 ON CHARTER TRIP GET FOOD POISONING
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 9 (AP)At least19 persons aboard a charter flight from Pueblo, Colo., were taken tonight from the Columbus airport to area hospitals for officials said.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: A FRISCH LOOK Back in the early sixties, Andorra, by the Swiss playwright Max Frisch, was one of the longrunning successes of West German theater. With its fury and irony aimed at bigotry and its wellsprings, Andorra was a play to trouble the conscience; and European audiences in general acclaimed it. Andorra (the reference is to a fictional country) opened on Broadway early in 1963, earning

title: Buses Warm Elderly at Social Security
description: The Social Security Administration deployed chartered buses with heat and toilets yesterday at eight of its 23 city offices to cope with any overflow of aged, blind and disabled people who might be involved in this month's transfer from the city welfare rolls to the Federal Supplemental Security Income Program.

title: Books of The Times
description: VEGAS: A MEMOIR OF A DARK SEASON. By John Gregory Dunne. 288 pages. Random House. $6.95.

title: Stock Prices Drop Across Broad Front
description: Stock prices dropped on broad front yesterday. Recent market favorites and oldline glamour issues were hit particularly hard. The DowJones industrial average, with none of its bluechip components showing a gain, sank 26.99 points to 834.79.

title: PANEL SPOTLIGHTS CHEMICALS RISKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9Americans should worry more about such everyday chemical hazards as cigarette smoking and alcohol than about relatively esoteric risks like the presence of mercury in swordfish, a panel of experts has concluded after a twoyear study for the government.

title: Bridge:
description: A large contingent of New York enthusiasts begin their annual trek to the Catskills today for the TriState Regional Championships at Grossinger's

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
Prices of Stocks Plunge 26.99 In 3d Largest Drop Since 62
description: The stock market, beset by the twin worries of inflation and recession, suffered a pounding yesterday that resulted in the thirdlargest setback since the 1962 break. Trading activity continued moderate at 18.07 million shares.

title: Royal Par Attracts Notable Commoners
description: Champagne bottles popped. The muted blare of Renaissance brass music filled the air. And hundreds of New Yorkers gathered in glittery surroundings at the Brooklyn Academy; of Music last night for what! Mayor Beanie called a Royal Brooklyn welcome to the Royal Shakespeare Company! and the opening there of a season of British theater.

title: Tokyo Expects Aviation Agreement With Peking Soon
description: TOKYO, Jan. 9  Foreign Minister Masayoshi Ohira said today that Japan expected to conclude a civil aviation agreement with China soon, apparently removing the obstacle that has stalled, improved relations between the two countries for over a year.

title: Advertising: 4 Progresso Soups
description: New York was sodden, slushy, soggy, splashy and sloppy yesterday. It was also raw and rotten. In other words, it was a perfect day to sell hot soup.

title: Contract Awards
description: Three Ohio utilities placed a $50.million order yesterday with the General Electric Company for a 1.17million kilowatt boiling water reactor nuclear system for the Walter H. Zimmer nuclear power station near Moscow, Ohio. This would he the second unit at the site. The contract covers the steam supply system and fabrication, for the initial fuel core. Participants in the project are the Cincinnati Gas & Electric Company, the Columbus and Southern Ohio Electric Company and the Dayton Power and Light Company. They would purchase and own the equipment on the basis of Cincinnati holding 40 per cent: Columbus 28.5 per cent and Dayton 31.5 per cent. Commercial operation is scheduled for 1982,

title: U.S. ADMITS PLAN TO DISRUPT PARTY
description: The Federal Government, replying to a suit against it, has acknowledged that it conducted electronic surveillance of Socialist Workers party members) from 1945 to (963 and that the Federal Bureau of Investigation, had a program to disrupt the party from 1961 to 1969.

title: Kent Jury Hears Wounded Student; 2 Others to Appear
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 10 (AP)One of nine students wounded in the 1970 Kent State University shootings appeared today before a Federal grand jury. Donald S. MacKenzie, who was wounded in the neck in the shooting that killed four other students, said he had appeared before the jurors, but he refused to say anything else. I don't want to talk about it, he said.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: JACK OF ARTS Jack Gilford, as theatergoers, moviegoers, television watchers and other patrons of the entertainment arts know, is a very funny, very talented man, and he has been that way just about as long as anyone can remember. How did it all come about? Well, that's what Mr. Gilford wants to talk to you about, at the first of a new monthly series of seminars called Personalities in the Performing Arts. The series, which is free, begins today at the School of Visual Arts, at 209 East 23d Street, between Second and Third Avenues, and the time is 12:40 P.M.

title: Waldheim Says the Chances Of Geneva Pact Are Good
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 10  Secretary General Waldheim declared today there was a good chance for agreement on the disengagement of Egyptian and Israeli forces in the next few weeks. But he cautioned against expecting early progress on a broad peace settlement.

title: Stronger Dollar
description: The United States dollar, less than a year ago an object of derision among foreign central bankers, speculators and even hotel desk clerks, has regained much its strength in world money markets.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: JAPAN WILL INVEST IN IRANIAN REFINERY
description: TEHRAN, Iran, Jan. 10 (AP) Japan is to invest in a 500,000barreladay Iranian oil refinery, it was announced here today.

title: Bulls Inflict 116104 Loss On Hawks
Dick Williams Takes an Interim Job in Business
description: Dick Williams, the phantom manager of the New York Yankees, retreated from baseball's legal wars yesterday and took a temporaiy job as an assistant to John D. MacArthur, the wealthy Florida businessman and developer.

title: Nixon Expected to Suspend Quotas on Imports of Wheat
description: WASHINGTON, Jan 10 (UPI)  President Nixon soon will suspend wheat import quotas as a hedge against possible domestic shortages, an administration source said today.

title: 5 Dead After Shootings in Delaware
description: DOVER, Del., Jan. 10 (UPI)A man free on bail on two felony charges shot and killed's three persons today, wounded three others including a tvoman hostage, and then apparently killed himself and his after his car crashed as he fled from the police, the Delaware, State Police said.

title: Encyclopaedia Britannica Plans 1st Major Change in 200 Years
description: The Encyclopaedia Britannica is abandoning its current design and coming out in a radically new formits first major innovation in more than 200 years of publication.

title: Books of The Times
description: LAST RIGHTS. A Case for the Goad Death. By Marya Mannes. 150 pages. Illustrated. Morrow. $5.95.

title: Auctioneer's Business Associate Accused of Fatally Shooting Him
description: CAMDEN, Jan. 10Joseph A., Kaplan, a 26yearold Israeli citizen, was arrested on murder charges this morning in the fafal shooting last week of Maurice Salvia, an Atlantic City. Boardwalk auctioneer for whom he worked as chauffeur.

title: Many Blacks Say Beame Uses a Double Standard
description: Responding angrily to Mayor Beame's sudden postponement of the appointment of State Senator Joseph L. Galiber to the last remaining Deputy Mayor's slot, a group of 14 black ministers yesterday sent a telegram to the Mayor charging racism which imputes misbehavior towards black leaders even when there is no basis for the charge.

title: CANADIAN COUNCIL CALLED C.I.A. LINK
description: TORONTO, Jan. 10 (Canadian Press)  The Canadian BroadI casting Corporation said last, night that a branch of Canada's National Research Council in Ottawa was really an intelli1 gence agency working closely with the Central Intelligence Agency of the United States.

title: AUGUST SCHENCK
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Jan. 10 August H. Schenck, a former member of the New York Stock Exchange and a partner in Mitchell, Hutchins & Co., Inc., in New York, died at his home here yesterday. He was 78 years old.

title: No Winter Coddling for Codders
description: BALDWIN, L. I.  Tony Froitzheim leads a double life.

title: Stock Clearing Refund Set
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that a refund of $1million in surplus 1973 fees would be paid to users of the Stock Clearing Corporation, a wholly Dwned subsidiary of the exchange. Refunds to the 274 brokerage and bank participants will be based on fees :hey paid last year.

title: GOVERNMENT DRAFTS MEDICAL COST PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10 (AP) The Department of Education and Welfare has proposed new rules to control the costs and quality of hospital and nursinghome care for elderly and poor people whose medical bills are paid by the Government.

title: John Birch Official Seeks To Oppose Gravel in Alaska
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, Jan. 10 (UPI)State Senator C. R. Lewis of Anchorage, a national officer in the John Birch Society, announced yesterday his candidacy for the Republican nomination to the United States Senate.

title: Data on Oil Supplies Are Given by Texaco
description: Texaco, Inc., became the first company yesterday to respond to the increasing criticism of the secrecy of oil companies on their supply and statistics. The company made public statistics on its estimated supplies of crude oil and petroleum products in the United States in order to help the public understand the significance of these inventory levels during the current energy shortages.

title: For Chapin, the Opera Must Go On
description: This season, for the first time in its history, the Metropolitan Opera has had an official music director working in tandem with the general manager. But Schuyler G. Chapin, the manager, said yesterday in an interview in his office, I must always take the final responsibility. And that is why there will be a performance tonight of Tristan and Isolde, despite initial advice to the contrary by the music director, Rafael Kubelik.

title: SAXBE COULD PICK NIXON DEFENDER
description: The Washington Star News

title: Esposito Lifts Bruins To 22 Tie
Florida Boating: Business, Pleasure as Usual
description: MIAMI  Motorists lined up for their wee bit of gas must be wondering why they are not out in a boat somewhere between Miami and West Palm Beach, the busiest powerboat region on the East Coast at this time of year. Small, medium and large boats powered by gasoline or diesel fuel are creating wakes up and down the Intracoastal Waterway and moving on out into the Atlantic through Port Everglades, Bakers Haulover Cut and others of the many neighboring openings to the sea.

title: Manhattan Courthouse a Sordid Setting for Justice
description: Enter the lobby at 100 Centre Street. A halfdozen vagrants who have spent the night in the building wander up and back, up and back. A spacedout addict dances by, bumping into people.

title: NIXON IMPOUNDS POLLUTION FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10President Nixon has ordered the impoundment of $3billion authorized by Congress to help communities build waste treat, ment plants in the coming fiscal year.

title: Encyclopaedia Britannica Plans 1st Major Change in 200 Years
description: The Encyclopaedia Britannica is abandoning its current design and cooling out in a radically new fornits first major innovation in more than 200 years of publication.

title: Decade's Warnings Fail to Cut Smoking
description: Ten years ago today, the Surgeon General of the Public Health Service issued a momentous report citing cigarette smoking as a major hazard to life and health. Yet, on the anniversary of that historic, 387page document, cigarette sales are at a record high, per capita consumption is increasing and 3,000 teenagers are becoming new smokers each day.

title: Nassau Prosecutor Investigated by U.S.
description: The Nassau County District Attorney's office is under Federal investigation for possible grandjury tampering in a case involving Republican politicians, sources close to the investigation disclosed yesterday.

title: Richard Cleveland Dead at 76; Lawyer Was Son of President
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 10 (AP)Richard F. Clevand, the oldest son of President Grover Cleveland and a lawyer and civic leader, died at his home here today. He was 76 years old.

title: Unpolitical Politics In Illinois
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill.Gov. Dan Walker is a tall, ruggedlooking Democrat, a man not easily lost sight of in any crowd, and a controversial figure who got to the top in Illinois politics without the blessing of Chicago's Mayor Daley. Yet, when he began his State of the State address the other day, he was several paragraphs into it before all members of the General Assembly were willing to sit down, stop talking and make some show of listening.

title: NASSAU ENLARGES HOSPITAL BOARD
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 10The board of governors of the Nassau County Medical Center has been enlarged to include blacks and women, County Executive Ralph G. Caso said today.

title: Text of U.S. Invitation to Energy Talks
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Jan. 10 (UPI)Following is the text of a letter from President Nixon to the governments of Canada West Germany, France. Italy, Japan, the Netherlands, Norway and Britain, as made public today at the Western White House:

title: Kissinger Bids Countries Act in Unison on Energy
description: WASHINGTON, Friday, Jan. 11Secretary of State Kissinger yesterday urged all countriesproducers and consumers of oil aliketo work for longterm multinational agreement to solve the energy shortage, rather than seek shortterm advantages in countrybycountry deals,

title: About New York
description: It is axiomatic that if there is a way to beat the system, some New Yorkers will find it. Their newest hustle is to beat the Transit Authority on Sundays, when it offers roundtrip subway rides at half fare.

title: Notes on People
description: Senator John C. Stennis of Mississippi, who was critically wounded during a robbery outside his Washington home almost a year ago, said yesterday that his health is good with no complications and that he definitely would be a candidate for reelection in 1976.

title: BID TO EHRLICHMAN BY JAWORSKI CITED
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 10 (AP)  John D. Ehrlichman, the former adviser to President Nixon, was offered a deal by the special Watergate prosecutor, Leon Jaworski, in return for his cooperation in Watergaterelated prosecutions, The Los Angeles Times reported in its Friday editions.

title: OffOff Broadway
description: It is advisable to telephone theaters for schedules and prices before going to the show. Most, if not all, theaters accept Theater Development Fund vouchers.

title: NIXON IMPOUNDS POLLUTION FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10 President Nixon has ordered the impoundment of $3billion authorized by Congress to help communities build waste treatment plants in the coming fiscal year.

title: Briefs on Energy
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation assertedthat the Federal Trade Commission would impinge..on. the oil industry's right of free speech if it began challenging the veracity of its imagebuilding advertisements, as six Democratic Representatives have urged. In asking the F.T.C. to include institutional ads in its program requiring proof for advertised claims of products, the Congressmen accused Mobil and other oil companies of using potentially false and deceptive messages to ease public concern over the energy;Orisis, In response, Mobil argued that control over the right of companies to express their views on public issues is totalitarian.

title: EGYPT IS BALKING PATROLS, EN. SAYS
description: CAIRO, Jan. 10The United Nations today reported restrainti tin the movement of its patrols to oversee the ceasefire between the Egyptians and Israelis, and said that tension at the city of Suez again has heightened because of an advance of Egyptian troops to a new position.

title: MRS. CARRIE BALABAN
description: Mrs. Carrie Strump Balaban, widow of A. J. Balaban, who operated a movietheater chain and had been executive director of the Roxy Theater, died yesterday at her home, 100 West 57th Street. Her age was 85.

title: EGYPT IS BALKING PATROLS, U.N. SAYS
description: CAIRO, Jan. 10The United Nations today reported restraints on the movement of its patrols to oversee the ceasefire between the Egyptians and Israelis, and said that tension at the city of Suez again has heightened because of an advance of Egyptian troops to new position.

title: Why Don't You Ever Go to Rockland, They Asked
description: The restaurants reviewed here each Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the author's subjective judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: JOINT PLAN IS SET IN NUCLEAR POWER
description: The American Electric Power System and the General Atomic Company announced yesterday a joint program to develop a series of 1.5millionkilowatt standardized nuclear power plans. The plants would be of the hightemperature, gascooled reactor type in contrast to the lightwater reactors now generally in use. They would also have the largest capacity of any units yet ordered.

title: IRAN DUE TO BUY 30 JET FIGHTERS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10Iran has reportedly accepted a United States offer to sell 30 Grumman F14A fighters at a total cost of $900million, including spare parts.

title: Super Scalpers Strike Houston
description: HOUSTON,. Jan. 10If you need two Super Bowl tickets, can afford to pay $150 and love dogs, Jack Farr is your man of the hour.

title: A TOMBS INMATE, 22, FOUND DEAD IN CELL
description: A 22yearold attemptedmurder suspect was found dead in his eighthfloor cell at the Manhattan House of Detention for Men; the Tombs, early yesterday, but authorities were unable to determine immediately the cause of his death.

title: Kissinger Reports Gains In Panama Canal Talks
Cancer No Threat to Crosby
description: BURLINGAME, Calif., Jan. 10 (AP)Physicians who tested tissue from the lung of Bing !Crosby, the singer, who has Ipneumonia, found no indication of cancer, they said. The 691 yearold entertainer entered !Peninsula Hospital here New Year's Eve for what was then! diagnosed as pleurisy. Since then, a lesion about two inch! es long and I inches wide on the upper part of his left lung and an abscess have been found. A medican spokesman said Mr. Crosby is confident, has a good appetite and is optimistic.

title: Greece Disqualifies 34 Bishops From Voting for a New Primate
description: ATHENS, Jan. 10The Greek Government invited the Orthodox Church's Assembly of Bishops today to vote for new primate Saturday but disqualified 34 of the 66 prelates from participating.

title: Katharine Cornell Stars In the Role of Raconteur
description: At a small, fireside ceremony attended only by a few close friends, Katharine Cornell was awarded the American National Theater and Academy (ANTA) National Artists Award yester, day evening for her incomparable acting ability and her theatrical genius and for having elevated the theater throughout the world.

title: New Foe for Antuofermo
description: Chu Chu Garcia of McAllen, Tex., was named yesterday to meet Vito Antuofermo, an Italian now living in Brooklyn, in a 10round middleweight fight scheduled for the Madison Square Garden Felt Forum on Monday night. Garcia replaces Jose Rodriguez, who suffered asthma in San Juan, P. R., while preparing for the bout.

title: PATERSON BATTLE ON MEASLES LAGS
description: PATERSON, Jan. 10Despite two days of free immunizations and widespread publicity, this city still has a serious outbreak Of measles cases. And in Newark, health authorities report sharp upsurge in measles since Dec. 1.

title: Dyce in Garden Meet
description: Byron Dyce, a middle distance runner and twotime Olympian for Jamaica, yesterday entered the United States Olympic invitational track and field meet at Madison Square Garden on Feb. 8. Dyce has entered, the 800 and 1,000 meter races, but will run in only one.

title: 67 Years After Discharge, Black Soldier Is Honored
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 10Dorsie W. Willis, an 87yearold retired shoeshine boy who was dishonorably discharged from the United States Army by President Theodore Roosevelt, received a taxfree Government check today for $25,000 as a sort of payment for services not rendered.

title: STREET CRIME UP IN CHINESE CITIES
description: PEKING, Jan. 10  Street crime has increased in Peking and some other Chinese cities to the point where neighborhoods are being patrolled day and night by militia units.

title: But Cars Slump Sharply
Police Tell of Bloodstains Found in the Carpi House
description: TRENTON, Jan. 10  Authorities testified today that they had found the Princeton home of Laura Carpi neat and clean when they arrived the night after she disappeared, but that the diningroom rug was missing and a closer inspection the following day revealed four tiny stains on the oak floor of the room.

title: BROOKS PALMER, CLOCK COLLECTOR
description: Brooks Palmer, a leading authority on American clocks, who wrote copiously and lectured widely on his hobby, died Wednesday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Walton Is Doubtful For Next 2 Games
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 10 (AP)The University of California, Los Angeles star center, Bill Walton, who injured his back last Monday night, probably won't play when the Bruins put their 85game winning streak on the line tomorrow night against California and Saturday against Stanford, Coach John Wooden said today.

title: Billion in Loan Guarantees Set in Proposed Bill on Rail Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 10The Department of Transportation officially disclosed today a proposed bill that would guarantee $2billion in loans to the nation's troubled railroads to stimulate investment to modernize plant and equipment.

title: BEAR POSTPONES NAMING CALIBER PENDING INQUIRY
description: Mayor Beame dramatically and abruptly postponed his third effort to appoint the city's first black Deputy Mayor yesterday after being informed that his designee, Joseph L. Galiber, was under challenge for possible improprieties in his handling of campaign contributions.

title: S.E.C. Issues Proposals For Annual Report Data
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10 (Reuters)The Securities and Exchange Commission issued today proposed amendments to its regulations that would require additional information to be included in corporate annual reports.

title: Seat Belt Bill Rejected
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 10 (UPI)The California Assembly rejected today a bill requiring California motorists to buckle their seat belts or face a $25 fine.

title: Warfield Pulls Leg Muscle at Practice; May Be Sidelined for Super Bowl Game
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 10Paul Warfield was listed today as a doubtful performer in Sunday's Super Bowl game here. Since Warfield, probably pro football's most effective pass receiver, is the leading singleplay offensive threat of the Miami Dolphins, the responses to his possible absence were many.

title: REAGAN PROPOSES A RECORD BUDGET
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 10 (UPI)  Gov. Ronald Reagan proposed today a record $9.81billion state budget that envisions a $272million surplus as a possible cushion against the energy crunch.

title: Proposed OilStorage Site Argued in Weehawken
description: WEEHAWKEN, N. J., Jan. 10 Additional pollution of the Hudson River, possible air pollution and heavy truck traffic all came in for discussion tonight as the New Jersey Stafe Environmental Protection Agency opened public hearings into the proposed construction of a new heatingoil storage depot on the waterfront. here.

title: Fuel Allocation System Scored By Its Director in Pennsylvania
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 10Fuel dealers in Pennsylvania have plenty of supplies but are refusing to deliver heating oil to new customers until they get a special allotment for each case from the Federalstate allocation system, the state allocation officer, William H. Wilcox, said today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Fire Breaks Out Atop Carnegie Hall

title: THREE MEN KIDNAP AND RAPE COED, 19
description: A 19yearold upstate college coed on her first visit to the city was kidnapped from a Queens street corner Wednesday night by three men who reIpeatedly raped her as they drove about for more than five hours, the police said yesterday.

title: Legal Betting on Sports Foreseen by 75
description: Legal gambling on football, baseball and other sports events could begin in New York as early as next year if the Legislature and public approve, two of the state's foremost wagering officials said yesterday.

title: Behind the Bravado, Deep British Doubt
description: LONDON, Jan. 10  In the West Country town of Hereford the president of women's club told a yearend meeting that the January bingo game would be canceled to save electricity. Then she proposed a New Year's resolution.

title: SIMON WILL AUDIT PRICE AND SUPPLY OF ALL REFINERS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10 William E. Simon, the Federal energy chief, said today that investigators from his Federal Energy Office and the Internal Revenue Service would audit the price, profit and supply, records of every petroleum refinery in the nation.

title: WHEELING RAISING TINMILL PRICES
description: The WheelingPittsburgh Steel Corporation said yesterday that it planned to raise prices on tinmill products about 8 per cent, effective Feb. 16. The planned increases are similar to ones announced earlier this week by the Unite States Steel Cord poration and the Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation.

title: ShortTerm Rates Off
description: Banking and credit statistics released by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York yesterday seemed to indicate a continuing trend toward making it easier to borrow money.

title: Fuel Oil Shortage Held NearCritical In the Bistate Area
description: New York and New Jersey were reported yesterday to be (facing an immediate shortage bordering on the critical of 200,000 barrels of heavy fuel oil a day out of the 600,000 to 700,000 needed daily for utilities to generate electricity, and for schools, hospitals and large apartment houses to heat buildings.

title: GOVERNOR ORDERS SPECIAL ELECTIONS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 10Governor Wilson today announced that he had ordered special elections to be held on Thursday, Feb. 14, to fill three vacancies in the Assembly, one of which is in Queens, and an election to fill the Senate seat vacated by Nicholas Ferraro, a Democrat, who was elected District Attorney in Queens.

title: REV. J. PIUS BARBOUR
description: CHESTER, Pa., Jan. 10The Rev. Dr..1, Pius Barbour, pastor of the Calvary Baptist Church here, died of gastroenteritis following a cerebral hemhorrage at Lankenau Hospital in Philadelphia on Saturday. He was 179 years old.

title: Griffith Signs to Fight
description: BOSTON, Jan. 10 (AP)Sam Silverman, a boxing promoter, signed Emile Griffith of New York, a fivetime world champion, for a 12round bout with Tony Licata of New Orleans at Boston Garden. Silverman is billing the Feb..5 bout as a battle for the United States middleweight championship. Griffith, 35 years old held the welterweight title, twice and the middleweight crown three times.

title: LIBERTIES UNION TO BACK DURYEA
description: ALBANY, Jan. 10The New York Civil Liberties Union intends to enter the election conspiracy case of Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea and argue that the charges against him should be dismissed because they are unconstitutional.

title: PROFIT REPORTS AT BANKS MIXED
What We Have Here Is a Prosperity Psychosis
description: PRINCETONEveryone talks endlessly about the energy crisis. The magazines are filled with prescriptions for the simple life. From many quarters come the urgings: get over the insistence on college and graduate school or if you must seek an A.B. or Ph.D. don't use it to race for money and status but relax into an accumulation of happiness.

title: Gov. Noel Asks NoFault
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Jan. 10; (AP)Gov. Philip Noel askedi Rhode Island's General Assernbly today to enact a nofault .automobile insurance bill that is virtually identical to one it

title: I.R.S. TAX VIEW CITED BY BRUNSWICK CORP.
description: The Brunswick Corporation said yesterday that an admission by the Internal Revenue Service to the United States Tax Court that Brunswick's tax liability for the years 1962 through 1969 was $22million less than the Government claimed confirmed the company's position that the I.R.S. had made inconsistent determinations for later years.

title: Film: LatinAmerican Documentaries
description: How do you cope with the .fact that profound social change  whether it's pro gressive or reactionary  is often accompanied by violence? And can you untangle the concepts of necessary and negative violence, or determine the moment when resistance becomes aggression! Before having to answer in 25 words or less, students of these subjects should see and ponder When the People Awake and Tupamaros! at the First Avenue Screening Room today and tomorrow.

title: COPPER FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISE
description: Copper futures showed some strong price rises yesterday at a session during which traders learned that the Government would soon sell copper from its stockpile of about 251,000 tons.

title: Doll Resigns Post As Packers Aide
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., Jan. 10 (AP)Don Doll, Green Bay Packers defensive backfield coach who helped mold one of the National Football League's stingiest pass defenses in 1972, resigned for personal reasons.

title: Soviet Citizens Assailing Solzhenitsyn and Sakharov
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 10A manila folder stuffed with letters sat in the middle of Yuri Zhukov's deskopinions offered by the Soviet silent majority that dealt far more harshly with the atomic physicist Andrei D. Sakharov and the writer Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn than the official Soviet line has thus far.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. AIDE IS LEAVING CHINA AFTER CRASH
description: PEKING, Jan. 10 (Reuters)A member of the United States liaison.office here is leaving because of a car accident in November in which a young Chinese cyclist was fatally. injured.

title: SCHOOLS ADVISED ON OPENING TIME
description: The more than 600 school districts throughout New Jersey were advised yesterday that they had the power to begin classes later in the day so that pupils would not have to start to school in the dark.

title: '61 PRESSURE TO KILL CASTRO IS REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10President Kennedy told a reporter in a private conversation in November, 1961, that he was under great pressure from intelligence advisers to order the assassination of Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba, according to an article in the February issue of Esquire magazine.

title: SKYLAB 3 IS CLEARED FOR A RECORD FLIGHT
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 10 (AP)The Skylab 3 crew was given the goahead today to continue in earth orbit on what will become man's longest space flight.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Jan. 10Depth has definitely been the reason, was Pete Calabrese's answer to the success Bloomfield's basketball team this season, which has won nine of 11 games thus far. Prior to this year we used to have eight fit guys on the team, Calabrese today told the New Jersey basketball writers, who honored him as the state's player of the week in the college division.

title: A Soliloquy
description: To impeach, or not to impeach: that is the question. Whether tis better for the Party to suffer The slings and arrows of outrageous Nixon, Or now to drown him in his sea of troubles, And by voting, end him. Impeach; convict; No more; and by convicting say we ended Watergate, restored the public trust, Upheld the Constitution, purified Our politics, and got Sam Ervin off Of Television. Tis a consummation Devoutly to be wished. Impeach. Convict. Convict: perchance acquit! Ay, there's the rub: For in that long and bitter process Of impeachment, what evils may befall us While we are shuffling off his White House coil Must give us pause: To deepen those divisions Now dividing us the more, to down Dow Jones to Davy's locker deeper, drive Bankrupted brokers to despair ful leaps From Wall Street's darkened windows, stoke the fires Of wild inflation, court depression, And he left ourselves to ration gasoline! impeach: Whilst wav'ring allies, heeding not Th unmastered Henry, yield to Cairo's will And Moscow slyly strokes the Arab hand That holds the hung of Sheikdom's oily drums, And whispers in the vengeful Moslem ear, The plotted Diaspora of the Jews. Impeach:To strike the sword from his commandThat U.S. sword he only holds to guard Our skies and shores from Russian infestationAnd in this hour of the sheathed sword And unhailed Chief, to court atomic doom! For who would bear the whips and scorns of Nixon's Insolence ,in office, his oppressive vetoes, His scrambled tapes, his plumbers, his Bed, His vaunted innocence, the law's delay, The exile of the Court of Camelot And noble Galbraith, Reston, Schlesinger, The pangs of unrequited Liberalism, The longdrawn martyrdom of Alger Hiss, When we ourselves might Dick's quietus make With bold impeachment? Ay, what Party. With e'en a tarnished Kennedy in hand Would grunt and sweat out three more years of Dick But that the dread of pitfalls on the road To his conviction puzzles still the will, And makes us rather bear the ills we have Than fly to others that we knOw not of? Thus conscience doth make cowards of us all, And thus our native hue of partisanship, Is sicklied o'er by the pale cast of patriotism. And politics of great pitch and moment, With these regards their currents turn awry, And lose the name of action. Soft you now! The fair Kay Graham! Nymph, in the columns, please Be all our fears remembered.

title: Stolen Weather Vane Found at Faneuil Hall
description: BOSTON, Jan. 10 (UPI)A 225yearold copper weather vane stolen last week from the roof of Faneuil Hall was recovered tonight from a hiding place in the Revolutionary War meeting place.

title: Narragansett Racing Off
description: PAWTUCKET, R. I., Jan. 10 (UPI)  Racing cards at Narragansett Park for today and tomorrow were canceled today because of poor track conditions and a threat of more snow.

title: Gibson Plans to Run Alone And Avoid the Racial Issue
... and in Albany
description: Unfortunately, it is less clear that the lessons of Watergate have sunk in with members of the State Legislature in Albany. The effusive hero's welcome which lawmakers of both major parties accorded to Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea at their opening session this week suggests a flippant attitude toward the formal charges Election Law violations a grand jury has made against him and his key aides.

title: Wilson Is Disappointed' Addicts Don't Seek Help
description: Governor Wilson said yesterday that he was disappointed that more drug addicts had not applied for treatment in the wake of the state's stringent antidrug laws, which took effect last Sept. I.

title: Feeler From Castro?
description: Remarks by Cuba's Ambassador to Mexico about the possibility of resuming contacts with the United States are of more than passing, interest, especially since for once the State Department did not dismiss the comments, out of hand but promised to weigh everything.

title: TIME INC. IS NAMED IN CLASSACTION SUIT
description: The Independent Investor Protective League filed a classaction antitrust suit yesterday against Time Inc. asking damages of $1.37billion.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: Frederick M. Bohen, 36 years old, of Princeton, who lost to Representative Peter H. B. Frelinghuysen in the 1972 Congressional election, announced he would seek the nomination in the Democratic primary to run for Mr. Frelinghuysen's Fifth District seat.

title: Revlon, Inc., Signs Agreement to Acquire Calbiochem Concern
description: Revlon, Inc., announced yesterday it had signed an agreement in principle to acquire Calbiochem, a manufacturer and supplier of diagnostic reagents, biochemicals and pharmaceuticals. The price to Revlon would be about $23million, based on a valuation of Calbiochem stock of $20 a share for an assumed number of Calbiochem shares to be outstanding on the consummation date. The deal would be made after the exercise of certain existing options and all existing warrants and the conversion of all convertible notes.

title: GEORGE R. WADLEIGH
description: HASTINGS  ON  HUDSON, N. Y., Jan. 10George R. Wadleigh, who retired 28 years ago as managing director of the West Virginia Pulp and Paper Company, died Tuesday at Dobbs Ferry Hospital. He was 98 years old and lived here.

title: Bridge: Goren International to Hold Classes at the Cavendish Club
description: Hundreds of, enthusiasts who try to improve their game by taking lessons felt a sense of personal deprivation recently when the country's No. 1 bridge teacher, Bill Root, moved to Florida.

title: Wilson Asks Small Deficiency Budget
description: ALBANY, Jan. 10Governor Wilson submitted to the Legislature today a deficiency budget in which he requested $26.6million in spending authorizations, the lowest such request since 1965, to meet expenses not anticipated when the 197374 budget was approved last April.

title: Eximbank Backs Egypt Pipeline Loan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10The ExportImport Bank approved today, as expected, a combined loan and financial guarantee of $100million to finance United States equipment and services for building an oil pipeline in Egypt running from the Gulf of Suez to a terminal west of Alexandria.

title: Death Toll in Plane Crash In Colombia Is Put at 40
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Jan 10 (AP)  Forty persons were killed last night when a twoengine turboprop plane of national military airline crashed in flames on the Andean foothills in southern Colombia.

title: In Spain, No Justice For Labor
description: MADRIDNo one doubted the outcome of the trial of the Carabanchel Ten, who have been sentenced to twelve to twenty years in prison., for their labor activitiesattempts to organize workers to improve wages and working conditions, conduct that is protected by civilized governments.

title: Health Department Warns Of Violations in 4 Schools
description: The Health Department is conducting a major campaign against health violations in the city's schools, and has summoned the principals of three elementary schools and one junior high school to hearings on unsafe and hazardous conditions in their buildings.

title: Police Say Bloodstains Were in the Carpi Home
description: TRENTON, Jan. 10  Authorities testified today that they had found the Princeton home of Laura Carpi neat and clean when they arrived the night after she disappeared, but that the diningroom rug was missing and a closer inspection the following day revealed four tiny stains on the oak floor of the room.

title: Wednesday's Fight
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev.Johnny Watson, 122 pounds, Los Angeles, outpointed Felix Jiminez, 1231/4, Mexico, 10 rounds.

title: C.I.A. HEAD LOSES APPEAL TO JUDGE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10A Federal district judge has turned down the request of the Director of Central Intelligence for a chance to testify about hook that the agency is trying to censor. He also upheld ruling that he had made earlier ordering the agency to turn over certain documents to the book's authors and publisher and their expert witnesses.

title: ALLEN JONES COOK
description: KENTON, Del., Jan. 9The State minority leader, Allen Jones Cook, died today at the Wilmington General Division.

title: CAMBODIAN PLANES POUND AT BUNKERS
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Jan. 10 (AP)The Cambodian Air Force, in a daylong battle, struck repeatedly today against rebel positions west and north of Phnom Penh, reportedly with napalm.

title: STEEL UNION ASKS WAGE GUARANTEE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10The United Steelworkers of America will demand a guarantee in its next contract with the industry against loss of income to employes because of the fuel shortage, I. W. Abel, president of the union, said today.

title: Nixon's Call for. OilConsumers Parley Evokes a Generally Positive Response
description: PARIS; Jan. 10  President Nixon's invitation to major consumer nations to coordinate policies at a Washington meeting on Feb. 11 has drawn a generally positive response although the Common Market countries:  including France. the least enthusiastic among them said they would have to discus the matter further.

title: Nassau D.A. Investigated For Possible Jury Fixing
description: The Nassau County District Attorney's office is under Federal investigation for possible grandjury tampering in a case involving Republican politicians, sources close to the investigation disclosed yesterday.

title: Sailor, Like Boxer, Must Train for the Big Day
description: The boat salespeople may be on the wrong track, selling the vistas of open'water, showing the photographs of tossed spray, purveying the image of great speed. I had known these since childhood, and a rented or borrowed boat can provide them in as good quality as an owned boat. But what the rented boat does not normally provide are the perverse pleasures of the offseason.

title: UNSOLVED KILLING WORRIES OAKLAND
description: OAKLAND, Jan. 10The fear that swept this city two months ago just after the ambush slaying of the superintendent of schools has virtually disappeared but in its place there are signs now of discontent over the failure of the police to solve the crime.

title: 700 Are Laid Off at Disney World Park
description: Walt Disney Productions has laid off 630 permanent employes in its Disney World park in Orlando, Fla., the company said yesterday. In addition about 70 parttime employes have been let go as well as 1,000 college students who worked the twoweek Christmas season.

title: People in Sports: Feb. 1 Is `Day for DeBusschere
description: The Detroit Pistons have designated Feb. 1 as Dave DeBusschere Day honoring the former Pistons playercoach and AllStar forward of the New York Knicks on his last appearance in the Motor City this season. They will donate a portion of the game's receipts for a scholarship fund at Detroit University in DeBusschere's name and urged other interestedparties to also contribute.

title: Millions in LoanSkarking Laid to 11 in, Garment Area
