description: To the Editor:

title: Marleigh Dover Is Fiancee of Zane Lang
description: Mrs. Eric M. Goldsmith of New York has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Marleigh Diane Dover, to Zane Alan Lang, son of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Lang of Winter Park, Fla.

title: Emergency Pesticide Role Voided by Appeals Court
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 12 (AP) An emergency safety stand and governing the use of pes. ticides in farm fields has been thrown out by the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit.

title: Three novels (one by an American) from England; Sweet Dreams; By Michael Frayn. 173 pp. New York: The Viking Press. $5.95.
description: Impossible not to overpaise Michael Frayn's latest novel, Sweet Dreams, I say to myselfand then ask myself, whatever do I mean? How could one overpraise so charming a book? It is lucid intelligent, delightful stylish, extremely funny, and I have no reservations about it at all I recommend it wholeheartedly.

title: COURT DISORDERS HELD OVERBLOWN
description: A comprehensive survey of trial judges, prosecutors and leaders of bar associations across the country indicates that the incidence of courtroom disruption is very, very small, that such disruption is not a growing problem and that lawyers participate infrequently in the small amount of disruption that was uncovered.

title: Miss Andrews To Be a Bride
description: DELMAR, N. Y., Jan. 12Mr. and Mrs. Norman B. Andrews have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carolyn Andrews, to John Matthew Pasanen, son of Mrs. Weikko Pasanen of Fitchberg, Mass., and ,the late Mr. Pasanen.

title: 2D GAMER AFFAIR IS UNDER SCRUTINY
description: A second fundraising event for State Senator Joseph L Galiber came under scrutiny yesterday with the disclosure that a filing deadline was apparently missed in accounting for the 34,200 proceeds of a cocktail party held at an East Side restaurant last month,

title: Home Improvement
description: SECURITY CONSCIOUS homeowners and apartment dwellers, as well as owners of boats, motor homes and vacation cottages, can now buy a very simply installed alarm unit that will sound a piercing air horn blast when a window or door On which It is installed is opened. Activated by an aerosol can which will last alMost indefinitely if not used, the alarm has no batteries so there is no fear of It running down when needed.

title: OffDuty Policeman Is Accused Of Killing Fellow Officer on S.I.
description: An offduty police officer was shot and killed early yesterday in his Great Kills, S. I., home by a fellow officer after both had spent the night drink. ing, the police reported.

title: Warriors Lose to Knicks
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 12 The New York Knicks pulled away from the Golden State Watriors in the second half tonight and presented Coach Red Holzthan with his 327th regular  season Knick victory, a club record. The final score was 9680 as both teams wound up their preAllStar break activities.

title: Ideas &Trends Education, Marine Life, Law, Medicine;Smoking: After All the Warnings, Not Much Change
description: Ten years after the Surgeon General warned that cigarettes are a hazard to life and health, cigarette sales are at an alltime high, per capita consumption is going up and 3,000 teenagers are becoming new smokers every day. Despite the repeated health warnings and growing social pressures against smoking, millions of Americans still finVigarettes irresistible.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 12 (AP)Dan Lasater's Hey Rube rallied in the final 20 yards for a halflength victory over his entrymate, Prince of Truth, today in the $28,135 Germantown Handicap marred by the fall of High Sir at Liberty Bell.

title: KISSINGER PUSHES TALKS IN ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM, Sunday, Jan. 13  Secretary of State Kissinger flew here from Egypt last night and set in motion talks aimed at producing concrete proposal for the separation of Israeli and Egyptian forces near the Suez Canal.

title: Gold Stocks Rise to Respectability
Child to Jeffrey Golds
description: WEST PATERSON, N. J. Jan. 12  A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Jeffrey Gold on Jan. 5 at St. Barnabas Medical Center in Living. ston. The child has been named Pamela Rachel.

title: Numismatics
description: IF anyone is still wondering whether there really is widespread, serious interest in the Bicentennial of the American Revolution, the response to the recently ended Bicentennial coinage design contest should dispel all doubts. According to a Treasury Department spokesman, more than 15,000 inquiries about the contest were received by late December; they came from every state in the Union and even from several foreign countries.

title: Aussies Cup Challenger a Radically New 12Meter
description: Australia's bid for the historic America's Cup off Newport, R. L, next summer will be more than a yachting challenge.

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: ***La Couronne, 10 Riverside Road, Lyndhurst (201) 9399820.

title: West German Court Asserts That a Maoist Political Organization Is Legal
description: BONN, Jan. 12  A West German constitutional court has declared that a Maoist organization whose leadership has been under vigorous investigation by the police since last spring is a legitimate political party.

title: Dave Anderson
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 12Surrounded by a red curtain, a dozen prize beef cattle were standing in straw, their rumps resembling an offensive line poised for a play. On the sawdust floor of the Astrodome, 25 bartenders were pouring drinks. Smoke drifted from two fires where a dressed beef and a whole pig were being barbecued. At the buffet tables, beef, pork, baked beans and Mexican delicacies were available. Soothing the heart, as well as the heartburn, was the voice of Charlie Pride, the country singer. Just a little Texas hoedown, as the invitation read, tossed by Pete Rozelle and his bride, Carolyn, as a prelude to tomorrow's Super Bowl game. Exactly 2,836 guests materialized for the National Football League's annual bash last night for its club executives, dignitaries, media and other assorted visitors to the first Super Bowl in the alleged great state of. Just about everybody showed except the competing players. Confined by their team curfews, they might as well have been in Huntsville State Prison up the road a piece.

title: Mississippi Threatens Flood For a 2d Consecutive Year
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 12  When the Mississippi decides to floodthere are some still alive who impute will and the power of decision to this rivar  does not rush down in quick violence, like the rivers of the Eastern mountains. It climbs out of its banks with slow certainly and then it appraoches and surrounds and covers everythign that is in, its way.

The ceremony was performed at the home of the bride in Forest Hills, Queens, by Judge Leonard L. Finz of the Queens County Civil Court. The couple's previous marriages ended in divorce.

title: Many Alpine Lakes Permit Sailboating Only
description: Pleasure boating in the Alpine countries of Switzerland and Austria is not expected to be adversely affected by the energy crisis. The reason for this is that governmental ??lations for years have curbed the use of power and motorboat use and encouraged sailboating. The fuel shortage, therefore, will have little or no effect on the sport as it has existed in these countries because it has been predominantly sailing.

title: Philadelphia Victor

Today, pantyhose is a tremendous business for us, says William S. Mitchell, president, who tells the story on himself.

The fourman American team ran out of cars following a series of accidents and the contest was called off after seven races, with the Australian team holding an unbeatable 2615 point lead.

description: LATHRUP VILLAGE, Mich.  Seriously, now, consider the pickle.

description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 12 (AP)The assistant dean of the Massachusetts Institute , of Technology's graduate school has been namd the institute's chancellor for minority affairs. He is Dr. Clarence G. Williams of Newton.

description: HARTFORD, Jan. 12 (UPI)New England's conservation efforts have accounted for a 12 per cent reduction in electricity consumption, according to Northeast Utilities.

description: MORZINE, France, Jan. 12 (AP)Switzerland's 22yearold Olympic silver medal winner, Roland Collombin, reasserted himself today as the world's top downhill skiar with a decisive victory in tie, downhill race of the World Cup ski meet.

title: Raritan Prides Itself on Hard Working Image
description: RARITANWorkmen are busy raising the track of the Central Railroad of New Jersey on First Avenue here so that traffic will not be held up by trains crossing the road. For Raritan this is the biggest thing to happen in years, because visitors using Route 202 will be able to make their way directly to Somerset Street, the shopping dis trict, without having to wait for clearance, or to wend their way through closely knit residential streets. The railroad's tracks are at street level through the center of this community of 7,000 people.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock market wallowed through rough weather last week and, in the process, produced a substantial decline. Prices were depressed by concern over a 1974 recession, large increases in energy costs and galloping inflation rates.

title: Here's What Makes the Ski Jumper Keep Jumping
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N.Y.This is the time of year when ski jumpers renew friendships with ski jumpers at this busy resort in the Palisades Interstate Park. It's a time of year when one ski jumper is apt et to ask another: What? Are you back again? To go schussing down the inrun of even this park's modest 50meter slope preparatory to launching one's self into space takes courage. But it also requires a certain amount of physical conditioning. It's obvious all ski jumpers are stout of heart. Whether they are in top condition often is questionable.

title: Navy Officer Quits Over Infringements On Oil Reserves
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (AP) A key administrator of naval oil reserves has resigned rather than accept further encroachment by oil companies upon Governmentowned oil fields, according to CongreSsional and Pentagon sources.

description: PERTH, Australia, Jan. 12 (UPI)Australia's challenge yacht for the 1974 America's Cup was today officially named the Southern Cross.

title: The Music World Is More Than 57th Street
description: MANY writers have pointed out recently that it is no longer feasible to see ourselvet simply as members of the JudeoChristian tradition. We are inhabitants of a planet, and we must try to sse the whole picture. Most of us  are quick to agree with this attitude in ecological and political discussions, but we remain quite provincial when it comes to more personal matters. For example, what kinds of music are we willing to listen to?

title: HELEN CLAIRE DIES; RADIO ACTRESS, 68
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Jan. 12 (AP)Helen Claire, a stage and radio actress, died today in Birmingham. She was 68 years old.

title: Recordings; Liszt? There Are Dozens of Him
description: WHEN people argue about Liszt's piano works they too often sound like the blindmen trying to describe the elephant. Each has hold of his own particular Lisztthere dozens of him to choose from  and the admirer of, say,, the Hungarian Rhapsodies may not be talking about the same composer who wrote the Sonata in B Minor or the Minks de Pelerinage. But they are, at base, the same man: The bombast and posturing that make some listeners recoil from the rhapsodies or the more florid transcriptions can often be detected deep in the bones of the genuinely poetic works, too.

title: News of the Stage
description: Emlyn Williams's prize winning play, The Corn Is Green, dealing with a Welsh youth who, through the sympathetic interest of one of his early teachers is enabled to obtain an education has been transformed into a musical called Miss Moffett for Broadway presentation in early spring.

title: The Met Was Glad To Get Her Back
description: ONCE in a while a singer at the Metropolitan Opera breaks out of the rut of small roles in which he or she is laboring, disappears for a while.and returns triumphantly as a major artist. Probably the most impressive example of this was. James McCracken, a tenor who could trumpet the few measures the Messenger has in Aida in such a fashion as to put the Radames to shame. Never allowed to tackle a leading part, he left the company in a huff, steady though his employment there was. He took his chances in Europe and in a few years made much acclaimed reentry at the Met in one of the ,great tenor roles, Otello.

title: The World In Summary

First, Prime Minister Heath said in an interview that he was willing to keep Britain on a threeday work week until spring rather than yield to the wage; demands of coal miners. Then, railroad engineers, already slowing down to support the miners, walked off the job for a day, stranding 241,000 Londonbound commuters and further adding to the nation's economic despair.

A sage thought that, even the jet age, for one of the big troubles with travel is that the traveler is always encountering tourist attractions that cry out to be climbed up upon, or down into, or clambered on or over through at the risk of life and limb, shortness of breath or, least, loss of dignity. title: Nothing Quiet on the Eastern Front

Back home, you will be in better form to be bowled over at Asia House, 112 East 64th Street, where The Colors of Ink, a selection of 47 Chinese paintings on loan from the Cleveland Museum of Art, pays tribute to a 20thcentury scholarconnoisseur, Sherman E. Lee, Cleveland's director, who assembled its oriental collection.

title: HONOLULU MAYOR BARS TWO PAPERS

Fasi, contending that Honolulu's newspapers have consistently treated him un fairly, waged open warfare with the two major dailies this week and they retaliated by obtaining a preliminary injunction in Federal District Court to assure that news conferences at Ctiy Hall would be open to the afternoon daily The StarBulletin and by filing suit against the mayor when he extended his ban to the morning Advertiser.

description: A son was born to Dr. and Mrs. Albert A. Abbey of West Orange, N. J., on Dec. 21 at St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston, N. J. Mrs. Ab. bey is the former Miss Joan Evelyn Stein,

title: The Glorious Misery of Fishing Through a Hole in the Ice
description: YOU don't really have to strike out for a faroff peak in the Himalayas, an atoll in the South Pacific, or even a cave in Kentucky in order to experience the peculiar pleasures of dropping out. Just pop inside a shack the size of a closet that's perched out on the thick ice of a New Hampshire lake, chisel a hole through the ice down into the frigid water below, drop in a line with bait or lure on it, light a little wood fire in a stove, pour yourself a snort from your favorite bottle, and sit back and relax. With a casual eye on the clouds in the blue sky that you can see through your little eightinchwide window being whaled along by the murderous winds up there, you soon realize that you have beaten them all: elements, jobs, people, all organized activities, most noises  even spouses, where indicated (or else spouse may join you in these delights). What you are doing is called ice fishing, but the ardor with which you tend your two linesthe legal limitis strictly your own business, so the marvelous sport can easily include, as well, card playing, guitar strumming, sleeping, cooking, portableTV watching or radio listening, love making, drinking, smoking, reading, even writing poetry or daydreaming, all inside your bob house, as such fishing huts are called in New England.

title: Chief Justice Burger Insists the Court Needs Help The 3rd Branch, Lately Active, May Have too Much Work to Do
description: Chief Justice Warren Burger has moved to renew discussion of a difficult and contentious topic: the burden of work on the Supreme Court. In a yearend review of judicial business, he has predicted that current trends would more than double the Court's present caseload in a decade.

title: 2 Catholic Homes Destroyed By Fire Bombs Near Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 12 (UPI)Fire bombs destroyed two homes owned by Raman Catholics in a Belfast suburb during the night in a new spate of street violence by Protestants, the police said today. Irish Republican Army bombers matched. the Protestant action by blowing up two shops in Newry and Dungannon, policemen added. The Catholic houses were set ablaze in suburban Glengortnley.

title: Performance, Comfort Rate Highest in Buying Sailboat
description: A sage once said that next to remaining afloat the most important quality in a vessel is not to capsize. A latterday aspiring sailor need not concern himself with either when searching for a sailboat capable of offshore trips. Boats of this type are selfrighting, and when prudently handled, the chances of getting holed or springing a leak in a modern hull are remote.

title: Unfair Game, or Shooting Down The Partridge Family
description: IHAD wanted, on the occasion of Super Sunday and a mere fortnight before TV's second season starts, to write a column about halftimes at football games. The Orange Bowl halftiMe especially appeals to those of us who were traumatized as little tykes by dwarfs and tattooed fat ladies. The people who stage the Orange Bowl halftime must gobble greenies with their Gatorade. This year it was Mickey Mouse impersonating the President of the United States; next year it will probably be Abe Lincoln singing Swanee on top of trundling papiermch tigercage, inside which three dispirited plumbers sit around waiting for a fourth for sex.

title: W. L. McNally Jr. Weds Miss Hauser

Editors are never sure what kind of critic to send to one of her performances.

title: Obedience to Authority An Experimental View. By Stanley Milgram. illustrated. 224 pp. New York: Harper &
description: Beginning in 1960, Stanley Milgram, who was then a member of the psychology department at Yale conducted a series of experiments on human beings which quickly became famous if not notorious and provided a variety of grounds for heated professional debate. Obedience to Authority is his considered account of that research. It is also a work that represents, in many important ways, current conditions in certain of the social sciences.

title: They Kill Animals And They Call It Art
description: I'VE just returned from The Holy Mountain. It was quite a trip. saw an old man pluck out his glass eye and hand it to a girl. watched three men impale themselves over and over on bayonets. I passed man whose face was covered with flies, and another whose body was covered with giant spiders. I met an armless psychopath, a quadruple amputee, a religious chimpanzee and a man whose excrement was turned into gold. I witnessed motherson incest, transvestism in the church, several dozen executions, and one public castration,

title: The West's High Oil Bill

description: An honest politician is one who, when he is bought, stays bought. About a century later the Speaker of the California Assembly, Jesse Unruh observed the relationship between money and politics in somewhat more philosophical terms. Money, he said, is the mother's milk of politics.

title: Television; Next Week, Of Course, It May Be Out to Be In; A guide to what it's acceptable to be caught watching if you're one of those people who never (well, hardly ever) watch TV.
description: NOT so long ago, in Certain Circles, If you admitted to watching televisionany televisionit would have been tantamount to a confession of fondness for Mantovani or for eating cardboard. But now, with the admission of bluecollar culture and the commonplace into these same Certain Circles, you not only may watch TV, you must (just as you must frequent McDonald's  cf., eating cardboard, above). These Circles have always been rather natrowly drawn, of course, so the TV shows you see have to be the Right Ones, or you may find yourself Outside the Circumferencea fate worse than depth.

title: Mrs. McDonald Recalls the Old Shows
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 12Mrs. John J. McDonald of Mill Neck, Li., sat outside the director's room at the American Horse Shows Association conventiontoday and her thoughts went back almost six decades. It was in 1917 and the first conventionthe association ever held, said Mrs. McDonald. The event was in New York and as I recall it drew a pretty good crowd. But even more than the business that went on I recall that for some reason there was a dog act involved. I guess it was to entertain the delegates.

title: Santiago Clamps Down On Its Remaining Press
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 12 Chile's military junta established prepublication censorship today over all newspapers and magazines here.No official reasons were given for the clampdown, but an authoritative source said that the aim was to prevent the spread of alarmist news during this delicate period.

title: Waiting for radical change
description: I am in favor of absolute freedom . . . free love and free lust, free land and free whiskey and free everything else, announced a certain J. L. Jones, on the Fourth of July 1900. He lived in a commune called Home, near Tacoma, whose creed was anarchism, the belief that men should live without rulers. In Europe, the anarchist impulsehas traditionally found its outlet in political agitation and even terrorism; but in America it has more often led to the founding of small colonies and sects that have tried to dissociate themselves from the existing body politic. Such colonies were most successful around the midnineteenth century; then the communal movement declined, , almost to the point of extinction, until its spectacular revival of the last few years.
